title: Now this is a dollhouse!
text: Forget the cheap pink plastic Barbie house! I'm so glad I bought this for my granddaughter! It is solid, well built and so gosh darn cute! Barbie and Monster High dolls fit! ( I was worried a bit, but not to worry, they fit just right!) Solid wood peices, even the walls! It goes together in about 2 hours. 28 steps to complete. Hardware isn't all mixed together in a plastic bag. Each different bolt or screw is in a hard plastic container that is labeled. Screws are color coded as well. Just need a phillips screwdriver to assemble. Instructions are thorough and Kidcraft even provides a hotline for help. The furniture is solid wood and cute! It was a bargain on Amazon, and if your prime, ships in 2 days free. When I was  a little girl, this is the dollhouse I always dreamed of. Granddaughter hasn't seen it yet, but I have no doubt she'll be thrilled! Huge, this is almost 5 foot high and 4 foot wide! Plenty of room for other kids to play! Sure is nice to recieve a high quality product that won't be trash in a week or two. I highly recommend!

title: My 3 1/2 yr old <3's It
text: We got this for our daughter's Christmas prsent in 2012.  She loves it, esp. the fact that her Disney Princess dolls fit in it so well.  It took us (me and my husband) about 4 1/2 hours to put it together.  I'd say it's "ok" as far as quality goes - BUT the garage doors still don't swing open right.  One is loose, the other drags.  We finally gave up trying to fix it.  :p  Best price BY FAR is on Amazon!  Esp. with the FREE shipping, this thing is a beast!

title: Awesome dollhouse, disappointed in damaged pieces
text:
This is a HUGE dollhouse. I knew it was big from the dimensions in the product description; however you don‚Äôt really realize how big it is until you see it in person! It seems to be made well with quality materials. It is pretty sturdy. I anticipate it holding up well for our three young girls.

My husband assembled this on his own. It took him about 4 hours! He was a little frustrated as he felt the instructions could have been a little more descriptive or included better pictures. Several times he found himself having to take something apart as he realized the pictures didn‚Äôt match up or similar things like that. Other than that it didn‚Äôt appear too difficult to set up. I would recommend assembling it in a large space. We were able to easily move it to another room once it was assembled.

My disappointment came about 3 hours into assembly. My husband was putting the doors on and realized that they had water damage on them. They were bubbles up and the paper/Design was lifting up on the edges. I immediately contacte amazon to see if we could just get replacement doors. I was told they unfortunately couldn‚Äôt do that. We would have to disassemble the entire thing and return for a refund or for a replacement. I was pretty disappointed in that since I wasn‚Äôt going to make my husband disassemble all that work and make him build it again when the new one arrived. Amazon did give me a small partial refund for the damaged item but I was still pretty bummed I couldn‚Äôt get new doors for it.

Overall we love the dollhouse and I‚Äôm pretty sure all 3 of our girls will love it too! Just be cautioned - it will take you HOURS to put together and you could possibly receive a damaged piece and not be able to get just a replacement pieces.

Husband said to pay attention to patterns on ‚Äúwallpaper‚Äù and flooring and bolts are colored to match up correctly.

Overall I'd say it is easy to put together, just time consuming. Doesn't matter though. The end product is really nice and my 5 yo daughter is going to LOVE her dollhouse from Santa. The accessories are perfect for Barbie-size (12") dolls and comes with furniture for a nursery which is great because she will be getting a Barbie Babysitting set also so she can use the baby stuff. Overall I am very pleased with this purchase and would buy again.

title: Beautiful but needs some improvement
text: This is a beautiful dollhouse that should last a long time. I love the size, the sturdiness, the creative touches. The reason I‚Äôm not giving it five stars is because the print on the particle board easily begins to peel off at the edges. This happened readily while I was constructing it. I‚Äôm concerned it will get worse quickly over time so I may look into some ways to secure the edges for longevity. Also, I‚Äôm attaching pictures of some furniture pieces that were sent to me, which are clearly not wood as pictured but are cheap plastic instead (bathtub, vanity, nightstand, and refrigerator door). I‚Äôm very disappointed about this, because everything should have arrived as pictured with no substitutions. The bathtub and nightstand don‚Äôt even look like the ones pictured. Also, the instructions NEED to be in color, which they‚Äôre not. It creates much confusion with the direction walls and floors should be facing as well as which color screws to use for the various steps. I found it best to zoom in on the Amazon pictures for guidance when I was unsure. Overall a nice purchase.

title: Love this house!
text:
We bought this second hand. The first family played with it for 5 years and it held up fabulously! We've had it for 3 months and couldn't be more pleased.

They weren't kidding when they called this a mansion! You definitely need a pick-up if you are buying this pre-assembled. It wouldn't fit in the back of my Outlander.

It's a great size for our 3 year old to grow into. She currently needs a step stool to get to the top level. I love all the details they put into it to look like s real home. I also enjoy the fact that this can be played with doll house people or Barbie size dolls. Very versatile that way! Not going to lie. When I set it up for my daughter, I played with it before she did. :)

The Kidkraft customer service is fabulous! It was originally missing the stairs. I was able to find the piece online and quickly order it. It came about 1 1/2 weeks later.

title: It's huge and so nice. The furniture is so solid and
text: Granddaughter loves this house.  She plays with it everyday.  It's huge and so nice. The furniture is so solid and beautiful

title: Very nice, large dollhouse
text: I was quite impressed with this dollhouse.  It was well made and game well packaged - no real damage to the parts/pieces (only just a little wear on some edges, very minor and not really noticeable).  Assembly wasn't too awful bad either.  Directions were pretty good (did reference some pics online early in the process to make sure I was correct).  Took me about 4 hours.  Only tricky part was sliding the back panels in an getting second side attached (needed a second set of hands).  The numerous accessories are well made and added to the overall end product.  I think our girls will be very happy and have years of fun with it.

title: Elsa has her Dream House
text:
Wow this comes in a very heavy box.

Assembly: Lots of pieces, instructions are pretty straight forward. But when you first lay out everything, it seems a bit daunting. But a little handy man knowledge will go a long way towards putting this kit together. There were times when you have to figure out how to get something together correctly. The instructions lost me a little in assembling the elevator, I put some of the panels backwards, and had to redo it. The garage door handles, some how I missed that step. All in all it took about 2 1/2 hours of steady work to get it all together. Sometimes a second set of hands is needed, especially in the beginning. I used a electric screw driver, this saves a lot of time for this project.

Final Product: Totally worth it, my 3 1/2 yo daughter loves it, was her favorite Christmas gift, she has to use a foot stool to reach the attic, it is very tall. The furniture details it comes with are nice. Her Barbie Fiat doesn't fit in the Garage, or at least you can't close the garage doors. It seems very sturdy for the money.

title: Cute but not the best quality as far sturdiness
text: This doll house was pretty easy to understand how to put it together and it‚Äôs super cute, however it‚Äôs not very sturdy and it has already broken in several areas after only two-three months and barely any playtime. My kids actually don‚Äôt play with it as much as I thought they would and I‚Äôm sad to say it‚Äôs feeling kindof like a waste of money.

title: Five Stars

title: Everything and more!!!
text: This dollhouse is beyond what any child could dream of. It is sturdy and well made. Putting it together was time consuming but very easy to follow and assemble. It's been over a year and it's still intact and survived a 3 hour move with no problems. I would recommend anyone who wants to blow their princesses mind to buy this product.

title: Barbie house
text:
Bought this for 5yo to play with.
First off, this doll house is HUGE. There are a lot of parts. But it took about 2 hours with just a screw driver and the provided Alan wrench to fully assembled.

Second, there was a few issues I encounteted.
Some of the pre-filled holes were not there when to screw on the back design for the rooms (babys room). There was also excess glue that prevented the walls from sitting right. I had to clean them out to install.(garage area)
I moved the house before the instructions indicated to. Which resulted in me breaking a part. So i would suggest you don't move it until you're told to in the instructions.

IMO, better material could be used. But when you take into the account the size this house is and the price. Then it's a good deal.

The furniture is amazing, and there's still lots of room to add more. Which wouldn't be the case if it was a smaller house. You can also use full sized barbies, the furniture fits them as well.

I have a younger child who tries to climb up this. Which would most certainly break the doll house. Something to take into consideration.
Note: This product does come with wall anchors.

All in all, good product at the price. Will get many years out of it if it's taken care of. I can see my children getting many years of use as long as they don't break it.

title: Happy Girls!

title: LOVE KIDKRAFT-GREAT DOLLHOUSE!!

title: Beautiful, strong, good value, but takes 6 hours to put together.
text:
This is a beautifuly made, very sturdy doll house that is extremely well worth the money. Great for dolls as well as Barbies. Stands solidly (I do not fear it tipping w out an enormous effort). Comes with all essential furniture - that matches the rooms and is also well made. I like it so much that I will be shopiing for more KidKraft products in the future.

Rooms are large and roomy so your child has room to put he hands in and play w her dolls and move everything around (complete opposite of Callico Critters doll houses).

You do need to be very reasonable with the amount of time it is going to take to get this finished. I custom design and build life size gingerbread houses (play houses that look like gingerbread) ... I know my way around tools and construction of this type.... the review that said it takes about 2 hours for 'prego mommy w husband deployed' to completely assemble this is out for her gourd. If I mainlined RedBulls and you offered me $1,000,000.00 to assemble this in 3 hours or less, it could NOT happen.

So, please, DO buy this product for it's very high quality and value. But DON"T think per the other reviews that it can be put together on Christmas Eve (we can attest to what a horrible plan that was)

title: Lots of Soul-Sucking Hours Spent Assembling a Product they could have ship at least partially built
text: I bought this product and it came in a large box - I assumed it would be at least partially assembled since the product description and details make NO mention of the needed assembly. title: Sturdy, pretty, and fun at an excellent value!
text:
To this day my husband and I marvel at how little this dollhouse cost in comparison to what you get. For the price, the house itself is a real bargain, but the fact that you get so many pieces of furniture and accessories is unbelievable, truly. One of the best values I have ever found when it comes to children's toys. We chose to wait until Christmas Day to put it together rather than try to do it Christmas Eve (thanks to some of the advice found here), and are glad we did so because it took a while. BE CAREFUL - this box comes unwrapped (no brown paper) and has a picture of the dollhouse and explicit descriptions of what is inside. I was grateful it was left outside the front door and my kids didn't see it ahead of time. Make sure you have a space to hide it though - we have a big house and had to think for a long time about where to keep it until Christmas - the box is big.

I'm a little confused by the age range - it states it is for ages 36 months - 7 years, but children will love playing with this LONG past 7 years old. It's clearly built for Barbies to fit, and Barbies are often enjoyed by kids up to 13 (my daughter doesn't play with Barbies, but does use it for stuffed animals). It puts the Barbie Dreamhouse to shame (something I ached for when I was about 9-10 years old).

Overall, I highly recommend this dollhouse - keep your eye on it and watch the price. At the time of this review, the price is about $150, but when we bought it - two weeks before Christmas, even - it was hovering right above $100. Even if we had paid $150 for it, I'd still think it's a steal.

title: My Girls love it. Building it was painful.
text:
The garage door knob didn't go in all the way. The screws were labelled, but the manual doesn't say when to use the different colored screws. Save the Amazon picture bc you're going to need to look at it to know which wall is on which side. The manual doesn't have pictures just labels! I started building at 10pm and finished at 3:30am. title: Great Doll house
text: Great Doll house, large size, love the fact that it comes with the furniture.  I build this dollhouse in about 3 hours with my daughters trying to play with it while I was building it. It was not difficult to follow the included the instructions.  I think that this is a great concept and a great house all together.  There are a lot of items to play with and this keeps my daughters busy for hours.  It does, however, have a few flaws.  The materials are cheap, the whole house is basically made out of thick cardboard and the edges are all fraying and peeling.  I would have rather paid $50 dollars more and got this house made out of thicker and better quality materials.  I had one level completely rip out while building it and I was following the directions.  I am pretty handy and was able to glue this level back in using Power Grab sealant.  There was no picture of the finished product anywhere in the box, this would have been handy as a reference point.  Overall it was easy to build and looks great now that it is complete, the quality of the parts is what took the star away for me, I'd give it a 3 to be honest but the sheer size and so many items included is what makes it a great product.  Another concern for me is that the house is top heavy, there is a kit to attach it to a wall, but I want the option to move this house around my house.  Time will tell how well it will hold up, overall a great product with some imperfections that need to be improved.

title: Great Buy

title: Great buy!!
text:

title: Love it
text: Ok, so this thing took about 3 hours of solo construction to be upstanding.  Move slow and discern the directions carefully, it'll go much faster.  One tip you don't realize until later in the construction (its not in the directions) is that some of the screws that show externally are actually colored to match the print on the house.  There is one vertically standing piece on the third floor that is not super secure, but other than that, this house is amazing. More detailed directions would be awesome and a different type of vertically standing piece would make it great.

title: Very large dollhouse
text: The amount of dollhouse for the amount paid was a great deal. This thing is a monster. I assembled this on my own and it took about 2-3 hrs with a short break in between. Instructions were a little confusing for direction of pieces and I accidentally put the garage floor in backwards so I didn‚Äôt end up assembling the garage doors- it wasn‚Äôt worth the hassle to correct. This is sized so that Barbies will fit. The furniture is a mix of wood furniture and plastic furniture- not really a fan of the plastic pieces. All furniture was already assembled except the bed needed screws and the piano had legs that push in. This was a good buy.

title: Five Stars

title: A lot of pieces came broken., so it's hard to put it together properly.
Don‚Äôt wait until the night before to put together
text:
Update! This thanksgiving, nearly a year of play later, my toddler informed me of a screw she found. When asked where she found it she showed me the garage area of her doll house. Sure enough, one of the screws had fallen out of the door hinge so I suggest you check every few months. Other than that her little house is still going strong.

Overall great product but I don‚Äôt know what I was thinking buying this for a three year old. She‚Äôs going to need a step stool to reach the top two floors. Mommy went overboard! As for the product itself, it‚Äôs huge and for the price a rather sturdy doll house. However, the wall and roof decals are fraying away from some of the edges right out of the box and a few pieces, a side wall of the garage structure and a few pieces of furniture, were also unglued but nothing a little gorilla glue couldn‚Äôt fix. Also, some pieces of furniture appear sloppily glued together. Another downfall was the sink was attached backwards so I‚Äôll have to rip the sink fixture off down the line and re-attach it but I doubt it‚Äôs anything my 3y/o will notice or care about. I suppose I just expect everything to be 100% when paying this price. Of course mommy and daddy cracked a few seems screwing things in so I‚Äôd suggest going lightly on the screws while putting everything together and, though painstakingly slow, don‚Äôt use power tools even if it gets things done quicker. Give yourselves 2hrs to put together and use everyone‚Äôs pics on the reviews to guide you because although the directions were somewhat clear, there are no clear pics to follow when dealing with decal sided walls and color coded screws. Your best guess will probably be the right one when it comes down to it. And a drink for mommy and daddy during the building process doesn‚Äôt hurt either. May have saved our marriage. You could always just play it safe and build it solo though lol. Good luck! I‚Äôm sure my little one will love it Christmas (tomorrow) morning. (Pics to follow soon)

title: Fabulous. Tedious to assemble, but not at all difficult. Just follow the directions.
text: This is an amazing doll house. It has everything. Although you need a rather large area for it, it is worth it. It is complete with any piece of furniture you might want including an iron and ironing board and a birthday cake for the table. There is also a pet cat. As far as putting it together, don't get in a hurry. It's not that it is particularly difficult, it just takes time. I am a 65 year old widow and had some college students over and put them to work. They worked for about an hour and got over half of it done. It took me an hour and a half to finish. I helped for me to have the picture on my laptop screen as the directions are in black and white with no markings and they are not in English. Screws are clearly marked, even color coded. It just has a lot of pieces that need to be securely put together. I did great until I tried to attach the garage and sun room to the main part. I couldn't get the screws and holes to line up on all four. I got two really secure and one sort of secure. However, I was able to move it to the location in the room where I wanted it to be and I don't see why that will matter as long as my nieces play with it - not IN it!

title: Well made and simple design, will last us years of fun
text: Such a fun and well made dollhouse. It took about 1 1/2 hours for my father and husband to put this together. The house itself is lighter than I expected but very simple and cute designs. The little wooden furniture is well made and more durable than the flimsy plastic often used in dollhouses. The colors are vibrant and the design is simple enough that it leaves room for imagination and versatility in using the rooms in the home. Taller than I was expecting but overall a great addition to our daughters play time!

title: Best Dollhouse I've Seen!  If I could move in I would...
text:
I was a little nervous about purchasing this dollhouse after reading reviews about assembly, and quality. I can now say after assembling the dollhouse (roughly 3-1/2 hours with another person), I am EXTREMELY PLEASED with my purchase. The detail of the dollhouse and included parts (table and chairs, clock, piano, beds, lamps, etc.) is incredible.

Assembly: I would recommend assembling with at least one other person. I used a regular screw driver, but also a power drill to speed things up a bit. The screw holes tended to line up well, but this is where having the second set of hands is imperative, as someone to hold while the other one assembles is key to having everything match up. There's nothing worse than having screw holes not match up! Also, the screw heads are color coded, which makes assembly easier (ie. blue screws go with the blue roof, yellow screws to the sides of the doll house, etc.)

Quality: Overall, this could be a heavier duty product (it is particle board, and thick cardboard), but when taken into account the amount of detail, size of the doll house, and price, I think it is DEFINITELY worth the purchase. It did come with some scratches and a few pieces of the wood were slightly frayed, most likely an issue created during shipping.

Overall, I HIGHLY recommend this product. My daughters (nearly 3 and 5) LOVE it and play with it daily. You may want to consider getting a safe stool for younger/shorter children to stand on, as the doll house is tall (almost 4-1/2 feet!), and smaller children may be unable to reach the top floor, which is the nursery - my daughters' favorite place to play! I am VERY pleased with my purchase, as this doll house can accommodate Barbie size dolls, but offers more/is much more attractive than the Barbie dream homes, in my opinion.

title: Great doll house

title: Good buy for the price tag
text:
Good buy for the price tag. It's not a top quality wooden dollhouse, but it is sturdy. I liked that it came with extra hardware and doll furniture. Instructions are only illustrations, but easy to follow. One person putting this together took 5 hours (me!). Two would probably had taken one to two hours. Garage knob broke off, but my husband fixed it with super glue. I'm 5'8" and this house comes up to my neck. It is very tall and wide, so be sure you have a space to anchor to a wall. My kids love the house and I hope it keeps them entertained for years to come.

My childhood kitchen and bedroom set from the early 90's fit in this house perfectly. Also, my old Barbie Jeep fits in the garage.

text: This was a gift for my 4 year old daughter for Christmas.  The refrigerator arrived damaged (Photo attached).  It would be amazing to receive a replacement refrigerator if possible. Assembly was okay, a little frustrating that there are different colored screws but the directions don't tell you what color screws to use where, so where we thought we were supposed to use colored screws we ran out and ended up having different screw colors on the same part - door hinges for example. title: Well designed dollhouse, solid construction and very very big.
text: When I bought it through Amazon a few weeks ago the price was a lot less than the three hundred dollars current list price!  However I think that it is well worth three hundred.  It took me about three plus hours to put together, and I'm a builder, but it is so well engineered there were zero problems.  The well constructed pieces fitted together and when finished it was sturdy and above all very beautiful. My dough tears are nine and five and both of them have spent the entire Xmas day showing the house to all their dolls.  The mini dolls are living on the top floor, the Barbies on the Second floor and the assorted others fill the last two floors!  Great product would buy it again.

title: Large beautiful dollhouse
text: I was a little nervous to buy this just because there were many mixed reviews. Some saying it was bad and many saying it takes a long time to put together & is difficult. I decided to buy it mostly because it seemed to have the most longevity for my toddler to grow with and get the most use out of. Plus it looked very nice. All the parts arrived just fine, looked great. There were 4 small boxes full of furniture which I think is awesome. It did take a long time to build yes but it is a massive dollhouse so it makes sense it would take a while. I put it together by myself. I didn't realise how big it actually is. I am 5'3 and the roof comes up to my chin for reference. My advice is when you are following the instructions keep referencing the picture they provide on here so you can check which way everything is supposed to be facing and what panels actually go where so you don't make any mistakes. The instructions are all black and white and that is what made it difficult. Overall I think it is a fantastic dollhouse 100% worth the money for the size and what you get. The wallpaper is very vibrant and pretty. It is a Christmas gift so I don't know what my daughter thinks of it yet but I love it!

title: A-maze-ing and completely awesome!
text:
For my daughter's 7th birthday. She's standing on tip toes to reach the attic space. She is overjoyed about this house.
Assembly is a little long winded, but the directions are good enough. From the get go, the packaging is nice and well secured, the instructions are pictures only, and little things are in separate boxes. The screw gears are color matched to the "wall paper"or exterior of the house. This is where instructions lack. It was hard at time to determine if a colored screw head should be used or a regular silver one. It didn't line up for me in 2 places, but by loosening the screws and readjusting the pieces, everything fell into place.
I did not speak with customer service, but this product is amazing! I've already purchased another Kidcraft house for my other daughter.
Overall, I can't express how much I like this house!

title: My girls absolutely love it.
text: The garage door came off after a few days. It took my husband 5 hours to put together the doll house so I do not want to return it. My girls absolutely love it.

title: Nice doll house
text: Pretty sweet! Not bad to assemble if you have someone to feed you the parts.

title: First Dollhouse
text:
I have two daughters, 3 and 6 years old. I got this dollhouse in hopes that it will last several years. So far, after owning it a month, it's held up fine to hard play. The furniture has also is holding up wonderfully. My puppy got ahold of one of the tables though. There are details on this dollhouse that may be easy to overlook too. The crib and beds have 'bedding' on them, and there is also a pigeon painted on the outside of the house which is a nice touch. The stairs don't stay on for me though. But my kids play pretty rough. My sons also play with it too. My littler kids can't reach the top. My 6 year old can, but the others cannot. Also, the elevator was really, really hard to move. We just oiled it a bit and it works fine now. You definitely want to anchor this dollhouse to a wall. It'd be disastrous if it were to tip over!

We built it at Grandma's house and relocated it to our new home a couple weeks later. We removed the smaller 'side' easily to fit in the SUV, and then put it back together at the new house with no problems.

The garage also doesn't fit the Barbie Pink Convertible that we got for it, so don't expect a Barbie car to fit in the garage. You can still use it for storage though! Very sturdy.

title: Skip the Barbie dream house and get this. Worth the money and you save over dream house.
text: Directions sucked but watching some YouTube videos, I got through it. Took about 4 hours to put together as others have said. Did it in two days.  Very sturdy and well worth the money. Got my Daughter this for Christmad and I know we will have it for many many years. Only this I am dissapointed in is the top floor of my house wasn't measured correctly so my top floor is kind of bubbling upwards but not a big deal and you cant really notice. My 4 year old doesnt care.

title: Worth every penny! Bigger than my 9yr old
text:
When I this first arrived, I will definitely admit that I was intimidated by the size of the box, and how heavy it was. Once I got the box opened though I was a little more relieved. I absolutely love the fact that all the pieces are numbered, and all the screws/bolts are lettered! The instructions are SUPER easy to follow as well!
It took me approximately 3hrs to assemble give or take a few min.
The picture I included with my review includes my 9 year old daughter... No, she's not short for her age either, she's about average with the rest of the kids in her class... That's just how huge the dollhouse it! We're both completely in love with the dollhouse also.
Its insanely sturdy!!! One of the main things I'm so ecstatic about. text: very big dollhouse.. my daughter loves it, took a few hours to put together but it was worth it. she likes all the accessories, my only complain would be that some of the pieces like the floor image that was glued on top of the wood are not perfectly aligned so you can see the wood around the edges like it was done in a hurry but after it is put together you wont really notice it, last but not least the screws to keep the roof together actually get loose pretty easy, my concerned for everybody is that if your kid is not tall enough the highest part of the dollhouse the attic gets difficult to reach and can be dangerous if they try to climb up. my recommendation would be to 1- use the included pieces to make sure you screw the dollhouse to the wall and 2- get your kid one of those step stool so they can reach in a safe way. believe me your kid will appreciate it and you'll improve their experience with this beautiful dollhouse.

title: High Quality Dollhouse, Low Quality Instructions!
text:
Took me about 3-4 hours to build this, taking my time, laying out all the parts neatly to start, and carefully following the lousy instructions! (If I built another I could do it in less than half that time).. The black-and-white (and pretty cryptic) picture-based instructions were definitely lame: With a lot of the pictures, I had to keep staring at them for quite some time before I finally "got it". (And I tend to be very methodical and meticulous when building things).. It was ABSOLUTELY ESSENTIAL (for me, at least) to go online and bring up a large color picture of the completed house on my laptop that I could refer to as I went along, so I could see how completed assemblies were supposed to look, and which parts were supposed to go where. ALSO VERY IMPORTANT: Have some favorite music playing while you build this-- It'll help calm your nerves as you fumble through some of the assemblies! BOTTOM LINE: It's a solid dollhouse, unbelievable size, detail and quality for the money. I only have one gripe: My daughter's Barbie car doesn't quite fit in the garage-- the garage doors have to be slightly ajar with the car in there. But my daughter doesn't care-- She loves it. I subtracted 1 star for lousy instructions-- A house this nice should have instructions of matching quality. But once it's done, the end result justifies the frustrations!

UPDATE: I looked at some of the other reviews of this dollhouse and noticed that several people recommend gluing the pieces together..One word: DON'T!!!! As mentioned, some of the instructions are a bit vague, so (as I did once or twice) you may wind up having to back up a couple of steps because you realize you assembled something backwards or some such thing.. So, what if you glued your incorrect assembly nice and tight? Maybe you even left it overnight to dry good and solid? Whatcha gonna do??? Kill yourself, exactly! The screws make this solid enough, and I find it to be very sturdy without any glue at all. Plus, what if you someday want to disassemble this, at least partially, to store it, or if you move? Glue = NOT a good idea!

title: Great buy if u have the space
text:
My twin girls got this for their 3rd birthday. (Almost 1year ago) it took my husband and me a good 6 hours to put it together. Wasn't hard just lots of pieces that have to be facing the correct direction. After completing it we noticed the elevator track was cracked and I just didn't think those stairs were going to hold up.( They are still holding up after 1 year) I got on the phone with kidKraft and they sent me new elevator section and stairs with a breeze.

I love all the wooden furniture pieces that comes along with the set. The pieces are large enough barbies actually fit in the bath tub, bed and different shelves......Everything a little girl could need included. The top shelf of the house is too high for them to reach, so we bought some step stools for them.

I wipe it down with a baby wipe about 1 time per month because it showed finger prints. I am scared to use anything too wet or scratchy as the floor is not very strong. But is plenty strong for playing on.

The shed door needed a small magnet to hold it closed. .50 cent fix from the dollar store.

My girls turn 4 next week and there doll has will NOT be going into the donate box.

text:
Wow, totally made for a princess. This is the prettiest doll house, we have ever seen. It just takes your breath away. The colors are so pretty. It looked wonderful sitting next to the Christmas tree. It never gets old to look at or boring for our daughter to play with. Her friends' eyes get so big when they see her dollhouse as this house is so big. The furniture is too cute, and looks adorable in the house. Your daughter's barbies will fit beautifully in this house and on the furniture.

The only negative thing I can say is to be careful with the elevator and really it is not a problem, ours has not break, but it is just a good idea for your child to hold her/his hand under the elevator when he/she uses the knob to push up or down as it just seems to be the only weak area of the whole house, and again, probably not an issue. We have had this for 8 months and it looks as new as when she received it. And she plays with it nearly everyday.

Setup does take a while, but it is really worth it. Look at this house... it is just too cute.

January 4, 2015
My daughter still has this in her room. Except for some minor drawing (haha, you know kids), it still looks new. She still loves it as does our youngest daughter.

title: Highly Recommend KidKraft Majestic Dollhouse
text: I purchased the KidKraft Majestic Dollhouse for my 6 year old daughter.  She loves it.  It is very well built and sturdy.  As far as assembly it took Santa‚Äôs helper and his pre-teen grand-daughter about 5 hours to put it together. From the reviews I read assembly time average seems to be 3 hours.  It came with lots of furniture. Although the rooms are large enough for Barbie dolls I bought the doll house family figurines, which my daughter prefers because the legs bend; she can sit them on the furniture.  She really likes that she can put her family car in the garage just like Mommy.  There is even a garage door entrance into the house.  Be mindful of the height and weight of the doll house if purchasing for smaller kids.  A wall mount bracket is included.  I, personally,  would not purchase for kids who cannot reach all levels of the house without assistance.  Otherwise, I highly recommend this doll house.

title: Adorable and HUGE!
text:
I absolutely love the furniture that comes with this! The bed has a little mattress, the couch has a cushion, the kitchen counter has curtains on the bottom of it, the refrigerator opens and has a shelf..there is a rocking bassinet for a baby!! ...yeah... I'm jealous of my 7 year old daughters birthday gift! It is made of wood and a pressed wood. We will see how it holds up. I will update in a few months.
Putting it together was not hard, but it was not the easiest thing to do. I would recommend using a drill (slow and easy!) It is easiest to put it together with 2 people. The instructions are only photos. Poorly designed photos of what you are supposed to do each step. Obviously it can be done, but it is a bit confusing. Just make sure to watch carefully to what you are doing and think ahead. You can do it! Your kiddo will love this! I feel like it could be easily customized as well, if you wanted to make it your own little dollhouse, it would be easy to wrap with wallpaper or maybe paint? This reminds me, I am somewhat disappointed in the quality of how well the current wallpaper or design wrap is placed on the wood. It peels VERY EASILY from the edges. It is not glued down well. At least mine is not. But a little tape, glue or maybe even an epoxy would help.
I am very pleased with my purchase! It is my little girl's birthday today and so she will wake up to this!
I am happy to know that it is not cheap plastic, it is a FRACTION of the cost of a Barbie dollhouse. The Barbie dollhouse is also SIGNIFICANTLY smaller! This dollhouse will work with barbies, LOL, small dolls, big dolls, Bluey, Army men and more!

text: Bought this for my 6 year old grand daughter. It is very well built like all the Kid Kraft products. I purchased this in early December. Eventually the price almost doubled so be aware.  Was not too time consuming to assemble. My husband did have to redrill a couple of holes. He also left the garage disconnected for easier transport.  Once it finds its final destination her daddy can screw the garage back on. She is tall yet the house is taller.  The furniture is awesome and somewhat intricate.  Barbie and Skipper dolls fit in every room standing up except the attic nursery.  I am certain this house will provide hours of fun for many years (and possibly generations) to come.  Thank you for this beautiful addition to any little girl‚Äôs fantasy.

definitely recommend

title: Well worth the purchase
text:
As others have stated already, if you buy this, set aside a few hours for assembly. Though the instruction book isn't quite as clear as I'd like, it's not so hard as to make things impossible to figure out.

The house is BIG though. The pictures do it no justice, even the one with a young child standing next to it. I am 5'7 and the house roof comes to my shoulder.

Our daughter plays with the house all the time & the rooms are so tall, most of her dolls fit easily in it. This was well worth the purchase and is so large, several kids can play with it at the same time. I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking to 'wow' their child.

title: Your daughter will love this dollhouse!
text: I was hesitant to order this because so many reviews related to damage or images not being printed on correct side of board.  We ordered this for our 5 year old granddaughter for Christmas morning.  It took my husband and son (both knowledgeable with tools) about 2.5 hours to put together.  There are a lot of pieces, and they covered the entire kitchen floor putting it together but when they did, it was impressive to say the least!  Our granddaughter loved it!  And yes Barbie dolls are perfect size for the doll house.  We had a birthday party a week after Christmas and all the children ages 4-7, boys and girls played with the doll house.  Prior to the party, the doll house was secured to bedroom wall.  Very happy with this purchase

title: Check all pieces before putting together.

title: Best dollhouse on the market
text: This doll house was a Christmas gift last year. The quality is amazing and the product does not disappoint! A great addition to any girls playroom!

title: Huge & beautiful dollhouse.
text:
A wonderful dollhouse and its huge and gorgeous and well built. I would definatly buy it again.
The only reason it has 4 stars and not 5 is because the directions are horrible to follow...that needs a huge improvement.
We did get a few broken pieces in our box and we tried calling several times and it was a 4 hr wait time. So I emailed them and it was taken care of within 48 hrs and sent us the new parts shipped to our door.
All in all we love the dollhouse and I think its definitely worth the price and will last a lot longer than those overpriced plastic ones.

title: It is a very nice dollhouse
text: It's very detailed it's not bad to put together, I used a 3.6 volt drill to assemble you only need a p2 Phillips and it H4 allen wrench bit.  I spent two hours assembling it.  I would buy again.  The only complaint I have is the instructions.  If you use common sense to figure it, no problems.  There are several parts with the same part letter but different colors, the instructions do not specify which color to use.  Several parts have two sides and the instructions do not tell you which side to use. I had to reference the pictures on Amazon several times to know which side shows.  That is the only thing I would change on the instructions I wish they let you know which color to use and which side needs to be facing up but like I said earlier if you use common sense and take your time  you'll know that the floor for example should be facing up with a brown screw.

title: Great doll house!

title: Amazing value!
text: This house is incredible! All told, it took my husband about 3 hours to put together, but I'm sure this will be well worth it. At this price, I was amazed by the quality of the materials. The floors are the thinnest pieces, with the walls being very thick material, and the furniture is all nice, chunky wood. My daughter wanted the Barbie Dream House, and I feel a lot better about buying wooden toys than plastic. This feels like a quality product, and I'm sure it will provide years of play!

text: Nieces love it and it's good quality for the most part.  However, it took me 5.5 hours to put together; yes you read that right.  I build this stuff ALL the time so I'm quick to realize when things are backwards/upside down on the directions than they are on the photos (which happens A LOT with this particular set... helpful tip: build the elevator based on the photo, NOT the instructions or it will be completely messed up) and it still took me forever.  I could see it taking a novice a good 7+ hours.

title: Santa did good!
text: This doll house is everything I could have imagined! My 4 and 2 year old girls love it, and have just enough room to play without stepping on each other's toes. They cannot quite reach the attic area yet, which is fine. Took Santa 1.5 hours to put it together and said it was pretty simple. The furniture is precious and the colors are soft. Definitely recommend! My niece received the same one from Santa and she loves it as well.

title: The dollhouse you always wanted as a kid
text:
This is one of the cutest doll houses I have ever seen. Bought for my 6 year old daughter. I purchased small (4 in size) dolls being that I wasn't sure what size would work. Looks like it fits Barbie size dolls . This dollhouse is quite large measuring 4.5 feet tall x 4 feet wide. Make sure you have plenty of space.
Pros: lots of detail ( chandelier, elevator etc)comes with sturdy furniture, fits dolls up to Barbie size, generous amount of rooms/size ... both my kids can play at the same time. My son likes moving his trucks in and out
Of the garage! Solidly packaged so no damage to pieces in transit
Cons: difficult and time consuming to put together. Some of the holes didn't line up, Designs are only on one side( the interior) so "front" of the house is just blank

Overall, I would buy this again as it's just an amazing piece!

title: Love it!!
text: We are soooooo happy with the doll house. Its huge! Much bigger then we expected. Barbies and other dolls fit perfectly. My only complaint is that the instructions suck. A picture would have made a huge difference. It took my husband and I about 3 hours to build, but once you get the hang of it building becomes pretty easy. A few of the pieces are messed up, but not too noticeable.

title: Five Stars

My daughter was very a happy with this doll house.
Is very big and fun

title: Absolutely fantastic product!
text: Absolutely fantastic quality and details. Easy to put together. Took my husband and I awhile but it was worth it. Screws match the room colors which is a great detail. So much better than Barbie brand.

title: HOURS of Entertainment!
text:
My girls (5 and 2) love Barbies and Disney Princess "Barbies". So, I knew for Christmas this year that this would be the ultimate Santa gift. This is WAY cheaper than the Barbie Dream house and in my opinion MUCH better. It is not tacky or made from cheap plastic. It took my husband (an engineer) and I 3 hours to put together on Xmas eve. Yes, the instructions are awful and don't show which side of the pieces should be facing which way so we had to redo a few parts. But, they were all basically big chunks and not 100 tiny stickers or pieces. The furniture is awesome and very sturdy. Only 2 pieces of furniture had to be assembled: the bed (with screws) and the piano (just pegs you stick in for legs). Over the last 3 days I have fixed the piano about 43 times, because my 2 year old thinks its fun to take things apart. So, today the legs got crazy glued on and I Modge Podged the piano keys sticker that also kept getting ripped off. All of the other furniture seems to be very tough. I did also get a Barbie convertible and when in the garage the doors don't fully close but the kids don't seem to care.
This is huge and if you have more than 2 players, there is plenty of room for both to play without fighting over anything. It will be years before the 2 year old can reach the top floor and honestly, its still a bit too tall for my 5 year old to really even play up there so I know it will get years of use. For the past 4 days the kids have spent HOURS playing dolls, rearranging furniture, and living it up in their new house. Well worth the money- especially as this gift was for both girls!

title: Fantastic dollhouse!
text: I bought this dollhouse for my two year old for christmas this year 2010 and she Loves it! It is all wood  with all wood durable accessories. She plays with is everyday. It encourages imaginative play,it is cute and it will grow with her. It definitely needs to be anchored to the wall to prevent tipping. The elevator does not move up or down so smoothly but it's a really great toy despite it's few flaws.

title: Be prepared for damaged parts, not easy to put together
text:
Parts came scuffed up or damaged. Had to super glue some pieces together. My kid loves it but very very expensive to get parts that look used. Can't say I am going to buy from this vendor again. Really disappointed to spend near 200.00 on this. And the items were packaged like this. The box was not damaged. I didnt include all pieces damaged in pics and yes the damaged parts did tear easier when assembling. And caution, even if it is mainly wood, the house is large and flimsy and it tears easily. When assembling. Have tape or glue ready.
Edit: putting it together is a 2 person job with all the turning you have to do of the item. I did rip and have to glue one wall that the instructions didn't have both sides already screwed in when going to the next step. You actually had to skip ahead 2 steps to finish that wall. I suggest to skip around and do steps out of order so you're only working on putting together one side of the house at a time. The house is large. It is as tall as me when half assembled (over 5 foot). Also, save yourself some blisters and own an electric drill. Some of the holes are not predrilled correctly, and it took me about 4 hours to do it manually. Lastly, the instructions do not have any parts labeled top or bottom. You have to do a lot of guessing with both sides being decorated (the instructions are in black and white too). I had a lot of oopsies to unscrew because I realized I put something on upside down. Have patience with this if its your first time building a doll house!

title: Fantastic doll house even for two kids
text: The kids love it.  It is taller than both my 3 and 5 year old, giving them plenty of room to play, even together.  Assembly took awhile, but all of the furniture and details that are included make it a great and affordable present for any little girl.

title: Floors warped after a week - only fix is to replace and rebuild
text: My daughter spent all her Christmas money on this house to upgrade her previous kidkraft doll house. It took me 3 hours to put it together and I‚Äôm pretty handy. Within a week the floors had warped. The doll house is in her bedroom in a dry, heated home. There is no reason for warping. I contacted kidkraft. They sent me some link and garbage to fill out a warranty claim FOR EACH PIECE. Then I have to wait for them to arrive and TAKE THE WHILE HOUSE APART to fix it. So we‚Äôre talking at least 6 hours of work on top of the time to navigate their cumbersome warranty claims. My daughter is so disappointed! This is our 3rd kidkraft house. We‚Äôve never had an issue before. The solution offered by kidkraft is wholly unacceptable. I‚Äôd give this house negative stars if I could!

title: Recent xmas 2017 trend?
text:
One will notice that most of the poor reviews of this product are very recent-I would hope KidKraft would take notice and require a QA review.

The poor reviews are true. Our box came damaged but lucky to have no pieces broken. The directions were so poor it took my husband 3 hours to assemble-drill holes missing causing us to duct tape an entire panel together...just not worth the money and pain to put together.

Save your marriage, dont buy this!!

title: Highly recommend
text: Was the perfect gift. Our daughters love it. Was able to assemble by self, but it did take a while. Only bad things is the stairs come off very easily and the one wall between bathroom and bedroom doesn't stay in well.

title: Reccomend

title: Strong chemical smell that won't go away
text: This is a nice, well made dollhouse but a word of caution...it has a ridiculously strong chemical smell. We set it up Christmas night and here it is 2 months later and I can still smell it every time I walk into my daughter's bedroom. We actually moved it to another, better ventilated room for the first month because the smell was so strong I didn't feel comfortable having my daughter sleeping next to it. It has improved somewhat but still lingers.

title: A great dollhouse
text: What a great dollhouse!  My daughter asked Santa for a big Barbie dollhouse but after reading the reviews on it, how cheaply they‚Äôre made and prone to breaking easily, I could just imagine the disappointment of having it fall apart after a short time playing with it.  I found this one and though it takes a couple hours to put together it is a much better dollhouse‚Äîand cheaper!  Large size, 4 stories and fits Barbie sized dolls.  All her other Christmas toys are being neglected as she spends hours playing with this dollhouse.

title: This is a true dream house!
text: My kids LOVE this barbie dollhouse. It was a fantastic deal for the price, especially considering what all was included. While it was a bit time consuming to put together, the directions were very clear and I didn't have any trouble at all. I'm almost always overly impressed with KidKraft products and have bought several over the years. I anticipate this dollhouse lasting for many years for our little ones.

title: A MUST HAVE FOR YOUR LITTLE GIRL!
text:
This hugh dollhouse is absolutely beautiful. Constructed mainly of wood which is a great plus.
Our Granddaughter is four and truly love her dollhouse.

title: What a fantastic find!
text: I am surprisingly pleased with this dollhouse!! It is sturdy and adorable! (Also comes with wall mount) It is very large, so keep that in mind before you make the purchase. My four-year-old twin girls LOVE it! This is definitely my favorite Amazon purchase thus far (and I've purchased A TON of products off Amazon!) I highly recommend this dollhouse!  It beats those Barbie dollhouses ANY day!

title: Great product
text: This was a christmas present for my 3 year old daughter. She loves it and loves that her "barbie" dolls fit in it. The furniture that comes with the doll house is very well made and has been very sturdy. The dollhouse itself is of good quality, although my husband had to reinforce of few pieces to make it more solid. My 3 year old was laying inside of it for a brief period of time without it breaking, so I am impressed with that. The size is large but not overwhelming. It's a great addition to our playroom and looks great.

title: Amazing!
text: I ordered this for my 3 year old granddaughter for Christmas. I'd read the reviews and took a chance on the quality. I was not disappointed. My brother put it together (he's a building contractor). His complaint, as others have stated in their reviews, is that there are only pictures and not written instructions. He put it together by himself in about 1 and 1/2 hours. The key is realizing the color of the screw matches the piece of the dollhouse. It is quite large, as expected, but perfect. She has to use her small step stool to reach the top nursery level--but loves that--the baby is sleeping she says. She plays with it for hours. I'm very pleased with this purchase.

title: Amazing dollhouse!
text: This doll house is absolutely stunning! It's HUGE! My 3-yr-old received this for her last birthday. It accommodates multiple brands of dolls (up to Barbie sized) with ease! The accompanying furniture is excellent quality and very durable (wood). I imagine we will get YEARS of use out of this dollhouse! HIGHLY recommended!

title: Well Made & Beautiful
text:
This doll house has been played with for the past two years by my two kiddos (and their cousins) and it has held up beautifully. The large size is ideal for more than one child to play at the same time. It's so big that my four-year-old stands on a stool to reach the top floor! It's a great value, pretty to look at and includes so many nice details and furnishings. Definitely recommend it. It takes some time to put together, but it will last for many years.
(If this review was helpful for you, please give it a "thumbs up" below, thanks!)

Besides that - my kids all love it (ages 8 - 4) and use it often.

title: Fantastic Dollhouse
text: My 5 year old daughter (and 9 year old son) tremendously enjoys this doll house.  I really like the furniture because the pieces are detailed and larger than I expected.  This was a great buy!!!!

title: Wonderful dollhouse
text: My daughter loves it. It took a little while to build but it was very clearly labelled and the parts fit so well together. Really well built and designed.

text: I bought this for my grand daughter.  She loves it.  My daughter put it together with help from her 6 year old girl and they had fun putting it together as well.  Her husband was there and wanted to do it but she had a great time with mom and daughter time. Just glad gramps didn‚Äôt get called to put it together. title: Great Christmas Gift
text: I bought this as s Christmas gift for my 2 & 3 yr old granddaughters. I don't think they will enjoy it for years. Very large & sturdy! It took longer than the 2-3 hours they say to assemble. More like 4-5, but I did it alone. No written directions only pictures.

title: Great gift!
text: This was a gift for my granddaughters 4th birthday!  She loves it!  Although it was not difficult to assemble it did take awhile due to its large size.  The accessories that came with it are well made.  My granddaughter is creative and uses her imagination while playing with her new doll house.  In addition to the dolls that are recommended she has moved her dinosaurs, little people and other assorted items into the house.  She is definitely going to be using this for a long time.

title: Great toy - lots of pieces.
text: This dollhouse is humongous and awesome. It took a long time to assemble but wasn't very hard - just a lot of parts. The furniture is awesome! There are a few places where the edges of rooms/ceiling molding on the pictures don't match up on the back and the sides and there are two places where the sides meet the front where the "wallpaper" is slightly peeling away from the edges. We used super glue to smooth it down and it is fine. Our kids love this toy!

title: Nice, but Barbies are a little big
text:
The dollhouse looks nice. The furniture is wood and seems well made. The assembly instructions left a lot to be desired, but if you print out pictures, you'll be ok. However, while the Barbies fit height wise on the different levels, they are a little too big for some things. They are too tall to fit in the elevator, their feet hang off the edge of the bed, and the barbie car (glam convertible) is too long for the garage. Also the back side isn't painted, just plain white.

Overall it is nice and I got a great price, so it was worth the investment. Just could use some tweaks.

title: Never buy this for your kids.
text: I give this only one star, but it doesn't even deserve that. The one star is for the looks. This is the most ridiculous thing I have put together. So many pieces and screws and some screws don't even fit. You have to use force to put this together. Never again.

title: Five Stars
text: Fantastic!

title: Stunning Dollhouse
text: This dollhouse is adorable. For assembly I would rate it 8/10. It's not difficult, but it is tedious and at times it took both my husband and I for balancing and reaching the harder angles. It took us about 2 hours to complete, with both of us working on it. The outcome is worth it! Stunning and durable. Our 30lb 22mth old has climbed all in it with no problems.

title: Five Stars
text: This was a great buy especially with the furniture being included.

title: Disappointed
text: My older daughter has a Kid Kraft doll house and it is beautiful and sturdy. This dollhouse is beautiful and flimsy. The boards aren't as thick, there are uneven places and a divider wall between 2 rooms falls down every time that we have to glue it. If it didn't take hours to put together it would be returned.

title: Alot of patience
text: Bought it for my granddaughters I know they going to love it. Took like 3Hours to build. You need to have patience to build this thing any little mistake can be disastres. Instructions  should of been in color I had to be looking at internet pictures to make sure I don't put any pieces backwards or side down. But I'm very happy with it.

title: Beautiful quality and excellent price
text:
I purchased this dollhouse for my daughter's 3rd birthday and could not be more pleased with my purchase! Between the free delivery from amazon, the excellent customer service from kid craft and amazon when one of the pieces needed replaced because there was a missing pre-drilled hole, and the design of this house, it's a real winner.
I put this together by myself in 2 hours- the directions were missing from my box, but the kid craft website has everything you need and is very user friendly, so I set up my iPad with the directions on it and went to town. One point ill give is to leave the screws a little loose until you are completely assembled so the top floor has a little give- it was harder to get together at the end until I loosened a couple of screws.
We use this for Barbies and it is a thousand times better in looks, quality and durability than a Barbie dream house. Its tall!! My little girl cant quite see the top floor to play with it, but this is something she will use for years and theres plenty of other rooms for Barbie anyhow. It's in her bedroom and matches her decor very nicely- it's pretty enough to be on display with everything else in her room. The wooden furniture that is included with this house is very well made. I'm very impressed with this and just cannot get over the price difference on amazon from other sites, as well as the fact that this is less than a Barbie house at toys r us and is so much better. THANK YOU!!! One of my best purchases- and I shop online alot!!

title: My girls loved the dollhouse Santa brought them
text: My girls loved the dollhouse Santa brought them. It took a while to put together but it was worth it. Great product.

title: Somewhat sturdy but poor materials
text:
Easy to assemble but instruction made it harder then it ought to be. Illustration needs to be included. On one of the pages where you attach elevator picture is flipped. I had to check finished part to figure out which panel faces what.

They colored screws top but it is up to you to figure out which color goes with where.

Floor are made of some kind poly-paper, whatever it is after couple of weeks it begun warping (check pictures).

If I knew this probably wouldn't bought it but now it's tool late anyways. I feel they are banking on you not being able to return it, because kid would be upset , so they didn't really care much about quality of work.

title: Five Stars

title: It's nice and sturdy and has great furniture
text: This Dollhouse is much bigger than I expected! It's nice and sturdy and has great furniture!  My daughter has played with it for hours on end! She uses her little people figurines, as well as her full size Barbies with it.  It's a little tall for her though.  She is four years old and in the 98th percentile for her height, but still stands on a stool to reach the third level (nursery) of the dollhouse.  But we LOVE it. My only advice is to allow plenty of time to assemble it.  It was very easy to assemble with its step by step illustrations, but was a little time consuming.  It took me a couple of hours to complete it. Overall, we are thrilled with this product!

A few broke with normal use very quickly. I haven't figured out how to contact the seller about this issue. Once I contact the seller I will update with their response.

title: Sturdy but the instructions aren't clear

title: Kids Love, Elevator Sticks
text: We just bought this for my two daughters as a birthday gift.  It is very big and our kids love it.  It arrives in a large box with a lot of pieces and minimal instructions to put it together.  The instructions are easy to follow and has pictures to help.  The problem was that the instructions are only wire frame drawings and it isn't always completely clear which part should be facing up or down.  I had to double check with the pictures on Amazon.  The elevator isn't the easiest thing in the world to operate and our kids have a hard time using it, this is what lost it the 5th star.  Over all I hope my kids will enjoy for years to come.

title: Five Stars

title: Peeling apart EVERYWHERE! Drips of glue, poor directions
text: Spent many hours (as expected) to put this together. During the process I kept coming across COUNTLESS areas where the paper/design was peeling off/fringed and areas that should be white but we‚Äôre scratched and black. The knobs to the staircase were dripping with glue that had hardened. One of the pieces of the roof doesn‚Äôt close completely to meet the other piece and match the other side. It would have been nice if they explained in the directions what ‚Äúcolored‚Äù screws went where. Some were obvious but others were not which resulted in the correct screws being used but not the correct color because by the time you find this out you can‚Äôt go back and undo everything just to change one color screw! If you like things perfect  and looking nice this is aggravating especially after putting SO much work into it AND spending almost $200. For the price and the amount of time to put this together it should be PERFECT with directions that don‚Äôt leave room for error. My daughter was beyond excited to get this for her birthday so I couldn‚Äôt just stop and say let‚Äôs put this WHOLE THING back the way it was, MAIL IT BACK and then wait to see if we get a better one in a few WEEKS. The one she had before this one didn‚Äôt have any of these issues by the same company. This one will not last because it‚Äôs going to continue to peel apart. Will not purchase this brand again.

title: What can I say that hasn't been said already?
text: What can i say that hasn't been said already? This house is huge and beautiful.  I'm about 5'3 and the top of the house reaches my chin. I love that the entire house and accessories are made out of wood (compressed) I believe. (Not the real thing) but still beats plastic any day! The designs inside house are also nicely done. Adorable that it has a garage and parents be aware that since it has a garage your children will ask relentlessly for a Barbie Car! Building the house took be about 5 hours. But it was worth every minute! The only thing that I found very annoying was that the baby room is at the very top of the house and the elevator doesn't go up that high! My child is still very upset that the baby has to sleep in the "attic" and that the elevator doesn't go all the way up. "How will the mommy reach her baby!" -my daughter.

title: Intimidating at first, but actually fun to build!

title: Magnificant!
text:
We purchased the KidKraft Majestic Dollhouse for my 3.5 year old daughter for Christmas. She loves another doll house she has, and using her imagination, so we thought this would be a great fit. So far she loves it! The size is just right for Barbie sized dolls, and also some random ponies and other things she puts in there. There is a lot of space for her to play and I am so happy to see her enjoying this gift. She makes up little scenarios with the dolls (Ariel doll is having lunch at the kitchen table with the penguin) and its wonderful to see her being so creative and engaged.
The dollhouse itself is extremely well crafted. All the little furniture pieces are sturdy and nicely painted. My only tiny complaint is that this is a bit time consuming to put together. My husband is very handy, and it took over 3 hours. Note to self: do not put together elaborate Christmas gifts on Christmas eve! But, it came together nicely and we are very happy with it.
I hope my daughter enjoys this dollhouse for years to come. Highly recommended!

title: Be patient. Give yourself extra time!
text:
Purchased this for our daughter (4 years old) as a Christmas gift from Santa. Assembly of this dollhouse will be extremely frustrating...but the dollhouse is really large and very nice!

Before you purchase be aware of the following challenges and you'll be fine:

We read reviews that putting this dollhouse together would take about four hours...this is 100% accurate (if not longer) due to the very basic instructions.

Anticipate that some of the holes won't line up easily, which will be a challenge...but with a little force, you'll be good to go.

Unfortunately we are missing some pieces (#5...part of the elevator). We have to contact kid craft to have them send out the missing pieces. I had read this happened to another buyer as well.

Hopefully our girl will believe that "Santa's elves" will be delivering the missing pieces in a few days! I guess her dolls will have to take the stairs...maybe I will make an "out of order" sign.

Even though the assembly is a challenge, I still think this is a good purchase. I know my daughter is going to enjoy playing with this.

...you'll just want to give yourself some extra time to put it together, especially since they may need to send out replacement pieces!

title: Five Stars

title: Mom of 4yr old Twin Girls
text: I LOVE...LOVE...LOVE this dollhouse.  I purchased this for my girls for Christmas coming up...They have been seeing a variety of dollhouse commercials on TV and get excited every time they see it.  They have also seen many dollhouses in the stores and always ask if the can "borrow" it for it a while!  When I was researching to find the best, I kept coming across this one and finally when the price was right one day ($139), I placed the order...We received this the beginning of November and I was so excited to get it, that I had my husband put it together immediately.  The quality of this dollhouse is superb.  It is absolutely adorable and honestly appears to be larger in person...The furniture that comes along with it is very durable as well.  I can't wait to put this out Christmas Eve for my girls "Santa Claus"...I will add a car for the garage and I am also going to a craft store to purchased a small Christmas tree to put in the living room of the dollhouse.  I am sure this will give my girls hours of playing as they have an imagine with no end!!!  I am a very pleased customer and would recommend this to EVERYONE looking for that "special" gift =)

title: GORGEOUS, excellent quality doll house, and EASY to assemble!
text: I'm a 47-year-old woman and I put this together for my granddaughters all by myself in a little over 2 hours. The directions were very comprehensive, and the only tools I needed were a philips-head screwdriver (two allen wrenches came with the parts). The pieces are very sturdy and lined up perfectly. No having to re-drill holes, no missing pieces. All the hardware was incased in plastic on a cardboard sheet. Each type of screw was labeled in it's packet so there was no confusion. What a great product! And such a perfect gift.

title: Solid dollhouse going strong 3 years later
text:
The KidKraft Majestic Mansion Dollhouse has been great for the last 3 years (bought it in 2016). It sees daily play and all the parts are made of really sturdy materials. You definitely feel the quality and get more bang for your buck with KidKraft.

We've had cheap plastic dollhouses before that flexed a lot and never fit right - not KidKraft. The KidKraft dollhouse is solid and has endured being moved up two levels and numerous rooms without issue - remember, this is a HUGE dollhouse. Moving it was easy and no damage occurred.

Would definitely recommend this dollhouse and KidKraft as a brand - they make great dollhouses!

If you feel my review was helpful, please click "helpful" below. Thank you!

With it are darling and hold up really well. It did take my husband 3.5 hours to assemble it and he is very handy, he said the directions were not helpful. All in all, a year later I am so happy we decided to get this one!

title: Hard build took 4 hours and 3 people on christmas eve
text: I got this dollhouse for my 5 and 4 year old daughters. I choose this dollhouse because the reviews said it was huge and the price compared to other dollhouses just seemed better for the value. This dollhouse is HUGE!! Its great for two or more kids and works well with barbie and dolls alike. However the instructions are hard to read. There are a lot of pieces and the screws are color coded. I wasnt able to put it together as it was way to difficult for me as a brand new builder. My brothers and stepfather (3 people total) are way more experienced and they had a hard time as well. It took them from 1030 at night christmas eve to 230 in the morning christmas day. The second story floor had a crack where the screw goes and did break. We fixed it however with some wood glue and it was in the back so no one will notice. I do also plan to add a small closet for the dolls clothes to go behind the elevator. I would recommend to a friend.

title: NIce dollhouse.
text: Super easy to build.  Use a power screwdriver or it will take you forever!  Shockingly well built for being made in you know where. Takes a few hours but not hard to put together.

text: Awesome size if you are looking for a big doll house. Initially, all was great but shortly after putting it together, the floor boards warped. Would not buy again.

title: Awesome

title: Great dollhouse, challenging assembly
text: This is a great dollhouse for my 5 year old daughter.  She has to stretch to reach the top floor!  She plays with it all the time, great buy!  The only negative was the assembly was VERY tedious and time consuming (more than a couple hours so prepare to make an evening out of it).  Instructions were not fantastic, and you have to pay very close attention to the pictures on the box to know which direction walls/floors/etc are facing.  Also the wall of the bathroom does not fit right between the floors, so I had to stick a small piece of cardboard underneath to prop it up so the upper tab fits.  Otherwise the wall falls over constantly.  Assembly and the one wall are the only negatives, otherwise it would be 5 stars.  Assembly is a one time thing and the wall is an easy one time fix, just annoying to the assembler... for her it's fantastic!

title: Cheaper than the alternative, Imaginarium Dollhouse
text:
My husband and I have been looking for a dollhouse for my daughter who is 7 and found that it was more difficult than we anticipated. She really wanted the Imaginarium Dollhouse, it look very similiar to this one, but it was 300 dollars. I was not ready to spend that much on something that I wasn't even sure she was going to play with that much. We found this dollhouse on Amazon and decided to purchase it considering it looked the same and was 60% less than the alternative.
We received it very quickly, but be warned, it is a very large box and it is very heavy. It took my husband about 2 hours to put together, I think there were like 27 steps or so, but time consuming. The furniture did not need to be put together, with the exception of the bed and piano. I was quite impressed with the quality of the furniture, and surprised it was not extra. The interior walls are thin, but as long as you are not moving it around, it should strong. Oh, many stated problems with the elevator...one thing to do to make it move much easier is to put some WD40 on the elevator tracks. It moved much easier after I did that.
If you are not looking for a big dollhouse, this one is not for you. This think is massive. I am 5'8" and ot comes to my shoulders. It does offer wall anchors as well just in case you are worried about it tipping over. I can't see it doing that unless you have a Godzilla xhild that likes to climb on tall objects, lol. My daughter absolutely adores this dollhouse, as do I. I know she will get many years of use out of this and look forward to watching her grow with it.

Besides for that, I am very happy with this purchase. It might not have the flair of the Disney Frozen castle, but it beats the competitors with value and durability. I picture this lasting years.

title: Well-Build, Lots of Accessories, Good Value for Money, but Instructions Lack Detail
text: I wanted to give this product 5 stars, but could not given how poorly the instructions are drafted, more on that shortly. This is a well-build, sturdy, product. For the money, it is a great value. It is enormous and comes with a lot of great well-build wooden accessories. It took me a little less than 3 hours to build, from opening the box to completion, with a little help from the little ones unwrapping all of the accessories. Now for my gripes... The instructions lack significant detail, there are no words, they are in black and white, and change scale frequently, causing unnecessary confusion. There are colored screws, but it does not tell you which color to use where! It is also difficult to tell which side of the panel use. Luckily the pictures on Amazon were high enough resolution that I could use them as reference. I would highly recommend having this handy when building! Lastly, given how well-built‚Äã the remainder of the house and accessories are, the stairs are very thin, cheap, flimsy, plastic, they cut a corner here, a missed opportunity for an otherwise very high-quality product, f you ask me. Overall, it is a great product and I would recommend it, but be prepared for some frustration when building.

title: mother of two
text: This doll house is awesome a lot more durable then what I thought it was going to be and this house is huge!  My daughter has been playing with this house everyday since she has had it!  My son even plays with it.  My daughter is 6 years old and she will have lots of years to continue playing with it.  She is in love with Barbie but I didn't want to buy a plastic house that was just going to break so we decided to make this purchase and it was well worth the money!  She is able to play with her Barbies with this house and with the durability of the house I'm sure it will last her until she out grows playing with Barbie and I'll be able to pass it on to another little girl that will have plenty of years to play with it!

title: Great Dollhouse... it's big
text:
I knew this dollhouse was big, but you don't realize just how big it is until you build it. My 3.5 year old daughter is actually pretty tall and she still can barely reach the top level, even with a stool. However, she absolutely loves it. I bought 3 barbie dolls to go along with it and they're perfect.

If I had the option, I would give this 4.5 stars. I didn't give it a full 5 stars because of some minor issues I found during and after the build. A couple of the smaller furniture pieces weren't perfectly put together and I was expecting perfection. Instructions could have been better too, for example; list what side of the panel you're looking at... especially during the beginning of the build. Having said all that, the rest of the furniture pieces were great and the house itself was great. Everything is very detailed. I recommend this dollhouse if you have the room. I'm going to be purchasing more KidKraft products in the future.

title: Instructions are iffy.
text: The instructions are backwards, I had to pull the photo up a couple times to make sure it was correct and just matched up the pictures on the pieces. Other than that this is a great dollhouse and very sturdy, my daughter can‚Äôt stop playing with it. It took about 2 1/2 hours to assemble.

title: This is a great dollhouse my kid loves!
text:
This house is great and my daughter loves it! She just turned 3, so we see her getting a lot of good years of play out of it. My only hangup is that a few things don‚Äôt line up perfectly (like the swinging doors or the roof tiles) and the instructions don‚Äôt clearly state where to put the different colored screws (so pay attention as you build and maybe plan ahead!). But those are minor inconveniences. It‚Äôs a solid piece of furniture and my kid absolutely loves it.

Also, we went into building this dollhouse thinking the other reviews were over exaggerating that it would take 4 hours, and we were totally wrong. It took me, my dad (who is an engineer and a pro at building things), and my husband over 3 hours to assemble. So yeah... Definitely don‚Äôt plan on building this on Christmas Eve when your kids go to bed. You won‚Äôt get any sleep and you‚Äôll be incredibly sore come morning.

title: Pretty much the worst present ever
