title: Worth it
text: This dollhouse is amazing. My children love it ages 3, 8, & 10. The instructions were not great so we used a YouTube video which saved a lot of time. The holes are not pre drilled and the I screws strip very easily so we had to screw in the holes so it fit and then follow the actual step. 2 people and 4 1/2 hours later the house was ready to go.

title: What could have been.....
text: My wife picked this for our daughter's birthday. It is very nice. Made with wood, high definition pictures on the walls..... And the furnishings are excellent. Nice detail, nice paint, everything is really well done. So why 3 stars? Well, first, the instructions are horrible. When I started putting it together I noticed that there were not pictures but outlines in the instructions. The problem with that is most of the walls on the house have two sides. So outlines don't show you which way it should go. I spent the entire time looking at the pictures on Amazon to know which way things should face. And not only that, often the instructions were wrong. The outlines we're facing the wrong way. You could tell this because holes were on the wrong side for the painting on the wall. Then there is the "fit and finish". There were holes completely missing from walls and floors. I had to break out my Dremel tool to create holes for the stair railings and the wall with the garage at the bottom. And lastly, quality control. The wood support for the third level floor next to the elevator is bowed. This caused the floor to pull away from the back wall and hang down. I had to glue it together with Gorilla glue. And the piano keys decal was glued across the top of the piano. It looked like the packed it before it was dry and it slid off and stuck to the top. I have since corrected all of these issues and my daughter loves it. So if you are willing to make corrections and take your time, this is a great doll house. But if you are not handy, and need a easy build, look elsewhere.

title: Once put together its pretty sturdy and is quite large

title: PILE OF GARBAGE! KidKraft quality has gone DOWN!
text: Its a good thing I started putting this piece of junk together 3 days before Christmas. KidKraft's quality is NOTHING like it used to be. I have 6 kids and 4 of them are girls. I have assembles countless beds, dressers, toy boxes, tv stands, cube units, and even a couple doll houses and kitchens. This was probably the worst of them all. This set has these JUNK plastic dowel screws MOST of which easily strip out when you try to actually screw into them. I had to remove most of them, drill out the holes, glue wood dowels in, re-drill to put a smaller dowel in, and DRILL THAT dowel so I could put a screw in it. I had no issues getting it from my office to downstairs to the playroom upstairs because I made it strong. I am convinced if we tried to move it without my repairs it would have fallen apart. That was the worst of it but not all. The paper pictures were peeling up on the corners right out of the box, I had to glue them down. Some of the floor pieces are very bowed, nothing I can do about that. The instructions are like Ikea instructions. Line drawings, no text. Download the BILT app for free and find the dollhouse on there. 3-d interactive detailed GOOD instructions. After my experience with this I would give the Bilt app 5 stars and the doll house 2. Yes my 4year old daughter loves it, but she loves empty cardboard boxes too.

title: Top toy
text:
My daughter got this for her third birthday. My parents got it but since they live in Scotland and I moved to the USA my husband and I were left to build it. It took us ages! Over 5 hours but we did make a couple errors. I hate the poor excuse for directions you get with these toys, there are a lot of parts that go together and it comes in pieces (the furniture is pre built) our main problem was the roof, it was cut wrong and so wouldn't connect properly, we made it work but it was annoying. The paper has torn up a bit near the slots as well.

This house is huge, my daughter will grow into it because she can't reach the attic . As all other reviewers mentioned this house fits barbies as well. My daughter loves to play with it. We made food from playdoh to put in the fridge.

For the price it's a great toy that will last a while, I know other reviewers said that it won't last long because it's cheaply made but my 3 year old does fine and all three of my cats have walked over it. Just don't sit anything to heavy on the floors, it isn't wood and it is made to flex.

All kids should have a dollhouse, it's a great outlet for both little boys and little girls to use their imaginations and learn about life.

title: I could kiss whoever packed this!
text:
No, really, I would kiss whoever packed this for shipping! Our dollhouse came double boxed (no pic on the outer box, so it hid the present) and thank goodness for that double box. The shipment came to Missouri from Texas, and I'm pretty sure UPS drug it behind the truck the entire way. This thing was BEAT UP! There were holes all through the outer box, and the dents! I was so sure the house as destroyed that my husband and I went ahead and opened it to check for damage. That's when we discovered the actual boxed product was inside (this one does have a large colored picture on the front, which is important later) Even the original boxed was beat up from UPS. Yup, the holes managed to get through two boxes. Way to be professional, UPS. The good news is that the house was in perfect condition. Thank goodness! It is very well packed, obviously.

Since we had pieces everywhere, we decided to put it together even though it was a bit early for Christmas. It took us about 3 hours together and was pretty easy. The instructions are clear, and the colored picture on the box helped confirm we were on the right track -- not to mention furniture placement.

TIPS:
1) Don't tighten the screws too tight. Some of the wood is thin, and we noticed cracks starting. Don't get me wrong, this thing is SOLID. It won't fall apart. But there is no need to tighten each bolt to the extreme.
2) Use a bit of oil on the elevator sliders before attaching. The elevator slid rather easily, but the oil really helped it to glide. Don't skip this part, it's worth the minute.
3) A power drill will reduce construction time. We would have had this thing up in 2 hours, but the kids were asleep and we didn't want risk waking them.
4) Give yourself plenty of time. Even though it's really straightforward, this is not something you want to wait till midnight to start.

As for the dollhouse, it's beautiful. Really. Well made, sturdy, and HUGE! The furniture is large, bigger than you'd think. We haven't done the whole "Barbie" mess in our house yet, but I know it's coming. This house will fit Barbie, when the time comes, but for now I bought the family of 7 wooden dolls. They are on the smaller side, but I feel they fit the furniture better. Plus, my 2 1/2 year old can manipulate them easier. Also, if your worried about the house tipping, it comes with wall attachment hardware. This house is so so so worth the little extra money -- especially when compared a plastic dollhouse.

title: Love it!

text:

It comes with a good bit of furniture- thought I would need to buy a lot but so far have only used what has come with it. Eventually I will add accessories like plates for the kitchen, etc. But this is a great purchase!!!!!!

title: Best dollhouse on market for price/quality!
text:
PROs:
- SIZE: - gloriously large for younger kids to be submerged into playing pretend.
- COLORS: - Amazing wallpaper and decoration
- The BUILD: - It took a LONG time to build.. but it came together STABLE and fitting.

CONs:
- Cheap wall-paper : - The stuff starts peeling off from the get-go. be careful moving the wood pieces around when building it.. and make sure you trim back all the overhanging stuff so your kids don't see it and peel off the whole thing.
- Expensive : - costly, but its worth it for its size/quality :-)

VERDICT : BUY it ! probably THE best doll-house for a kid that I have seen in a long time. Can't go wrong with this one as long as you put 3 hours of building time aside. Make Sure you look @ the building instructions closely to make sure things are facing the correct direction! It was a fun build to do alone!

title: Great quality excellent toy - Daughter loves it!
text:
We purchased this doll house as a Christmas gift for our daughter. She'd played with these huge doll houses at a local place where they host birthday parties, but never had anything like this at home. Having ordered it a few weeks before Christmas, it arrived and I moved it to the basement to put together, knowing she would be down there. It goes together fairly easily. Here are a few observations.

* There is a lot of attention to detail: Some of the screw heads are actually painted different colors so that they blend into whatever wall they're going into. You have to decide for yourself when to use painted screws or silver, but it's a nice touch.
* There are a lot of screws included, but don't let that scare you - they all make sense once you get through building
* It's not difficult to put together. You don't need to be a professional handyman. Some moms have posted here about their success in building it and I would wholeheartedly agree and encourage any parent to order this with the confidence that they'll be able to assemble it. It's more like a 3d puzzle than a construction project.
* I put it together in 2 separate one-hour assembly sessions. I was extra careful not to damage any of the wood or scratch anything. It helps to have an extra person around to hold it up while you're still getting the basic structure of the 4 floors put together.
* The elevator is cute, but the track is pretty tight, making it hard for our toddler to move it up and down. Good news is, she doesn't care.
* The garage doors can flap open by themselves... nothing that can't be fixed with cheap magnets
* The overall quality of how all the pieces are made and how they fit together is very high - this is a well made toy and not a carelessly mass-produced kit.
* I've already ordered some cheap LEDs to add some actual light inside the house.
* There's an impressively complete set of wooden furniture included, which really adds to the fun.

The thing to keep in mind - it's really a giant thing. My daughter can only see/reach as high as the 3rd floor. The 4th/attic floor - which is supposed to be the baby's room - is unoccupied at the moment. She's fine with it because a large part of the fun is rearranging the furniture. Also, being so large, getting it up the basement steps was pretty tricky. We had to experiment with a few different angles and my wife had to help carry it. It's too heavy and large for one person to do steps with, but I could lift it a few inches and move it across level floor pretty easily.

* Speaking of lifting it - use the side windows of the main part of the house as handles when lifting and you'll be in good shape. Don't lift using the garage/porch section at the left!

On Christmas morning, our daughter came down the stairs in complete amazement when this was under (actually next to) the tree. It's found a permanent spot in her toy room and actually looks great. It warmed up the room and added some height in what was pretty much a room full of toddler-size toys. She loves it and it's part of her everyday routine already. Hopefully she'll get years of mileage out of it as she grows into it and discovers more ways to play with it.

title: The kids love it
text: Was easy for the hubby to put together, I think it took him about 4 hours or so. And it is huge. My five year old is of average 5 year old height and it is taller than her. It comes with anchors to attach to the wall so that it will not fall on your unsuspecting child. The playhouse itself is not really heavy. Im 5'4 about 135lbs and I could move it around the room very easily and pick it up (improperly) when I needed to. It is a huge playhouse so if you are carrying it to another room or something you will need help b/c the dimensions will prevent you from being able to wrap your arms around it. THe colors are nice, it comes with plenty of furniture, almost too much furniture and you can fit a barbie car in the garage, you just wont be able to close the doors. I couldnt have picked a better dollhouse for my girlies to grow up with. Maybe Ill update this review in a few years so we can see if it stands the test of time and abuse from the children.

text: Took almost 4 hours to assemble. Some of the individual pieces are a little weak and worried me but completely assembled, it is very sturdy. Doll furniture was nice. Worthy purchase and my daughter loves her Christmas gift.

title: Great-Please read this first!
text:
Great dollhouse. My niece loves it. Received 12/27/19, too late for last year. Kept unopened until 12/24/20 (this year) and almost went into shock with all of the pieces. Luckily, an angel on YouTube (How to‚Äôs by Mama) gave step-by-step instructions on how to put this together right the first time! She tells which sides go up (down), what color screws to use, etc. without her, I would not have realized the pitfalls until after the house was assembled. Do yourself a favor and watch her video! You‚Äôll thank me/her.

Now for the house. I was impressed that Kidktaft put enough thought into this to even color the top of the screws to match each room, the garage and the roof. The boards are somewhat thin, but sturdy. I was pleasantly surprised to see that all of the furniture is made of wood (not that plastic stuff). The head and footboards of the bed had to be screwed in with pink (of course) matching screws.

The assembled house is large, about 4.5 feet tall and almost completely covered my fireplace.

This was a very pleasant surprise for my niece and me, especially after almost a year of covid. Thanks Kidkraft and ‚ÄúHow To‚Äôs by Mama‚Äù‚ÄîKidkraft should hire you!. My little masked niece was very happy.

title: I was fortunate enough to get two of these from Amazon when ...
text:
Wow!!! I can hardly wait for Christmas so I can see the look on their little faces! Just the size alone is impressive. Add to that the sheer quality and beauty of the decor and you'll be over the moon. But if that's not enough for you the wooden furniture will blow your mind! I was fortunate enough to get two of these from Amazon when it was only $129. Heck, I used a code when I ordered the second one and it was even cheaper and I got a family of seven for free! Assembly was not difficult. It didn't matter that three were only pictures. I did have to look at pictures of it on Amazon to ensure I was using the right part, but I only did that twice. It's great that the screws are color code for. Kidkraft really takes pride in their products. I had two pieces with very minor damage. I mean so minor you'd really need to have it pointed out to you. I contacted them via email and got replacements in a few days. The little Woden dolls are too little in my opinion. The Barbie size dolls fit better but still aren't perfect for some of the furniture. The only thing not perfect is the elevator. It's a bit tight like the others have mentioned but I used Vaseline when installing and that helped a lot. I believe it will loosen up with use which is probably why they made it tight to begin with.

I must admit that I've played with this house everyday for a week until I had to wrap it. I can't to play with it with my grands on Christmas! AMAZING HOUSE!!!

title: Great value for the price...This thing is HUGE!
text:
Single mom here...I was definitely intimidated when I saw the box and all the pieces. I am no rookie at putting toys and furniture together, but this gave me pause. An important thing to note: the instructions have no words! You must infer from the pictures which side is the top side, which edges screw together, etc. Be prepared to undo and redo a few screws. Bring your patience. Also, bring a drill.
Three hours, two glasses of wine (did I mention the instructions HAD NO WORDS??), and a broken fingernail later, I had an enormous dollhouse that I knew my daughter would absolutely love. She spends hours playing with this dollhouse. The wooden furniture pieces are sturdy and will last a long time. The walls of the house itself seemed a bit flimsy, but once it is all put together it feels very durable. It is bright and colorful, and most of all, HUGE! I was looking for something that was sturdy, a good value, and that my child wouldn't quickly outgrow. I certainly found it!

title: Stunning Doll house
text: This doll house is stunning. I bought as a gift for my niece for her 7th birthday, this house is HUGE! The thank you photo I received back shows it stands about 3-4 feet taller than her and she needs a step stool- this is not being mentioned as a Con for buying this. I honestly believe this is hands down the best doll house (it fits regular size Barbie's) for the price and for any little girl that loves dolls. Very well constructed but it took my sister a few hours to put to all together- it's a very heavy item!

title: Perfect
text: Very cute! My daughters face was priceless Christmas morning. Its huge!!

title: This is the best dollhouse ever
text: This is the best dollhouse ever. Built very well with real wood/plastic furniture. The frame is made out of wood and very sturdy. My granddaughter just loves her new dollhouse.

title: Amazing dollhouse-but VERY large!
text:
We ordered this dollhouse for our three year old daughter. I spent hours online trying to find the best dollhouse within a reasonable price range and I also shopped around in a few stores. I do think this one is the best choice! It definitely has the best reviews. As most of the reviews say, it does take some time to put together, so set aside a couple nights to work on it or whenever you have time. It is very sturdy and well made. Our daughter loves it and I think she will have a lot of fun in the years to come. There are two things I'm not completely happy with: 1. The size of the house. I knew it was big, that was actually a lot of the reason I decided on this one, but it's hard to visualize how big it actually is until u see it in person. It could possibly be overwhelming to some children. Also make sure you have enough space for it! 2. The elevator does not work. We had to cut off part of it so it would slide up properly. I also added Crisco to the metal part which did WONDERS! It works perfectly now, but I do feel they need to work on the manufacturing of the elevator so that it doesn't have to be tinkered with just so it will work.

Overall, this dollhouse is great! I do recommend buying it if you have the space for it.

Oh I also want to mention that I LOVE the furniture that comes with it!

Has anyone bought dolls for it? Barbies fit but are a little too big and I would like to buy a dollhouse family. Any recomendations?

title: We're moving in!
text: Great dollhouse for the price. It's bigger than my 5 year old, and she adores it. And it fits Barbies. It took my husband about an hour-and-a-half to put it together. Worth every second.

title: Perfect for my girls!
text:
I have a 3 1/2 year old and a 9 month old. They both LOVE this dollhouse.

As far as how it's shipped - if you order it as a gift (in the settings of Amazon when you're selecting shipping method, etc), it comes wrapped in plain cardboard so you can't see the sides of it. That worked out great for me. I ordered it as a birthday present, and my daughters were both sitting at the kitchen table eating lunch when it came. Neither of them could see what was inside, so I was able to just leave it by the front door until my husband could move it somewhere to hide it (it's pretty heavy).

There is plenty of furniture included, and all the decorations are very nice looking. It does require a large space. It is easily nicer than anything I could find in local toy stores,

title: This dollhouse was actually quite easy to put together
text:
This dollhouse was actually quite easy to put together. My daughter loves the colors and all the little details. It's quite large...at 3 she cannot reach the top floor but it will grow with her.

From an aesthetic standpoint...its bright and tacky and doesn't give the elegant, classic dollhouse detail I'd like on display in my home but... Why not? She loves it!

title: My granddaughters love this
text: I bought two for my granddaughters! They love it! The moms had to assemble but they had no problem other than time consuming.

title: It's great but don't expect to assemble on Christmas eve!
text:
Overall, this was a good purchase for $145. It's huge. Once assembled it is quite sturdy but not super heavy, which is good. The instructions were easy to follow, but heads up that this will take HOURS to complete. I read in other reviews not to assemble on Christmas Eve so my husband and I assembled half on the 22nd, and the other half on the 23rd. Both of us working together took about 3-3.5 hours to assemble. It was 28 steps if I remember correctly! So if you are putting it together alone then expect 4+ hours! There were also a couple instances where holes did not line up exactly and hubby had to use some muscle to get it together correctly.
Last minor gripe (but isn't really important) is that there are screws of different colors, but share the same name in the instructions. So it will say to use hardware labeled "L" and then when you go for the L hardware you have to decide whether to use the white, blue, gray, brown or silver ones. So not a huge deal, but if you want the colors to match appropriately then you will have to put a little forethought into it. (Instructions are in black and white and do not mention colors at all)

So it seems I have listed multiple reasons to dislike this product but really I am actually quite happy with it. The hardest part is putting it together but once that is done it is fantastic! And not a bad price for it's huge size.

title: My daughters love it
text:
Wouldn't say the instructions were bad but they weren't good. There are different colored screws, you'll notice this about 25 minutes and 40 screws in. There also isn't an actual picture of the designs on the instructions, so if you aren't particularly observant you might have to take panels of and redo them for the designs to match correctly.

The installation in general is simple. But not all the pieces are cut/planed correctly. So some pieces are uneven, just a bit of drilling can fix this though.

title: Love it
text: Beautiful dollhouse. My daughter love this house

title: This dollhouse is great, our daughter loves it
text: This dollhouse is great, our daughter loves it...  however, putting it together almost ended my relationship with my boyfriend.  It took the two of us almost 5 hours to put this together.  We're both extremely handy, educated and have set up many Ikea pieces together without any issues.  This thing is a BEAST to put together.  So many pieces and parts that looked like they were on correctly (according to the crappy black and white directions) only to find out it was backwards or the wrong piece/screw/etc.  The house itself is great quality and not extremely heavy - so while it is huge it can be moved fairly easily.  Just be sure to give yourself plenty of time to put it together (i.e. don't wait to put it together until Christmas Eve or the night before you're giving it to your child).

title: Great dollhouse!
text: We gave this to my girls for Christmas (3 & 5) and they absolutely love it!  It was so much fun to see the excitement in their eyes when they opened it up, and again when it was all assembled!  I knew it was big, but didn't realize quite how big after it was built!  My 5-year-old isn't even tall enough to see the attic floor!  But at least this is something they will have for a long time - it is well-constructed and I loved that I didn't have to plaster stickers on everything - a definite plus!  This is played with constantly in our house!  Just make sure you have a space big enough for it!

title: KidKraft Majestic Dollhouse - great buy!
text: My daughter is 6 yrs. old, and she really wanted a dollhouse for Christmas.  I chose this particular one after researching many, as it is large enough for more than one child to play (with a friend), as well as feasible for many sized dolls (12" Barbies).  The assembly took approximately an afternoon, and the pieces are durable.  The only drawback is one must place against a wall, as the product is top heavy and could fall on child or backwards if not placed properly.  My daughter loves it, and the furniture included is great...very sturdy!

title: Is it awesome looking? Sure it's pretty awesome and my kids ...
text:
This house was designed by the devil himself. So, so many pieces, color coordinated screws, multicolored floors and a colorless "instruction manual". Do you have an engineering degree? This should take you about 1 hours. Every day folk expect to spend 3 plus. Also the one dividing wall doesn't fit correctly in the slot.
Is it awesome looking? Sure it's pretty awesome and my kids are happy. But the lack of instruction and assembly earned this house a generous 3 stars.

title: Came obviously used.
text: As we unpacked the pieces it was obvious this has been put together before.  This resulted in some wear and many of the screws won't hold.  My 2 year old was able to pull out the screws and remove the roof over the garage.  Unfortunately we fell outside of the return window because we bought this and then decided to move 90 miles away when the house we wanted became available, so we waited until we were in the new house to assemble it, it is way too big to move and once assembled should stay that way.  Just be wary of the price and make sure you get a good look at it within 30 days so you can return or exchange if you get a used one too.  It is huge and beautiful, my lo loves it but she has been able to pull the furniture apart so just expect that.  I am disappointed a company would ship a used product without labelling it as such, very dishonest.

title: Perfect for 5-year-old granddaughter
text: Perfect for 5-year-old granddaughter. Quite large - be sure to check the dimensions. Four stars instead of five b/c some pieces came apart (lamp, door knobs, etc.) within a day. Easily repaired.

title: Super cute!
text:
So, I read reviews before buying. I knew better than to wait last minute build. And I'm glad I put it together early.

The instructions are not very detailed and I screwed up the orientation 3 times. Really ticked me off. But eventually I got it. But part of it might have been because it was late and I was tired. But their instructions need to be better labeled.

Some parts came broken and when it was together we tried to move it, it didn't feel very sturdy. Like we might break it.

But when it is up and stationary it is totally fine and is perfect for the kids.

title: Fairly easy to construct he said
text: Thus is a very big doll house that I gave to my granddaughter for Christmas.  My son warned me next time he will need a building permit! Fairly easy to construct he said.

title: Don't wait till Christmas morning to put together!
text:
So based on the great reviews of this dollhouse I decided to buy it, and had it delivered it to the house early December! I ask my husband if he wants me to put it together by myself because he works a lot, he says no, I would like to do that. I say okay, no problem we can do it Christmas Eve so our daughter doesn't find it.

WHAT A HORRIBLE IDEA!

My husband had decided to take a nap while I stayed up to make sure that our daughter was asleep. Waking him up was awful, and then I had to listen to a grown man complain because he didn't want to do it! Grrr....

It took us 4 hours to put together this dollhouse! It might have been quicker were we allowed to yell at each other(he really isn't a great team player) and it was difficult to put together! But, the look on my daughter's face was priceless when she walked in and saw it was worth it...but, find someplace to hide it so you can put it together before Christmas!!

title: LOVELY dollhouse!!
text: I am in LOVE with this dollhouse!  This was a Christmas gift for my five year old daughter.  As soon as we opened the box I was ooooh-ing and ahhh-ing over the furniture.  It is PRETTY.  I mean PRETTY PRETTY.  I can't get over the details.  It is very solid, very well made.  It took way too long to put together but that is operator error.  The one slight hitch was I didn't realize that the 6 was upside down on piece number 6, finally dawned on us there were two labeled "9".  Whoops.  Anyway it is absolutely a WONDERFUL dollhouse and I am so very pleased with it.  I have no doubt it will be enjoyed for years to come!

title: Awesome !
text: I bought this house for my little princess . She LOVES the house. It‚Äôs very tall she has to use a step stool to play with it. It took me a while to put it together. It was about 2 hours altogether . The instructions are clear, everything is labeled with numbers. Easy to follow. I loved the packaging everything was secured and protected . It has everything a doll house needs all the furniture and an elevator big enough for a Barbie. It didn't come with people figurines . I had to purchased those separate. I also added string lights as the final touch and I‚Äôm so happy of the outcome. My daughter is 2 1/2 and she wouldn‚Äôt come out of her room all day, she was super busy playing with the house. I highly recommend this doll house to any child.

title: So cute!
text:
We just received this in the mail today. It is a Christmas gift for our daughter, so we will not be assembling it until closer to Christmas; however, the box is damaged. It has several big holes in it, and parts of the doll house are visible. We are hoping everything is in perfect condition, and it puts together fine. I plan to update this review once the doll house is assembled.

**UPDATE**
This product turned out great! There are a few blemishes; a piece of the wood trim was damaged (nothing major), and some of the printed paper placed on the walls were peeling up around the edges (again, nothing too major) which ended up being hidden. The wood furniture is absolutely ADORABLE!! I am 5'4 and only about a head taller then this doll house- It's huge! Assembly is simple, just time consuming; it took about 3 hours. I would highly recommend this product.

title: Good looking.....BUT.....
text: I bought this doll house for my daughter. She liked it, and that concludes the story. That being said, it took us (me and my helper) almost FOUR trying hours to assemble it. The manual is helpful, but its illustrations lack clarity as to which side goes where--left or right, up or down, you get the idea. A tutorial video on Youtube will definitely come in handy. Also, an electric screw driver will shorten the process. I used a manual screw driver. Thank God I don't have to repeat this process, ever! Four hours isn't four minutes. It freakin' sucked!

title: My kids will love it!
text:
I bought this doll house for my daughter for Christmas and just finished putting it together. From the reviews it sounded like it took awhile and I wanted to get ahead of the curve and make sure no parts were missing well before Christmas. The doll house is very solid and well made, almost everything (furniture included) is made of sturdy wood that will withstand hours of play (and my kids are pretty enthusiastic players). Of the entire doll house, my only complaint is the stairs. While everything else is made of very sturdy compressed wood, the stairs are made up of cheap plastic. I'm still rating it 5 stars though because my kids will probably not care :) My daughter will love it!

As for the assembly do not wait until the night before, you will thank yourself. The directions are the kind with only pictures and no words. For the most part they are OK, but I found myself putting several pieces on backwards due to the illustrations not specifying the direction. Also, there are several areas where you match up the color on the hex screw with the color of the wall on the house, but they don't tell you which color to use. I know it sounds like it would be obvious, but there are also several unfinished hex screws that are silver, so if you don't guess right then you might end up with an ugly silver screw where a colored one should be. Nothing that was a huge deal but it made the process a bit slower. Also I had to bend at an awkward angle to screw in some of the screws, but that is probably just normal for something of this magnitude. It went together fairly easily, but would be a lot better with a partner, I did it solo.

One thing that I did really appreciate is proper alignment of the screw holes. I didn't have to try and force it to align or drill additional holes, which typically I have had to do with other put together items. That helped keep the frustration level down quite a bit.

title: Over all I am pleased with the price I paid.

title: Beautiful House BUT...update/ January 2013
text:
so, we bought this house for our two daughters (5 and 6) to open on Christmas Day. My husband thought it would be good to have the house done for when they wake up Christmas morning. While he was putting it together he noticed pieces missing from the house. I wouldn't mind 1 or 2 parts missing, but it is missing 9 pieces.

It is missing the elevator, chandlier holder, knobs and a bar to finish the roof of the side house. I called amazon and they tried helping me right away, but I just need those pieces and the house is perfect. KidKraft will be open on Wednesday so I hope that they can supply the missing parts. If and when I get those, I will change it to 5 stars..

PS: Amazon customer Services.. thank you so much for trying to help.

Update on the missing pieces. Called KidKraft and with no problem we received the parts to the doll house. It took about 2 weeks to receive but our daughters didn't mind. The house is now complete and both our daughter's play with it everyday. The house is not strong at all, but the girls are not rough so it should last.

KidKraft, Thanks for making this a great experience.

My only complaint was that the instructions for assembly were pretty awful. I am generally pretty good at deciphering instructions, but I had to resort to YouTube videos to help with this.

If you are purchasing this for younger children, you may consider purchasing a sturdy step stool for them to use. I am 4‚Äô11‚Äù and the roof reaches the bridge of my nose. Even with a step stool, my twins can still barely see the top floor.

All in all, this is a great purchase! My girls LOVE it and it is high quality and has lots of accessories. I do wish that the directions had been more clear.

title: The value of this dollhouse is just unreal!
text: My wife and I are thoroughly impressed and satisfied with this dollhouse. It is amazing! It‚Äôs literally almost the size of me (5‚Äô 8‚Äù) and I think that‚Äôs just hilarious. The value that you get with this is just unreal... I don‚Äôt know how they‚Äôre making money on this! The amount of items you get with the house along with the quality and size of the house itself... we‚Äôre just at a loss for words. Very impressed with it. The only things that they could improve on is the instructions. There were several times when I wasn‚Äôt sure how a piece was supposed to be facing or what color screw was supposed to go where. But that‚Äôs the other thing... the screws are colored for the different color parts of the house! It‚Äôs the attention to the smallest details like that that I‚Äôm talking about. You get so much value in this dollhouse. I ended up finding a couple on YouTube with a assembly video that I kinda looked at when I wasn‚Äôt sure about something and it really helped out a lot. All In all it took about 5 hours to assemble by myself, and it is so worth it. Again, the instructions could be more clear, like what way the pieces should be facing (labeling on the picture what color to which side), what color screw goes where.. those kinds of things. Maybe even an instructional video from the company themselves would be helpful as well. Or just search up some others like I did. Overall, extremely satisfied with it and would 10/10 recommend it to anyone!

title: Assembly NIGHTMARE!!!!
text:
So, I would say I'm a furniture assembly hobbyist. I look through the IKEA catalog dreaming of cam and barrel nuts. What I'm trying to say that I've together a thing or two in my day.

This may be the worst assembly of anything I've ever done. In all, this took me between 3-4 hours to assemble, which seems ridiculous for a dollhouse.

There are two main issues with assembly
1) Poor quality control / tolerance on parts. There were several times where bolt holes were off by a few mm. I suspect many people may not have the strength or patience to force these pieces into place.
2) The directions... my God the directions. So here's the thing: all the pieces are two-sided. If you're assembling a book case, it's relatively easy to understand where to put the unfinished/finished edges. The issue here is that all sides are finished, but the instructions give NO indication of the orientation the piece should be. You find yourself flipping forward several pages to try and figure out what you're doing... "oh... ok, in 90 minutes, this is going to be a bathroom, need to put the floor facing this way". Absolute nightmare.
3) I came up with a third reason... there are some legitimately difficult parts of the assembly. Parts, where you're lying on your side so you can use your leg to push in on the side of the house while you use your other two hands to assemble.

Another example: one of the last steps is screwing the door knobs on. OMG. So, the door knobs are like 1/2" wooden balls, predrilled to accept a screw. How any mortal in the world can hold that ball while trying to drill into it is beyond me. After failing (and stripping the first screw) I had to get a C-Clamp out.

4) Oh oh, and a fourth reason! So, the included hardware is nicely split into individual groups. So, there is a "I" screw. The issue is that some of the bolts/hardware are actually colored. But, because step 3 says to use 3 bolts, you'll use all the bolts from the little pocket that has 3 bolts, right? WRONG. You should have used 1 bolt from three different pockets so it could be color matched to the piece it was holding... you'll understand.

Once it's assembled it's an awesome dollhouse. It's like legit. Comes with a PIANO!! (wooden and unplayable of course). It's huge; it's sturdy; there's an ELEVATOR!! Your kids will love it. You will want to kill yourself putting it together.

title: Amazing house! Great quality and overall build
text:
I have to tell you, I was skeptical about a house at this price at this size. I figured it would be a decent piece that wouldn't last through the year.
I have a 2yo and 4yo, I have put enough toys together and tried to follow unclear instructions and left out a screwed or had to undo a part to redo it correctly. Not the case with this one. The parts were all clearly labeled and easy to follow along, other than step 5 and 6. Ibhad a little trouble figuring out the overlap of pieces.
The entire assembly took about an hour and a half, with some interruptions and trying to redirect curious little munchkins.
There were a couple of parts that were damaged, police included. Weird party was they were parts that were nestled inside other parts, none of the parts close to the box were actually damaged.
I called the 800 number, spoke to Scott, who was awesome. Just make sure you have the item number, batch number and part numbers ready so they can help you out. Sending out the parts, nohassle or hoops to jump through. Great customer service at KidKraft! I would definitely buy another one of their products.
Only area of improvement I would say is the clock and the chandelier. You have such a great quality product and then you throw in the plastic base for the grandfather clock that attaxhes to the wood body and then the chintzy plastic chandelier.

title: Huge house
text:
Ok so I took so many photos for future buyers. This product was amazing after all of the hard work. It wasn't super bad to put together but I'm also a person who likes to build things so if you aren't your in a rude Awakening.
So the instructions were great but need to be in color so it is more clear as to the direction each piece needs to face and the roof need arrows or something to be placed properly. I was t expecting for the house to be so tall so I took a photo with it to show the true size. I am 5'2 as you can see so the house is huge. But totally worth the buy.
I can t wait to unveil it for my daughter on Xmas. The screws and everything were I'm order with the instructions so if your patient and take your time with it it comes out perfect. I say do t screw so tightly tho I thought I was going to split a few pieces and break the house while building it.
Also they do need to adjust the cut outs some pieces o had to struggle to fit properly. They weren't totally accurate in the measurements I had to push and pull pieces to fit so the screw would fit in both holes to begin screwing the screw Into it.
All that aside it's a great gift. I would buy it again to be honest I love it and it's better than. Amy other doll house. Like I know it's a huge house. It size wise it's perfect. They should aim for an upgraded version to 2020 status but keep the same size they have created now.
Other than that I give it a great review.
Just be patient putti g it together a d be sure to screen shot a pic of the displayed house to refer back to as you build with the given instructions. That's what I did other wise I would have messed the house all the way up lol.

title: Beautiful
text: This dollhouse was everything and a lot more.

title: Go for It!
text: Second KidKraft that I purchased. I bought this for my 6 year old. They're sturdier than a barbie dream house.  But this house is extremely difficult to put together.  The directions are very basic and I was left figuring things out on my own. Due to this, I feel I messed up on some of the structures like the elevator. After 3-4 hours it was done and yes it looks great. It's very tall and my three year old has to stand on a stool to play with the very top room.  The garage does not hold barbie cars.  The structure is to small for a barbie car or jeep. The wood furniture that comes with it is very impressive. If you have space in your child's room, go for it!

title: Fun and cute
text: It's huuuge and every room something to look at. The furniture that comes with it isn't so great, but overall it's worth the purchase.

title: Good buy thanks

title: Great value, sturdy and beautiful
text:
We bought this for my 2.5 year old who immediately fell in love with it Christmas morning. She‚Äôs too short to see the top floor‚Äîand she‚Äôs tall for her age‚Äîbut we will use it to store stuffed animals until she can access it. We purchased this instead of the Barbie Dream House because with this you get a LOT more house for less money (we bought it while it was on sale for $93!) and it seems sturdier.
My husband put it together by himself in about 3 hours with a few breaks. He said the instructions were fine. He did not use a drill.
The bed and piano needed assembly but otherwise all furniture came put together. One piece, a small table, was broken. It was easy enough to glue the leg back on though (most furniture appears to be assembled using glue).
Barbies will fit in this house but the Barbie Glam Convertible does not. It‚Äôs a few inches too long and the garage doors won‚Äôt close. It doesn‚Äôt bother my daughter though!
The elevator is a bit difficult even for myself to easily operate but I‚Äôm hoping with some wearing-in it will glide more smoothly up the track.
My one issue is the bottom floor of this house could stand to be a bit deeper than the other floors, and stick out a few inches at the bottom. This would provide some stability; as it is, the house MUST be secured to a wall or it is in danger of tipping over if your child likes to climb.
All in all, excellent value for money and looks like it will last for years to come. My daughter AND my 5 year old son are having a blast with it!

title: Daughters LOVE it
text: My daughters were really impressed with this one. They had 4 different types I'd dollhouses in the past which they either got bored, broke apart. That doesn't seem to be a possible case with this one. With all the furniture that is included there are so many different ways for them to redecorate. The house is very sturdy, I don't see this one going in the trash in pieces!

title: Great value, sturdy craftsmanship.... best dollhouse!
text:
Great doll house. HUGE! 4FT BY 4FT. MAKE SURE YOU HAVE ROOM. Daughter needs stool for top floor. Very sturdy and good quality craftsmanship. All wood product, only plastic was the steps and some of the furniture pieces had plastic on them. Although some furniture had plastic, most the furniture is wood pieces and have fine details.

Assembly took an evening ,but maybe would have been 3 hrs if I wasn't stopping to do other things in between. All wood so be comfortable with screw driver, Allen wrench and cordless screw driver. Cordless screw driver is a necessity as holes dont conform to all screw sizes. Pre drilled but holes a little smaller than screw thread, so save your hands and use a cordless driver. Instructions were in black and white and detailed. All pieces numbered and screws come categorized in letters. Could have used more written instructions as sometimes it got confusing with so many pieces and screws happening. For the most part, each step of instructions were limited to minimal tasks which made it easy to follow. Also I used a picture from Amazon page of the house put together to get more assistance with making sure right pieces are being placed in the right direction or correct piece. Instructions would be better if it showed the pictures of had detail to ensure you were putting the piece correctly.

Pay attention to colored screws as they need to be used with same color background colors. All of them come mixed so it can be a challenge to find the right color.

Some pointers I learned. Don't tighten all the screws until you have done the next step. With predrilled holes you need a little wiggle room to align the next piece. If tightened if makes it hard to adjust next holes.

Also, holes for screw "I" are smaller than thread, very hard to get started. I found using power drill with Phillip's head directly on the hole and spinning it widened it enough for the thread to enter easier.

I did this on my own, but having a helping hand to help make sure pieces dont move. Need help to move the final product due to size.

Overall 4 yr old approved and worth 160 I bought it for. Fits her regular sized 11inch dolls. She does need a stool to see the top floor.

Hope this helps.

P

title: 2.5 months of use and warped and falling apart
text:
If you are just looking for the wow factor of something huge under the tree this dollhouse will do it. It's impressive in size and delightful in appearance when first put together.
My daughters are 2 and 5 and I was hoping this would last until they're too old to be interested but I doubt it will last through the year. After just 2.5 months of normal use it's not in great shape. Considering the price I'm very disappointed by the quality.
Some of the floors were wavy right out of the box when we constructed it, I was hoping once it was all together it may correct itself but it's gotten way worse. It's so warped and wavy now that the bathroom wall wont stay up. :(
My kids really wanted one with an elevator but it is so difficult to move up and down they never play with it.
I will edit or remove this review if Kidkraft offers to make it right.

title: Worth Every Penny
text: Easy to put together. Very sturdy and bigger than we imagined. We got this dollhouse for our 4 year old for her bday and she absolutely loves it and plays with it every day.

title: this thing is enormous
text:
Before you get this, be sure you have a plan for where you're going to put it. It's enormous and cannot be put away once assembled. If you're giving it as a gift, make sure both parents are good with it and its dimensions before you purchase it. And be really clear that you'll be okay with it if they say to go for something MUCH smaller.

This was given to us as a gift and speaking as a mom, I hate it. It's a foot taller than my kid, it dominates the only room we could put it in, and I can't get rid of it without its being a problem with both my kid and the giver. I was fine with "a dollhouse." I am not fine with this monster.

title: Perfect test for your patience.
text:

Then this is the doll house you want. I read a review that said it took only an hour to put this together. And Grizzly Adams had a beard.
Took me about 4 hours. But once it was together.....Wow, it really is amazing. The size is unbelievable. Pictures do not do it justice. Bought it for my five yr old daughter for Christmas but I had to give it to her early because I had no where to hide it.
Still trying to figure out how its going to fit in her room. Might have to get rid of her bed;)

title: Very quality!
text:
If you are thinking about buying this product, don't think anymore and just buy it. I have twin four year old daughters and they got this as a birthday gift back in March of this year. Daily (literally daily) they probably play with this for several hours and could not love it anymore. The house is the prefect size for barbie dolls/other similar sized dolls.

For the price point, this house is a steal. Knowing the quality of it, I would have paid more for it back then. Assembly is rather easy, you just need to take your time and take a deep breathe, it will take a while, but the end product is stable, and strong. I have had no breaks, issues, loose screws, etc in the 4 - 5 months my daughters have had it so far.

Note, even the furniture included with the house is super well built. Most of it is solid wood, and besides the legs on the piano falling off (easy to glue on) nothing has cracked, chipped, etc.

title: Five Stars
text: My granddaughters love it

title: Worth it.
text:
We ordered this for the Santa gift for my girls (age 2.5 and 4.5) this year and it is wonderful...and HUGE!

First off, it DOES take some time to build, and granted staying up til 2am on Christmas eve with a few glasses of wine does tend to hinder the construction a tad, it still took my husband 3+ hours to build. There are alot of pieces and one WILL need an image of the built house to reference... the directions do not tell you which side sometimes they want facing where, but none the less once figured out it was smooth, just long. It also helped to have the pieces laid out in number order before starting.

Now, when people write saying its TALL, they are not joking, its TALL!! I am 5'8 and the roof hits the tops of my shoulders. The girls have to use a stool to reach the baby's room in the attic! We will be using some pet. jelly on the elevator to make it a bit smoother but I don't think it needs any more than that to loosen it up.

The house itself, is very well made, classic looking, (so no fear of it becoming out dated anytime soon) and sturdy. Way BETTER than a Barbie brand house for more money and uses plastic for it's main posts. The furniture it comes with is bigger than the images give them credit for and they too are made of wood. Quality again.

I def would say this is a GREAT BUY!

title: Floors are warping
text:
We have had this house for less than a year. The floors are already bowing ! My 4 year old is not rough, this is just from regular play. We're super disappointed because now she doesn't even want to use it anymore. The furniture just slides to the middle of the floor.
It's a really cute house and the furniture it came with is sturdy..... but the floors are not.

title: You have to love KidKraft!
text: I researched a lot to find the best dollhouse for my daughter at the best price.  Amazon had this for an amazing price at the time I purchased it.  I own many KidKraft toys and I will continue to buy KidKraft products.  If you every have a broken or damage part, even after years of play, just contact KidKraft for the the serial number and parts needed and they will put them in the mail to you no questions asked!  LOVE IT!  This dollhouse if very large and dramatic.  It's every little girls dream.  It's big enough to work with Barbie dolls which was key for me.  My two year old son even loves it because it has a garage to park his toy cars in.  I compared this dollhouse to many others in the same price range and this was by far the most dramatic and highest quality.  I saw many in the same price range made out of cheap plastic.  I would recommend this product and most KidKraft products to anyone!

title: Get ready
text: We ordered this for our daughters who have been wanting a big doll house. It took over 4 hours for me alone to put this together Christmas Eve. The instructions could be better, it lacked a lot of detail but I was able to look at the Amazon picture to help get an idea. Our girls LOVE it, but not even a month in and it‚Äôs starting to peel in some spots, which I wasn‚Äôt expecting to happen.

title: Smooth as a baby bottom.
text: I just ordered this for Christmas for my 5 and 6-year old girls.  What I found is that the price on Amazon fluctuates frequently.  Over a period of two weeks, I saw this listed as over $200 to the lowest of $99.  I picked it up at $129 plus free shipping.  I'm guessing this is a hot product for Christmas, and as the holiday draws closer, the price drops.  At $129, I feel like I got a steal, even though less than a week later it dropped another $30!  That said, it came in a large brown box and was delivered within a few days.  The box said what the item was but didn't have any photos on the outside.  Fortunately, I read many of the reviews on this site and was prepared beforehand with some lube for the elevator, some wood glue, a hand drill with phillips head bits, a regular hand phillips head, and alcohol.  I put this together alone, with a wide open work space, low stress (no kids around), and with a nice frothy beverage.  From the time I started cutting the box until the time I was done putting it together was right aorund four hours.  Anyone who says they did this in an hour and a half alone is a stone cold liar - yes I said it.  I'm a pefectionist, but it's just not possible for a first-timer.  If I'd put together a few of these, I could probably cut the time some, but I hardly think I could cut it in half.  With two people and one of those two being skilled, maybe two to three hours...maybe.  That said, I did not have a single hiccup in building this thing.  The directions have no words, but the pictures are very clear.  There were a total of 29 steps...by the time I hit step 5 I was glad I had beer on hand.  But it was not hard by any stretch, just time consuming.  I wish the pictures in the instruction manual had some color photos...this would have helped on one or two of the steps, but I just looked up pictures of the product on Amazon on my phone and that was good enough to guide me.  All the parts were clearly labeled and numbered with a little white sticker, which was really important to the ease of putting this together.  The screws were all separated in a little vaccuum pouch, and were even color coded.  Again, this was extremely important.  All of the holes in the wood were in the right places and all of the wood was cut to the right dimension.  When contructing the wing on the left, there was one piece that didn't match just perfect, but I made it work with little effort.  When I started, I wood glued the elevator pieces, but stopped gluing there.  By the time I had the whole thing put together, honestly I don't think it needs the wood glue.  This thing is very sturdy, it's huge, and it's beautiful.  I'm totally impressed with myself.  I knew I was awesome, but I'm now in awe of myself for selecting this product and putting it together all by myself.  I can not wait to see the look on my girls' faces come Christmas morning.  Kidkraft made an awesome product in this doll house.  I did purchase the Kidcraft Professional Doll Set as an accessory.  Biggest warning I have for a prospective buyer is this thing is huge!!  Like if it falls on a kid, you seriously have to worry about brain bleeds and hospital copays.  I plan to anchor this to the wall, which likely will take more beer to do.  I have to transport this from my mom's house to my house now, which will require keeping the main house split from the wing and using a pick-up truck bed.  I have to admit, when I first opened the box, there was an alcohol-fueled tirade of choice expletives echoing throughout my mom's home, but once I set my mind to it, it went smooth as a baby bottom.

title: Nice Dollhouse. Set some time aside to build will ...
text: Nice Dollhouse. Set some time aside to build will take you about 1 1/2 to 2 hours to build. Over all well worth it!

title: Awesome dollhouse
text:
Gotta say that this blew me away when I saw it. It was for my 4 year old daughter and I wanted something larger scale & not fussy. Talk about large scale, she needs to use her stool to play with the top floor. She will definitely be able to use this for years and her 7 year old brother likes it too. It looks great in her room.
It took my husband several hours to get it put together so plan ahead. It is just heavy enough to be substantial, but light enough that you can pick it up & move it when needed. Pretty pastel colors & the furniture is awesome! Chunky tables & chairs, chandelier, bed, crib, toilet, floor lamps, etc. I wanted to get in there and start decorating.
They say that you can use 12" fashion dolls (barbies I guess)but I wouldn't recommend it. The celings are high enough but the furniture is not the right scale for dolls that tall. We ordered the [[ASIN:B001LU6RL4 Doll Family of 7 Caucasian]] which were a bit smaller than the furniture but that works better I think.
The box arrived with a hole punched in it and we found one of the main panels had been damaged but we called KidKraft and they shipped us a replacement piece free of charge within days. Word of advice: don't wait until the last minute to unpack & put together in case you have a similar problem. There are a lot of pieces densely packed in the box so look them all over well before you plan to present the toy.
In short: Amazon shipped a well priced good quality product quickly. KidKraft provided excellent customer service. It's all good.

title: Awesome dollhouse!
text: I bought this dollhouse for my daughter‚Äôs for Christmas. Everything was packed nicely and all the parts were included. Took me and my husband about 3 hours to assemble. It is nice and sturdy! My husband is 6‚Äô3‚Äù for size comparison!

title: Kids love it and that is what matters
text: It took a lot to get this doll house here! We had lots of issues but that's not what this review is about. The doll house is pretty good. One reviewer said it is flimsy until all the way put together and I'll agree with that. We took it up stairs and into my children's room without any issue or fear of it breaking. But the wall and ceiling decorations are a bit disappointing. The material is peeling off in places. The garage doors will not close. One over laps the other. I'm not sure if I did something wrong or if it's just warped. A lot of the boards were warped. But what really matters is my daughters love it. They used their own money and sold another big toy in order to buy this doll house. So I'm glad they love it. I would -NEVER- pay full price for this but if you can get it on a good sale (we did) then I'd snatch it up.

title: Would send it back if I could
text:
Pros- my daughter loves this set and it came with a lot of furniture. It looked great once it was put together and she plays with it every day (mostly on the bottom two floors of the house- she‚Äôs only 2 and this thing is tall!)

Cons- there is already drooping on the third and fourth floors and we haven‚Äôt even had it for a month. My daughter has never played on the fourth floor as she can‚Äôt reach it and she barely ever plays on the third floor. The construction offers no support under the flooring at either end (see pics) so it wasn‚Äôt an issue with how we put together. Also, it took HOURS to put together and my husband is a very handy person.

I would not purchase this brand again and I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to anyone. For over $100, you‚Äôd think it would have more support where needed. If it wasn‚Äôt such a hassle to put together, I‚Äôd consider taking it apart and sending it back. Wish I had bought the one for $50 more from Costco.

title: Daughter Loves It but I think I enjoy it more than her hahaha
text:
Measurements after I assembled:
HEIGHT: 4 Feet 5.75 Inches
LENGTH: 4 Feet 1.75 Inches
WIDTH: 1 Foot 2 inches (I measured the width of the roof because it is slightly wider than the house)
My daughter is 3 Feet and 9 inches tall and she‚Äôs eye level with the 3rd floor. She has a step stool to see the top floor which she doesn‚Äôt mind.
ASSEMBLING:
I read other people‚Äôs reviews about assembling it prior to the day you plan on gifting it. I highly recommend doing that. I timed myself and it took me 3 hours and 23 minutes to put the entire thing together. The instructions are slightly hard to understand and it‚Äôs not in color so that makes it more difficult. However, it‚Äôs not impossible.

I assembled it in my living room and then had to take it upstairs to my spare room to hide it since it was too big to hide in my closets. Surprisingly enough I was able to carry it by myself upstairs easily, in 2 pieces: The house and the garage separate. The boards are sturdy. There were 2 parts that took me a bit to fit together: 1. The roof doesn‚Äôt exactly line up but it‚Äôs not too noticeable
2. The garage walls didn‚Äôt line up with the holes exactly so it took a bit of finagling but you don‚Äôt really notice after it‚Äôs complete.
My daughter‚Äôs dolls are 11inches tall. I also attached Tea Lights inside to light it up.
I love this doll house and we play with it everyday.

title: Awesome dollhouse

title: Great for the money
text:
We bought this for Christmas 2014; I kept meaning to write this review earlier. I searched online for what seemed like hours for a sturdy but not astronomically priced dollhouse that the girls could move the furniture and dolls around in. I can't remember all the reasons I finally chose this one but I'm glad I did. Even though my oldest wanted a princess castle for Christmas, she (5yrs) and her sister (3 yrs) LOVED it on Christmas morning. It is taller than they are so it was very magical for them to walk in the room and see it. They play with it almost every day, and the furniture gets scattered among their other toys. The piano legs started breaking off about 4 months after Christmas and a couple other pieces are now starting to break 6 months after Christmas. The 1yr old also gets a hold of the furniture from time to time.

Putting the dollhouse together was a challenge but not utter frustration that made me want to pull my hair out. The instructions are pretty clear, every single piece is numbered. I forgot to put the back panel on the top floor so I had to go back a couple steps and redo it but it wasn't that big a deal. The three roof pieces didn't fit exactly correctly but I was able to force them a bit and no one seemed to notice (tall husband included). There were a couple other picayune hangups--the doorknobs were too difficult to get in place because they just wanted to spin with the screwdriver and I didn't bother to use a clamp to hold the knob still.

I would highly recommend starting this project a few days in advance; it took me a good 4 hours between having to finagle a way to hold pieces still while adding pieces (the three floors for example) and then just having butterfingers with the screws/ allen wrench. It would also have been helpful if my husband could have helped me but since I waited until the last minute I had to do it while he was at work. You also will need a large working space; I laid all the pieces out so I could see their numbers before starting to build and it filled up my app. 10x 15 living room.

I've moved the house several times when rearranging and it is light enough for me to move it alone; it didn't act like it was about to fall apart. I'm really happy with this purchase.

I'm glad that plastic came at a minimum in this dollhouse. The colors are very attractive and furniture well made.  As you can see from the picture, this house is huge! More than enough room for two maybe three to get in there and play. Even my older kids were enjoying this for a while. The girls are currently using Barbies for the house and the dolls fit well. The only real issue is that the dolls keep knocking the chandelier down when they "walk" by that room. My girls just remove it altogether. All in al this is a great gift! I'm glad Mom got it when she did because back at the beginning of December it was less than $150. A much better deal than those plastic dollhouses that are the same price.

title: Terrible Instructions
text:
The instructions are all pictorial. The pieces have numbers on them and the hardware is in individual compartments, labeled with "I", "B/H", "E" etc.
I am older so I am taking my time to build this. Been about 3 days now with breaks in between.
It is a good looking doll house, but the instructions are terrible.
While I think the packaging of the hardware is good, I would appreciate more instructions. For example, it immediately calls for "I" screws. Well that is great but there are FOUR different choices for "I" screw. Which one?
And for putting the "main" frame together you need the "B/H" hardware. And while some are colored coated, I am at a loss as to where I am supposed to use the ones that are just silver. So it is a crap shoot.
I am a mechanical minded person, good with my hands, and all I can think is there is NO WAY my spouse could put this doll house together.
The instruction could stand SOME written clues, advise or something!

title: Assembly Instructions are Inadequate!!!
text:
The dollhouse is solid and I believe it will last my Granddaughter for years to come. The furniture and accessories that came with it are also well built and should last for years with normal use by children. I am really looking forward to giving this to my granddaughter for her seventh birthday in a few weeks.

This thing is huge. I completed the main part of the house and then the ‚Äúside part‚Äù (the part has the garage). The garage is fully assembled and then attached to the side of the house. If you plan to deliver this house (and have a car) then I recommend that you wait until you get it to its destination prior to attaching the side. Even keeping it in two pieces I may have trouble getting it into my car. Like I said, this thing is huge!

I gave this a three-star rating simply because of the assemble instructions. Every piece has a small sticker with a number on it. This makes it easy to identify which piece is which. But BY FAR this had the worst instructions I have ever encountered. Example; many of the panels are two-sided. The instructions show a blank white image with the number on it. You have to figure out which side goes in which direction. I did find a video on YouTube that offered some help. The manufacturer's website has no video and the instructions shown there are basically the same as what came in the box. Many of the screws have colored heads to help them blend in. But, the instructions do not mention this, you have to figure it out on your own or have a bunch of different colored heads showing. It took several hours to assemble this dollhouse. Had the instructions been properly written, it should have been less than two hours.

title: You need to pay attention to the screw head colors/
text: I felt the quality of this product was great, but the instructions could've been more detailed.  Example: they don't illustrate direction on certain things, and you could possibly assemble a floor section upside down, and not know it until you add the walls.. Then you have to redo things, which cost time.  The recommended time to assemble this was 3 hours.  That was about right, but it could've took 2 hours with better direction.

title: Really big

title: Quality not quite as expected
text:
I spent quite a bit of time researching dollhouses for my daughter's 3rd birthday. I read many reviews and decided this was the house for us. With all the great detailed reviews, I thought we would be very satisfied with our purchase. Now I do realize (and the directions included a statement to the effect) that the dollhouse is handcrafted so there will be imperfections. However, there were many more than I expected, and during the 2 hour process of putting together the house, they began to really stand out. We have at least 3 major pieces (floors and decorative walls that have either folds or scratches in the top layer. They are fairly noticable even when the whole house was put together. We also have 3-4 corners that we will need to glue the top layer back to the backing. We experienced some smaller issues like holes not lining up, but they were much easier to overcome, and not visible once we completed the house.

I am disappointed to have so many major "imperfections" when we first received the dollhouse. I do realize that my daughter will cause such imperfections over time, but we were looking for a good quality dollhouse that will grow with her. We did expect the quality to be a bit better from the onset.

However, overall I am pleased with the dollhouse, the size is just as stated, perfect for a little girl to grow with. I love that accessories were included, and overall are good quality that will withstand some tough 3 year old playtime.

title: Great house! Small elevator issue
text:
My 3 girls love this doll house. They range in age from 2-7 and play with it together. They love the size and it's perfect for the barbies.

It took me a total of 6 man hrs to build it so be prepared. The main trouble was the elevator. It was easy to build, the problem is that the small plastic track and small bearings fix together too tightly. I could barely move it so I knew my girls wouldn't be able to. I actually had to "grind" out some of the track in order for elevator to move. After that, before I assembled the entire elevator, I ran the bearings in the track a good 50 times to wear them in. They are cheap bearings so keep that in mind.

Outside of the elevator issues the rest of the house went together smoothly. I has held up the my 3 girls so far. It's seems pretty sturdy for press board. The instructions were easy to follow and it even came with extra hardware.

Smart buy! Glad we got it!

text: Fantastic Doll House! I bought this for my 4 year old daughter for Christmas this year and just put it together last night. It takes about 3-4 hours and you just have to make sure that you pay attention. Is fairly simple, but you do have to be patient. I was not expecting it to be so big. Its going to be really fun for my to play with and grow into. I'd watch out for the price though. Its selling today for $279, and a few days ago it was for $249. I bought it for $165 in August but I've seen it as low as $135 last month (after black friday) so I'd just keep checking on the price. Great Product.

Worth the price, from grandpa's point of view!

title: Best dollhouse we have owned.
text:
Can not say enough how worth every single penny this was. We have owned multiple doll houses (frozen castle, Barbie dream house, monster high house) and this so far has been the favorite. This was a Christmas gift to my girls. (My 4 year old boy also plays with it with them). #1, it's HUGE. Measure your space to make sure it fits. #2, it was easy to put together. We didn't didn't struggle with assembly (and didn't need to YouTube directions.) And it is sturdy. #3, they play with it ALL THE TIME. Bc it's so big, all 3 of my kids can comfortably play without fighting.
It also comes with a ton of furniture and accessories so you don't have to purchase anything- other than barbie dolls. So glad we got this gift!

title: Love this!!!
text: Wow! I absolutely love this! We bought it from the Amazon warehouse, so I assume someone returned it because the box was damaged. However, everything inside the box was perfect. It took us about 2.5 hours with two people. The instructions do a pretty good job explaining. By combining it with a picture of the final product, we were able to put it together without an issue. The only confusion we had was which color screws were meant for which spot, but I love that they are made to blend in! Also, my husband broke one corner by being a clumsy, so be careful when moving it around! The furniture is great, and it will be years of fun for our daughter. I can‚Äôt wait to see her imagination. The details with this are perfect. It‚Äôs much bigger than we expected, even though we knew it was large. We bought 7.5‚Äù Lottie Dolls, which I highly recommend.

Otherwise, it is my daughter's center of attention and it is sturdy enough that I can leave her alone with it. Be sure to attach it to the wall though. It can tip over otherwise...

title: Adorable, but HUGE
text:
This dollhouse is adorable and my daughter loves it.
Assembly isn't difficult, but it is very time consuming. It probably took me a good 2-3 hours to complete. It's very sturdy. I don't worry about it falling over or breaking.
This dollhouse is much larger than I anticipated. My daughter is very tall for her age (3) and she brings her stool from the bathroom when she plays with it, otherwise she can't even come close to seeing in the top floor (the kid's bedroom).
This is definitely a house for Barbie-sized dolls. The furniture it comes with fits Barbies. I bought the Hape dolls, and they're WAY too small, but she plays with them regardless.
In the end, I'm glad we got this dollhouse, but if I could go back, I would probably look for something a bit smaller, because this looks quite ridiculous in our living room.

title: Everything a little girl dreams of
text:
This dollhouse is worth every penny! Comparing it against the Barbie houses and other dollhouses on the market, it offered the best price to feature/quality ratio I could find. I bought this dollhouse for my twin girl's 5th birthday and we were not disappointed what so ever.

This house is everything your little girl would expect: Durable, lots of wooden furniture, an elevator, lots of space for barbies and hours worth of enjoyable imagination everyday.

For the parents, this dollhouse comes packed in a thick shipping box, with Styrofoam inserts to prevent damage to the parts, easy to follow instructions with numbered pieces, a descent manual, basic tools, earthquake/tipping prevention straps, and a number to call with questions or for parts replacement printed in the manual. I recommend you have at least a good amount of space to build it, wood glue, quality Phillips screwdriver (not power as you can strip the holes or crack parts easily) and a good Allan wrench with some leverage on it to tighten things appropriately.

Building the dollhouse:
The dollhouse took me, a novice wood worker, a total of 4 hours and 29 minutes to build (Yes, I timed it). It may have been built quicker, but I used a lot of Elmer's E742 Waterproof Wood Glue to ensure things wouldn't fall apart or break (I highly recommend using wood glue on the non-MDF joints). As stated, each part is numbered with a sticker to help build the dollhouse, but the picture on the front of the shipping box was an invaluable aide in trying to determine the orientation of each MDF printed, Pine, or plastic piece. The hardest parts to build were the roof (don't screw everything down until you can align it correctly) and the garage/patio left side (lots of pine pieces).

The good:
- A very well made/durable and long lasting house with furniture
- Sturdy floors, roof and elevator parts
- Lots of printed detail on the MDF walls and floors
- Guaranteed to not disappoint your little girl(s)
- In case a part breaks within 90 days, KidKraft will replace it for free and without shipping charges
- Great customer support (M-F 8:30-5, Central Time)

The bad:
- The stairs do not stay in very well, is made of thin white plastic and will probably be the first to break for my kids
- The Elevator is stiff to operate, but works nicely if you put some dishwasher soap or petroleum based lubricant inside the rails
- The garage does not fit many of the barbie cars correctly as it is not deep enough to both put it in and shut the doors
- The chandelier comes off easily due to it being affixed with string around a piece of wood (I glued it in place instead)
- It wasn't free :P

Regardless of the downsides of this dollhouse as every product has them, my family is completely satisfied with this product and I completely recommend this dollhouse to anyone who wants something that will last for years.

title: My girls are playing in their room for the first time ever.
text:
This dollhouse is so big that my 4 year old is probably going to have to age a couple years before she can reach the attic. lol They are loving setting everything up, and they are using a lot of different dolls in there from tiny Sofia dolls to Barbies.

There are just a few things that my husband and I disliked. the first was the assembly instructions. Pictographs are fine normally, but there are screws that are the same size but color coded so we have some random colors in some places. It seems like we were a color short for the roofing. Really wish the directions had words with it for more detail!

The bedroom is a little small for the bed.

And lastly, one of the walls in the back is just a mm too small. The way the frame fit together made a hairline space. If that wall gets bumped too hard, we're going to be trying to get it back in there.

Took about six hours to assemble, but we were juggling kids and trying to figure out which color coded bolt/screw that's the same size as another color coded bolt/screw went where. Seriously, we're not illiterate. Put words on the directions.

I DO ADVISE TO FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS!! My grand daughters eyes lit up and mouth flew open, she was extremely excited. She saw all the wood furniture that came with it and she could also add her existing furniture to it as well. I'm 5'4" and the top of it comes to the top of my shoulders. My grand daughter has to use a stool to get to the top floor. Also, I bought her a Barbie car (not the corvette) and it doesn't fit in the garage. I LOVE THIS ITEM AND I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!!!
