title: Amazing quality for the price
text:
This thing is fantastic! I was not expecting such a quality product for the price. The details are adorable. There's a chandelier (with a little wood block to hang from), circular wooden door handles for the garage doors, just super cute.

It assembles easily as far as the actual putting together but the directions could use more detail. You're often guessing which way things face like with the floors and sides of the elevator. It's the first section you're assembling so you really have to look ahead and piece together how some of it goes together. It took us a long time to put together and I'm guessing we could have cut that down significantly if the directions were in color and showed all the holes on the pieces. For instance there are pieces that have a set of holes then another set 2 inches down but the directions only show the set of holes you're supposed to use for that step so again you have to look ahead and find where you use the other holes to use process of elimination. Not a deal breaker and totally worth the hassle for what you get in the end.

I would have expected to pay significantly more for what I got, like close to double. I've bought several KidKraft items and have always been happy with my purchases.

title: Nice gift.
text: Took 3hrs to put together (by myself) really nice dollhouse my daugnter loved it for Christmas. It is HUGE. but it fragile very thin wood.

title: Five Stars
text: My daughter loves it!!

title: It‚Äôs okay
text: My daughter loves it but it‚Äôs not made out of the best quality stuff and would be easy to break

title: Gift for girl
text: My girl loves it! It a good Christmas gift for your princess.

title: A NIGHTMARE to put together, but lovely once done
text:
This was the most frustrating thing I‚Äôve ever assembled. I am good at following directions and usually have no problem putting things together. This dollhouse, was a nightmare. The directions are black and white pictures that do not tell you which side of each piece to use or which color screw to use. Worse, the holes were not aligned properly on several pieces. Some of the pieces weren‚Äôt even labeled. The roof gave me the most trouble. The holes were mid-drilled on one or more pieces and I had to literally, drill new holes.

Once you manage to put it together, it is a nice, sturdy dollhouse that provides hours of endless fun.

RECOMMENDATION: use a power drill. I don‚Äôt know how anyone could do this without one but the instructions just say to use a screw driver. Trust me, with all the poor drilling they did, you‚Äôll want to have an electric tool for this!

title: Highly Recommended!
text:
First off, this thing is big! Make sure you are paying attention to the dimensions (52.75" H x 14" D x 51" W) and planning where this will go in your home. However, my 4 year old absolutely LOVES this doll house and has it FULL of dolls of all different sizes.

Construction:
The instructions are well thought out and easy to follow. You will build this one section at a time (elevator, roof, garage, & main house) and combine these as the steps progress. I would suggest making sure you have plenty of room to spread things out and organize your pieces and set things aside after you build them until they are needed again, which was typically within the next few steps. The hardest parts in putting this together were #1) matching the color screws to the room color... just takes a bit of planning and #2) the slide in back pieces as they like to pop back out of place and I have one now that is not holding tight despite everything else being in very well. That loose panel is the only reason I have this a 4 vs a 5 star rating. Lastly, #3) the door knobs for the garage door are a bit of a pain to get on. Careful though when tightening these down as I did break off a screw inside of the knob and there are not any extras. I was able to find a suitable replacement from Hobby Lobby that looks nearly identical to the original.

This was a Christmas gift so we constructed this in two phases. We built the main house and the garage separately in my in-laws basement and moved it home on Christmas Eve and attached the garage and roof. Overall construction time combined was about 2.5-3 hours but we were really in no rush to complete so it could probably go a little quicker. The main dollhouse took the entire back of my wife's Town & Country minivan with the third row folded flat to move so I don't see this fitting inside of a sedan, especially after being fully or even partially constructed so keep that in mind should you do as we did and store it elsewhere until Christmas.

Quality:
This definitely seems to be made from quality materials and everything fits together very securely, with the exception of the above mentioned panel, but I do not see this falling apart or not being able to withstand a lot of play (I've attached an image of this thing in use). As you start putting this together it may feel a bit flimsy but rest-assured that once completed it is sturdy and you will, or at least should, love it!

Shipping:
This thing is heavy! It is packaged well and surrounded by Styrofoam with the pieces stacked inside each other. Also, there is a huge picture of the dollhouse right on the box along with words telling you exactly what it is so hiding this can be a challenge if this is a gift.

Overall, I am extremely pleased with this. I am very thankful for the detailed instructions that helped my marriage survive yet another project. Should you decide to purchase this I believe you and your little one(s) will be very happy with it. I highly recommend it.

title: Dubious Quality
text:
I purchased this dollhouse for my two year old daughter for Christmas. After two hours or so of assembly, I realized the main frame of the dollhouse was off, making it impossible for the back walls (which slide into the frame) to stay put. So lame considering 1) took a lot of work to put together; 2) there's no way to fix it; 3) most importantly, those back walls are where you screw the straps into the dollhouse to safely anchor it to the wall. Without those in place (and in really securely) this massive dollhouse is a HUGE safety hazard. Emailed customer service at KidKraft and it's been a mixed experience. On the one hand, they've been prompt in returning my inquiry and directing me to order replacement parts (free of charge). On the other hand, they never addressed why this might be happening (had to guess which replacement parts to order) and they never apologized or addressed the inconvenience of spending all that time assemblying a faulty product or the inconvenience I will soon experience in disassembling and re-assembling it to put in their replacement parts. Such a bummer--and never mind that anticlimactic moment when you give your daughter a really special Christmas gift only to have to pack it away until it can be fixed.

The furniture seems well made and fun. It's pretty adorable. The actual housing structure quality seems dubious. The furnishings that are on the walls are stickers laid over cheap composite board. In some places, the sticker front is already peeling and it has had no use whatsoever. Honestly surprised this particular product is getting such good reviews.

title: A Favorite with the Grandkids
text: I bought one of these used 3 years ago for my 3 year old granddaughter.  I didn't know if she would even play with it but it was too good of a deal to pass up.  Well, she is still playing with it.  I purchased  the same doll house new and had it sent to our second granddaughter who lives in another state after watching her fall in love with it on a visit in August.  I heard from her parents that it did take two and a half hours to put together last night but she was very excited when she saw it this morning.  It is a very well made product and very tall.  At 3 years old both girls could not reach the top level.  It takes up quite a bit of space so make sure you have room for it.  One of the best toy purchases that I have ever  made.  Our older grandson even played with it using his action figures.

None of the 'decorations' peeled off, the elevator still works, and it is still as sturdy as the day we assembled it. I love that it was the perfect size for all types of dolls ranging from Barbie to Brats. My daughter loved the size and all the rooms it had. Worth every penny as a childhood staple!

title: Terrible Customer Service at KidKraft
text: We received the item with a damaged part.  There was no phone number in the instruction booklet to call for a replacement so I went to the website that was listed.  When I tried to order a replacement part, it did not work.  I then saw a phone number to call.  After waiting on the phone, I spoke to someone who told me that I had to use the website to order a replacement.  I told her I tried but it was not working.  She asked if I was using a computer or a cell phone and I told her I was using a cell phone.  She said that I had to use a computer as their website was not compatible with all cell phones.  I told her that would be inconvenient for me and asked if I could just give her the info to get a replacement.  She said that she couldn't do that and I could only get help on the phone if I tried using a computer and the replacement part was out of stock.  I told her that was very annoying and that it was terrible customer service.  Here I am with 1000 parts to put together all over the floor with one broken part and now I need to go through multiple inconvenient steps to get the part replaced (and somehow keep all this hidden until Christmas).  Eventually got to place the order on the computer for the broken part but I will never order from KidKraft again knowing that they have terrible customer service.  Would have been nice if the item was packed properly in the first place.

title: Loved it!
text: Gift for my great granddaughter's‚ù§

title: Ridiculous instructions manual in black and white
text: Ordered this around black Friday time. It takes a very long time to assemble. It took me 6 hours to put together. I have knocked off two stars because of length of assembly time, absolutely ridiculous black and white instructions which made too much of rework necessary and due to warping of the second and third levels on assembly and due to hole drilled on wrong side of product. I have since then ordered replacement parts from kidkraft (free) but it's going to be hell to disassemble and reassemble. My daughter loves the playhouse though.

title: Huge doll house!
text: I received this as a birthday gift for my daughter. This doll house was so huge! Be sure to have a safe, open space for your doll house when being built. Moving this doll house can be hard because it's not all that sturdy. Took me 3 hours to put together alone. Instructions were clear and easy to follow. My girls love it and play with it often. I love how it comes with extra barbie items such as beds, baths, chairs..etc. Overall, it was a great birthday present for my daughter.

title: It IS really big. But SO great!
text: I ordered this last week with no reviews to go off of. I was a little bit nervous to see if it would live up to expectation. I think it is really fabulous!! I am about 5'8" and the top of the house comes up to my collar bone. It is really big with more than enough room for my 3 daughters to play Barbie dolls and such. The furniture pieces are really sturdy, and I am really excited to give it to them from Santa. Yes, the box comes unwrapped unless you change the gift option. It is a LARGE cardboard box, but no color picture on the side. Just a printed drawing. I was concerned about the elevator not moving easily, so when I built the house, I didn't tighten the screws on the elevator all the way. It slides up and down pretty well. It's not really smooth, but better than tightening them so tight that it has to be forced up and down. I wasn't too sure about this house before I bought it, and I was fully prepared to send it back, but I am really pleased. If you are on the fence about this, I would say GET IT! Fantastic price for how big the house really is. It really does take a while to put together, and I would recommend two people, but no other problems to report.......except that now I find to find a place to put it after Christmas. It is really that big! Good luck all!

title: Pure Magic
text: We purchased this dollhouse for our 3 yr old granddaughter, because she has a fabulous imagination and loves to play house. It is very big, you need the room for it, it took 4 hours to assemble (not a big deal),the directions were fairly easy to follow. And when she unwrapped it she jumped up and down 3 times then stopped.....she was speechless. That was the best review you could get, ans as my husband said, between the price and the work assembling it...."That made it all worthwhile!!" She spends hours with it when she's here, she gets lost in it it is so great!! A little girls dream. She needs a stool to reach the top floors because it's 20" taller then she. We were,also,impressed with the nice wood furniture that came with it. This house will be with us for a very long time, don't think she'll ever tire of it.

I'm 5'7" and it's higher than my chest. My daughter is a very tall 3 year old and can't play with the top floor but it's doesn't matter. There's so much else to play with. Also it's the nursery in the attic... who puts a baby in the attic??? Baby sleeps in the mama's room. My niece who is almost 2 loves it too. It will definitely grow with them. Days the box isn't disguised so I had it delivered to a neighbor and had to get it to my house (it's really heavy) but there are no pictures on the box.

Although you could clean a plastic one with a damp cloth, it would not be a good idea with this one. Our foam board(picture part) is starting to slightly peel, from Barbie cars parking in the garage and general use. We have no issues with our elevator.

Luckily, our saving grace was that each and every part was numbered correctly.

Some parts don't necessarily fit properly. We had to cut pieces and make holes a little bigger with power tools. You definitely need something legit to get the job done.

When it was all said and done, it was great. She loved it. And is having a ton of fun playing with it!

text: I got this on sale an all three of my kids love this (boys 4 and  6 and girl 2). They play with it pretty much everyday. The door knobs on the garage came off while we were putting together, but we super glued it. The elevator kept getting stuck so my husband put something to help it glide easier. title: Beautiful Dollhouse - Missing pieces
text:
This dollhouse is impressive! I got it as a Christmas gift for my 3 year old. It is a beast to put together. The directions are less than to be desired, so it took him about 3 hours (and he is quite handy). We received the item with multiple missing pieces: the staircase, as well as 1/3 of the furniture. Amazon was not helpful at all with my issue. Make sure you go to the KidKraft Website. Apparently this is a common issue with their items, as there is a whole website dedicated to wrong parts.

Had I received everything I needed, this definitely would have gotten 5 stars (maybe less if you asked my husband since he had to put it together), but the added stress of missing pieces and bad customer service on Amazon's part on Christmas Eve makes me give it 3. It is definitely a beautiful dollhouse, though!

text: The pieces were marked wrong and the instructions were SO bad and in black and white that I had to go to amazon to look at the dollhouse in color to see what piece went where.  It took two adults about 7 hours to put it together.  The shipping was not so great with the box messed up and broke all the way thru.  Somewhat decent sturdiness  As with all doll houses, You get what you pay for.  This one is not the worst and no where near the best. The stairs on this does not get screwed in, they just lay there and cave in a little when Barbie walks up them.  I gave it a 3 star only because it is cute.

The side board for the garage had dirt/mold on it. I kept the product and did not know where to file a complaint at. Other than those few things it's a great dollhouse. My daughter plays with it for hours!

title: Excellent quality and design
text: This is a very high quality (and very large)dollhouse.  Having just assembled it I was very impressed with the quality of the materials, the clarity and logical layout of the instructions and the attention to detail within the product. As an example - all of the different screws and hardware are laid out on a shrink wrapped card, individually labelled, and all of the screw heads are carefully matched for color with their position on the dollhouse. The finished product looks great.

title: So Disappointed!!!
text: I bought this for my Daughter this past Christmas so it hasn't been long and the top floor is bending upward (buckling) which has caused the panels that divide the rooms to fall down because they no longer reach the groves,  looks horrible!  she still plays with it but this was not a cheap dollhouse not to mention it took 4 hours to put together  I expected it to last for some time.

title: Quality could be better for the price
text: Not the Kidkraft quality I have come to expect.  Many panels have the images close to peeling off.  Also in general it doesn‚Äôt seem very sturdy.  Thankfully it came with anchors.  It took my husband and I about 3 hours to assemble.  The instructions aren‚Äôt clear as far as screw color you should use.  So just as PSA to scope out where you‚Äôre putting in screws and if you need a colored one.  We made it most of the way and realized we had white screws left.  I think for the price it could be better quality, but I think it will likely last as long as needed, just don‚Äôt see this being a hand me down item. title: Worth the trouble to put together
text: Do not wait until the wee hours of the night on Christmas Eve to put this together!!! My husband worked on it alone for about 4 hours until he was ready to give up and came and got me. It really is a 2 person job. If you don't have someone holding it together while you are attaching one of the 85 screws...it will break!!! We worked on it together for about 3 hours. The instructions have NO words and this makes it that much more challenging. Each piece is numbered and the screws/nuts/bolts are alphabetized. It is good for the neurons...maybe it will prevent Alzheimer's. Once we got it put together it was wonderful. I have a 6 y/o and a 2 y/o who absolutely love it. They have to use a step stool to get to the top floor nursery. It is worth the trouble to put together.

title: Kids are still enjoying it.
text:
Overall satisfied with the product. I wouldn't say the quality of the parts are very high (some things don't fit flush, etc.) but nearly all the parts, including the furniture are wooden which gives it this classic feel. I am also surprised at the dimensions of this thing. Without the detachable garage this mansion is about 4 feet by 4 feet.

Give yourself ample time to put this together. From unpacking the box to casually putting each piece together it took about 2.5 hours to put together.

Recommendations:
Each piece is numbered 1-72 (more or less). If you have the space, lay them out in numerical order. The instructions will have you grab piece 5 and then 64 or something like that and having everything laid out in numerical order will greatly speed up the assembly of the product.

The product contains several small wood screws to attach pieces together. Some of the screw heads are colored. Silly me didn't realize that the colors should match the color of the piece you are screwing that into until I was well into the assembly. For example, the blue roof should get the blue wood screws, etc. So keep that in mind. Don't just reach for any wood screw and use that to attach pieces.

As I mentioned before, this product has A LOT of pieces and give yourself ample time to assemble. There will be moments where you will need someone to help you so have a helper close by. I took my time getting everything together and it took me about 2.5 hours. I would imagine it would take a more industrious/motivated person about an hour.

Overall very happy with the product and now Barbie finally has a home :P

title: Overall a Positive Experience (if you schedule enough time)

This thing is huge, and my 4 year old granddaughter won't be able to reach the upper level but I got plenty of stepstools since she's a peanut anyway. Requires medium skills (someone who knows not to overtighten screws; I had to drill one missing hole but no biggie). The only change I would suggest to the manufacturer is to include a color picture in the assembly instructions, as I had to print one from the internet to make sure that I assemble the parts on the right sides and directions, but everything is well numbered. Overall, it was a very positive experience.

title: Product Assembly Impossible due to Defect
text:
I ordered this product in November and held onto it since it was a present for my daughter... her main Christmas present (most of her other gifts were for this Doll House). Due to it's size I had to take a risk and wait to assemble it on Christmas Eve because I had no-where to hide it. Can you imagine my despair when I realized 5 holes were missing on one of the 42 structural pieces (part #8). Part #8 is a KEY PART, the part that is a main sidewall and has the elevator attached to it. The holes simply were not there. Somehow they didn't get drilled. I had to fabricate the thing together with screws and this made assembly a real pain and I ended up having to stay up until 1am putting it together. I haven't contacted KidKraft yet since today is Christmas and they are closed but I will call tomorrow. I will update this post with how the company makes this right or not.
I sure hope this didn't happen to anyone else. How disappointing for some Mother or Father in the same situation as me but with no solution to fabricate it together... yuk! Doll Houses are extremely important items for little girls, I'm thankful mine was not disappointed on Christmas morning. My point? Doll House assemblers and QA professionals should take their jobs very seriously because to the people who purchase them - they're extremely important! - just sayin'.

title: Happy 7 year old
text: Bought this for my 7 year old for Christmas since she was asking for a Barbie Dream House... She was so excited to see this under the tree in the morning that it seemed like she didn't even care that there were other gifts! Took the elves quite some time to build. title: Satisfied with my purchase.
text: 9/19/18. I'm a 59 YO grandma and I got this for my 2 granddaughters.  I have NO "handyman" experience, but I put this thing together by myself.  If I can do it, you can.  Was it easy?  No, but I took my time (about 7 hours over 2 days).  The instructions were NOT very helpful.  I had to pause frequently to take a look at the YouTube on-line video or just to look at the picture so that I would understand how things went.  Yes, I made mistakes, but I just backed out of what I did wrong and re-did it.  I am impressed with the sturdiness of this dollhouse and very impressed with all of the furniture/items that come with it.  Once I got things to fit together correctly, the thing is "solid" and I believe it will give my granddaughters a very long time to enjoy it.  Note:  from reading other's input, I did grease the elevator track with some Vaseline on a Q-tip.  However, I also used a little WD-40 directly on the screws that connect to the elevator compartment, and I DO NOT recommend that you do that because it can soak through the paneling and show up as an oily spot.  I learned the hard way on that.  I cannot stress enough to give yourself PLENTY of room to put this thing together.  Spread all of the pieces out and pay attention to what you have.  Most of all -- take your time and think about what you are doing and how it's supposed to look in the end.  If something doesn't look right, that probably means it is NOT right.  Would I buy this again?  Yes, definitely.  Also, from my point of view, Barbie-sized (12 inch) dolls are a bit too big for this house.... yes, they will "work," but if you can find dolls that are more along the size of Barbie's little sister, Skipper (a couple of inches shorter), those work better.  Just sayin.  My youngest granddaughter is only 4 months old, but the older one is going on 4.  When she saw this dollhouse, she was so excited and happy, it made all the sore fingers and difficulties worth it!  Good luck.

title: love it

title: Great Product - Horrible to assemble
text:
My overall takeaway is that it seems like a great product but was horrible to assemble. It was obvious that the person that wrote the installation instructions had never actually assembled it themselves. So here are my takeaways:

Great Product
Looks good in pictures; looks even better in person. Quality shows in the small details with the quality of the furniture which is really nice. And furniture is expensive for these things and sold separately could easily be $75-100 in of themselves. So if you can get this total thing for under $200 (and I got it for around $170), then it's a steal. Seems very sturdy and I'm not worried about my daughter breaking it. So from a safety perspective, seems great. Word of warning, it is tall so do make sure to use the enclosed attachments and attach it to the wall. Since it's so tall, kids may try to climb it and despite being heavy, I can see it toppling over if someone tries to climb it. And it's heavy enough to cause SERIOUS damage if it fell on your kid. Just attach it to the wall and then don't worry about it.

HORRIBLE Installation
Like I said, obvious the person that put it together, had never put the product together. Honestly, the instructions were clearer in comparison to many products as far as the particular items that you should put together BUT they did a horrible job showing which sides to put the products. So for example, there were multiple times I attached something and then later in the process when I could better visualize how the product was supposed to work, I had to take it apart and switch something that was backwards or upside down. So definitely try to lay things out to visualize how it should go beforehand. Because it's not obvious how many of these should go. So be careful. Also, annoying things like making the packet that contains all the screws open on the back so every time you flip it over to find let's say the "G" screws, the "D" screws would fall out of the packet. Just the small details like this show that the company handed off the design to someone else to throw together the installation stuff and they didn't pay close attention to details.

As far as putting it actually together, there were a couple holes that were slightly misaligned but you could force the screws through to take care of it. All in all, it took me probably 3.5 frustrating hours to get it together. Once you get the basic frame up though, it gets a lot easier. And just so you don't think it is just a lack of skill that made it difficult to put together, I've put together numerous furniture from Ikea, a crib, changing table, bookshelf, bedside table, and play kitchen all in my daughter's room. So I consider myself a bit of an expert. And this was worse than average to put together due to the ambiguous directions. Actually physically putting it together though wasn't that bad.

Other takeaways:
REALLY Big - bigger than you realize. So definitely measure where you want to put it just to make sure there is room for it in your house.

Customer service seems to be pretty good. The little clock furniture item was slightly warped and broken so it wouldn't stand up and I very easily ordered a free replacement online. Great website. Hopefully I should get the replacement in around 10 days.

title: Huge!!! Very cute and super sturdy, set aside A WHOLE DAY

title: Couple construction hiccups but great finished product
text: Construction makes perfect sense, just look closely at all the parts before you start and have a color photo of the finished house to reference. Anyone who can read and use a screwdriver can assemble this in 3hrs or less. I did it in 3 with no help. Some of the holes didn't line up but I either forced it into place or pushed hard enough on the screwdriver to create fresh holes in the wood. Part of the staircase rail was cracked off but I put a dab of wood glue in it and you'd never know. Oh, and a hinge on the shed door was installed backwards at the factory, switched it around. So, I guess 4 stars on construction and 5 stars on the end product that my daughter will love.

title: Great product for the price. Watch out for garage assembly.
text:
My pictures don't do it justice since I had approximately 5 seconds to take a picture before she absolutely destroyed it. I wanted SO badly to give it 5 stars. I really did. Especially since the price is amazing for everything that came with it. The only reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5 is the garage. The rest of the house requires assembly. The garage is partially put together. In our case, the put together pieces made it that much harder to build. They were wood glued in some places, and in others they only relied on pegs. Either way, the main pieces of the garage were crooked. It took us a lot of extra time to even it all out. Regardless of the construction errors, we have many great comments. The furniture was abundant (even though the colors didn't always match the images provided). They were great quality. Everything but the garage was perfect. The garage was not only hard to build, but many pieces (like the garage doors) had started to peel. Aside from all of my adult complaints, my girls love it. Which makes all of my days that much better.

I purchased this item at full retail price, and am happy I did.

title: Love, love, love this dollhouse!!
text:
I am having a difficult time trying to put into words just how beautiful this dollhouse is but I will try! :)

The box was massive and very heavy - I am not sure if my husband was exaggerating when he said the box was 70 lbs or not. Yes, I am aware it says it in the product description somewhere but I am not looking it up...ha!

I wanted to assemble it myself (girl power!) and I was successful after setting aside 4-5 hours! All I needed was a Philip's head screwdriver (not included) and the Allen wrench (included). The screw-heads even match the color of the house that you're attaching it to! So nice! I did wish that the manual was in color and not black/white - but I figured it out without a problem.

The house is MASSIVE! It is great quality for the price - which includes a good amount of furniture. I will be including a picture of my husband standing behind it. Keep in mind that he is 6'3" and it comes up to his chest!

I highly recommend this product to anyone who wants to have years of dollhouse fun with their little one. I love it so much and we are having a wonderful time with it! I wrote on the back of the house a little note with the date that I built the house for my daughter. I hope she will enjoy reading it someday while playing with her daughters, sons and grandkids! This may be the best toy purchase I have ever made.

title: Awesome dollhouse-you won‚Äôt regret buying it!
text: I‚Äôll admit when reading the reviews I was nervous about having to assemble this dollhouse. Yes, the instructions are not great, HOWEVER once I got over the hump of figuring out the side panels, and a few moments of cursing under my breath, the rest of the assembly went very smoothly. I strongly advise having a few pics of the dollhouse on hand for reference and a YouTube video I saw helped me figure out the side panel issue (the panels overlap to be screwed in)-after that it was not hard at all to put the house together. The screws are all  very clearly labeled and the parts of the doll house are numbered. I only used my own Phillips head screw driver and the little tool provided. It took me 2.5 -3 hrs to put it all together. I‚Äôm a mom, not an engineer-you‚Äôll be fine. The dollhouse is awesome! And it comes with so much furniture and even a mini chandelier to hang. I was contemplating on getting  another brands ‚Äòdream house.‚Äô But so glad I got the majestic mansion dollhouse-I freakin want to play with it now. It‚Äôs hidden in a basement closet assembled ready to bring out for Christmas.

title: Buyer Beware
text: Buyer beware.  This looks amazing and I suppose once it it put together it could be fun - but getting there is a horrible ordeal.  First, it comes in an incredibly heavy box with every single piece separate.  That in itself would be fine if it included anything even like IKEA instructions - but it doesn't.  Pieces need to go in very specifically, however the instructions are not detailed or in color (which would help tremendously when dealing with multiple bolts, screws and holes.  The only way I could get this together correctly is by really putting on my puzzle solving hat and consulting the picture on the Amazon page.  No picture is included on the box or in the instructions.  As you can tell from the pictures on amazon - they are from one angle only - so a lot of guess work is needed.  Now let's get to the craftmanship - shoddy all the way around.  Cheap bolts and screws, pieces that do not line up - some pieces that have been assembled in the factory don't line up - or aren't flush as they should be.  Places where you need to insert fastening bolts into holes were impossible because epoxy from the factory had dripped into the holes.  So you are halfway through this incredibly long build - to find out that you need to disassemble it to remove this crud from the holes before you can move on.  The paint used on the screws to blend with the walls and furniture pieces are not the same paint color.  Cheap all the way around.  3 hours of my life I will never get back.  Not to mention, when you have an incredibly excited 3 year old jumping around trying to help - it becomes incredibly frustrating to need to have her leave the room - just so you can concentrate enough to get this thing together.  I did this by myself, by I advise a second person to help.  It is incredibly big and awkward to assemble.  Get it pre-assembled or forget about it.

title: Two man job
text: You definitely need two people to do this.  But don't fret, it is worth it. ALSO THE SCREWS ARE COLORED TO MATCH THE BACKGROUND!! I did not realize this until I had already used 4 of the screws in a spot I should have used the other colored screws. Beware...the instructions are a bit tricky. It's just pictures but since the walls are double sided you have to use your brain and visionary skills. Tap into the craftsman you are! You've got this! It comes with an Allen Wrench but I suggest having a power drill, it'll make the screwing faster.  I will reiterate a comment I read, DO NOT ATTEMPT TO PUT THIS TOGETHER THE NIGHT BEFORE A BIRTHDAY OR CHRISTMAS, YOU WILL FAIL.  I started this 3 days prior just because we were busy and still had to work on it diligently the night before.  But like it said, it's all worth it. Somehow my 3yr old did not recognize the 5' tall object covered in blankets in our living room by the Christmas tree (because it's always been there right?!) title: Incredible dollhouse! Worth 3x the money
text:
This dollhouse is incredible. The build quality, attention to detail, and value make this worth three times what you actually pay for it.

The build quality is great, it is super sturdy. I was really impressed by the attention to detail, even the screws that hold it together match the color of the rooms that they are in for crying out loud. As far as value, it comes with a whole house of furniture that is really well made wood furniture. The individual pieces of future should be $5-10 each. You are basically getting $100 worth of free furniture when you purchase the house. Also, this thing is BIG. My two daughters (and son when my daughters let him bring spiderman) can all play on it at the same time. If you have ever seen kids fighting over a toy, you know what a big deal this is.

It took me about an hour and a half to put together. It goes together like a piece of IKEA furniture. Well thought out and hex wrench included!

Spend the extra $20 and get this wood one that will last forever and avoid the pink plastic Barbie one that feels like you could break it by looking at it funny.

title: Fantastic and worth it.
text: I ordered this from Costco the day it went on sale (thank God because they don't even carry it now, one month later). I got it for $139 (down from 169) with free shipping so I was shocked to see the price here of over $300.  I would not have bought it for that much simply because we are not rich. However, I do think it is worth it. I read all the reviews on it beforehand and was a little concerned about the "wallpaper" issue some seemed to have. Maybe that was an older model because there is no wallpaper. All scenery is printed directly onto it. This was easy to assemble with 2 people (and we are severely challenged in this area normally).  The only thing I didn't like was the way the screws were packaged. I think if they put them in separate bags, it would have been better. I also agree with the reviews about the elevator, but we just put some grease in it and it is fine.  It is HUGE...much bigger than I thought but it DOES come with wall attachments so you can attach it to a wall and living in earthquake land, I was glad about that.  I had an issue with the refrigerator, it was broken in the packaging but it couldn't have been easier to replace. I went on the website and put in my item number and address and boom, it is set to be delivered. They didn't ask for a receipt or anything. So I am not clear about the 90 days other are talking about.  I cant wait to see my 3 year old's face when she sees this for Christmas. She saw it in the Costco catalog and has asked Santa for it and talks about it constantly. I am just thankful I got it when I did!

title: Worth the money!
text: This dollhouse is lovely. It came in a big heavy, box with a lot of peices.  To help with assembly, all pieces have a little numbered stickers.  I organized by number and followed instruction booklet.  Nice touches are the fact that all the screws are divided into type and in order of use.  Also many of the screw heads match the color of the dollhouse or furniture making it easier to identify exactly where to screw it together.  It took 2 of us 3 hours to assemble and a few times we had to disassemble an area that had been put together incorrectly.  The furniture is very well made and sturdy!  We purchased the kidcraft family and some Frozen barbie type dolls.  My 5 and almost 3 year old love it.  It is so tall that they can't really play in the top room but they use it to store some things.  It is wide enough to have plenty of room for 2 children to play at the same time.  I expect to have this for years!

title: WOW!  I was surprised when I was finished!!! NICE PRODUCT!!
text:
Granddaughters are going to love it. Better built than my expectations. NOTE: When you are constructing this monstrosity, take your time. Check to ensure that the holes line-up (and they do!), that the print is on the right side, and don't force anything (i.e. roof will line up and since its is on an angle, let the screws draw themselves into the pre-drilled holes). The instructions are simple and almost clear on what to do. It will not show you the "print" on the part you are installing. I used the box and a YouTube video on this mansion for my install. I watched the video and checked the box before finalizing my install. The reason is that this product is mainly wood fiber and pine. Both are soft woods and if you stress them during install, it will leave a weaken joints and time will wear them down faster. After all my joints were tight, I checked them again and made sure all joints, etc. were aligned before I applied my final torque to the screws. Not to tight, just snug. The final result was a sturdy and beautiful dollhouse my grand kids will adore and probably have for a very long time. Nicely done KidKraft.

NOTE: During shipping, my mansion patio roof panel was scratched in a spot to the wood. I contacted KidKraft and within four days, I was placing the replacement roof on the doll house. Wow, just WOW!! That is customer service!!!! THANK YOU!!!

title: Excellent Quality down to the screws!!
text: This dollhouse is magnificent!  The directions were clear, though some clarification was needed through looking at the artwork on the dollhouse itself.  My husband and I put it together in about 2 hours.  We were very impressed with the attention to detail...the screws were even painted to match!  We were originally looking at some other KidCraft dollhouses but noticed that none of them had a nursery (what little girl doesn't want to have a nursery for her dolls' babies?).  The fact that the mansion had an elevator, stairs and a garage with doors sold it even more!  Excellent choice for most ages, we have a 6 year old and a 2 year old that both enjoy it (though they have to use a stool to access the attic).

title: For the price, this dollhouse is in a class by itself.
text: I bought this dollhouse after returning a similarly priced Barbie house to a local store. The Barbie house was made of plastic and we returned it because it had broken pieces upon opening it. The KidKraft Majestic Mansion Dollhouse is in a class by itself. I knew when I opened the box that I had bought a well made, sturdy product. The quality of the pieces was way better than I was expecting for the price. Almost every piece is made of wood. The packaging is such that every surface piece is protected from scratching by individual pieces of padded paper. It took me about 2 hours to put this together by myself. I was taking my time and recovering from a recent wrist fracture so that's probably longer than it would take most people. The complexity of assembly was low. There are two main types of hardware in use and maybe 6 different types total, so you don't have to pick through a dozen types of screws to determine which one to use, go back later and re-assemble it when you realize you used the wrong one, etc. My daughter was absolutely thrilled with the end product, and we consider ourselves fortunate that the previously purchased Barbie house was dead on arrival, because we ended up with a much better dollhouse. My one complaint / suggestion for improvement is on the anchor that is used to tether the dollhouse to the wall (to keep it from tipping). The placement of the bolt/nut is in a hole in one of the walls on the third floor. With a significant pull on this item, you could displace the wall - it would have been better to put pre-drilled screw holes in one of the solid wooden pieces.

title: Big enough for full size 'Barbie" dolls
text: We just gave this to our 7 year old as a Christmas gift. She went CrAzY! I had no idea this thing was so big! Although not 'Barbie' Brand name, I find it is better quality than their doll houses, sorry but true. And the full sized 'Barbies' fit with ample room! This house is not plastic but rather made from wood and put together with cabinet quality machine-grade steel fasteners! No silly plastic push-pins and such here. Very impressive quality! I have seen cabinetry that was not built as well as this doll house, Seriously! The fit and finish is amazing. Comes with complete and detailed instructions for assembly. It will take You about 1- 1/2 to 2 hours to put it together. Everything is detailed in the assembly instructions and I mean the locations of every nut, bolt and screw to include the color-coded painted ones that match the doll house wallpaper so as to hide them!!! If You can read and turn a screwdriver then You can put this doll house together, it just takes a little time. And my little girl is worth it! It does not 'snap' together. It comes complete with a full set of furniture made from real wood! Even the bed has a soft attached mattress covered with cloth. Amazing value for the price! In this day and age of disposable junk it is refreshing to find something of such value. I venture to use the word 'Intrinsic'. It comes completely packed to a 'T' so as to not scratch the detailed finish. Unload the box carefully, don't just turn it over and dump it on the floor. The box is heavy and You may need some help moving it. After I put hers together I simply pulled it along the floor over by the Christmas tree, so You don't need to pick it up to move it. This doll house will last her for years, no doubt. I give it 5 Stars!

title: Great Toy
text:
The kit is beautifully packaged, way above average, and all the pieces and hardware are numbered or lettered. And they give you extra hardware in case a screw gets buried in the carpet or your little helper flushes a bolt. Below are a few things I encountered that don't show in the YouTube assembly videos.
Steps 1 and 2. You have to put pieces 1 and 3 into piece 5. The holes in piece 5 look as if 1 and 3 could go on to either side. But the distance between the holes in 5 are different from one side to another. Pick the wrong two and piece 6 will not slide into place in step two. You can either measure the distance you need or put pieces 1 and 3 in loosely to check whether 6 will fit. Piece 5 has tile on one side and wood on the other. KidKraft wants the tile side to be on the interior of the elevator both top and bottom
Step 4 You attach the elevator to "sliders" on piece 8. Each slider has four holes drilled but you use only the middle two,
Steps 17-25 Garage. The pieces for the house fit well and everything went together smoothly. But the garage pieces didn't fit as well. (If the dadoes are off by even 1/16 inch a panel may not fit as it should.) In the end everything worked out fine but a few additional tools were needed. In this case clamp, trim saw and rubber mallet.
Total assembly took around four hours.

title: Great doll house!
text:
I bought this doll house to give my daughter for her birthday in September. Bought it ahead of time because I was afraid there would be any missing or defective parts. I was able to get this doll house for less than $170.00 and shipping was totally free!!! This doll house also includes all the furniture which made it my final purchase when I decided to buy it. Other doll houses in the market do not include furniture naking it a lot more expensive when you have to buy them separate.
Directions for the item were fairly easy considering I am a very handy person and love to do things myself! It took me only 3 hours to assemble from opening the box to the very final screw!
I love the doll house and think it is very sturdy. It is a very good product considering the amount of money I paid for it. Beware, some other websites can charge up to $599.99 for same doll house but a little bit of shopping around can get you going for less than $170.00.
After completion of this product assembly I was missing 2 I-screws that go on the garage door. Next day I called the 1800 number on the instructions page and without any questioning I was sent new hardware, free of charge.
The only thing I did not manage to do well was to hide the doll house from my daughter. I left it in the family room and covered with a large bed sheet but she figured that out quickly because of the shape of the roof. Since this is a birthday gift to her, as a tease, I let her play with it a little bit and told her she could use the house for her lalaloopsy mini at this time.
Overall, great product that promises hours and hours of indoors play for either one, two, or more children together.
I am very satisfied with my purchase!

text: This dollhouse is huge! I‚Äôm a single mom and was able to put the entire house together with minimal assistance over the course of about 3 evenings, total maybe 4 hours. Instructions were clear, all the parts fit and the quality is good. Only funky thing that didn‚Äôt work was the garage door knobs- suggest the manufacturer use a different fitting there- but I rigged it so they work. My 5 year old was ecstatic to see this next to the tree on Christmas Day and plays with it regularly.

title: KidKraft does it again!

That being said, we used wood glue for all of the joints to ensure a solid assembly.  Our daughter isn't rough with her toys, but if she were, I think the assembly with the glue would hold up to quite a bit of abuse.  Be warned, this thing takes about 2-3 hours to build with two people.

title: Decent quality at best but the instructions were actually very wrong.
text:
I would say I‚Äôm an 8 in terms of getting things done around the house or building things. Yes. I did wait till Christmas Eve this year to build the house. Yes I did read reviews warning of that. However not having a place to hid it I worked away. A solid 4 hours to build. Problem was that the instructions included skip steps. For example stairs require 3 screws but instructions show only 1 needed. Was an issue on every page. Fortunately found instructions on Amazon and sure enough PDF has all the steps I found missing, but now included.

As for quality vs cost I have no idea. I think paying what I did I get quite a bit. Will it hold up to my 3 year old climbing on it? Nope. I wouldn‚Äôt expect that anyway. A little let down on panel finishes, corners all peeling but it‚Äôs for a 3 year old not an adult model builder so a painful pass.

Again my largest beef was instructions. Some panels didn‚Äôt have numbers and had to reference pictures to get an idea what side was up (elevator specific) and what went where.

I recommend paying someone a few hundred dollars to create actual instructions that match. Perhaps (wood floor side up) type comments.

title: Not very happy
text: The boards were warped some of the background they applied was peeled at corners and applied uneven ... My 3 year old was happy but the quality is not as expected for the money I paid!

title: Fabulous Doll House!
text: We ordered this doll house because my 5 year old daughter wanted a Barbie Dream House for Christmas.  The Barbie versions were more expensive, and in my opinion, more cheaply made.  I read the reviews, and was prepared for the assembly.  It did take my husband and I almost 2 hours to have it completed.  The house is very impressive, comes with a lot of furniture, and is now housing Barbies, Liv dolls, and many other stuffed animals. My daughter loves it, and I am very happy with this purchase overall.

title: DO NOT BUY
text:
I bought this product and it took over 2 hours to build. The pieces are not of high quality and some of the wood split. There also was not enough of the correct screws. I do not normally write reviews, so for me to be writing one says a lot.

I asked for my money back and they told me I would have to send back the product. Mind you this took 2 hours to build and they wanted me to disassemble it and send it back? This had already inconvenienced me and I was not going to spend another hour disassembling it. I even took pictures of the broken pieces and wood splits and sent it to Amazon.

The best they could offer me was 30% discount on the product and they would not even give that to me until I sent them pictures of the product. So there you have it, I lost 100 dollars and 2 hours of my time building, and 1 hour on the line with Amazon.

DO NOT BUY- the house is also very light and if not fastened to the wall it could fall on your child.

title: It is huge.

title: The Big House
text: After several Barbie sets that fizzled within a week, we were very apprehensive about investing in a doll house. To our great relief,  this was our daughter's favorite Christmas present. We wanted a doll house that would be compatible with Barbie while providing more bang for he buck than the offerings from Mattel. This doll house exceeded our expectations. It works well with the Barbie size doll. As far as bang for the buck, this definitely delivered. It has three floors with a baby's room loft, a garage with a patio above it. Comes with furniture: piano, chandelier, bed, crib, table & chairs and many more. It took a few hours to put together, but the directions were fairly easy and the end result was a solid product. Highly recommend this product.

title: Incredible product, sturdy, and beautiful! Lots of fun!
text: Wow! What an incredible dollhouse! I assembled it over the period of a few days so I could do it secretly for Christmas. I would say putting all the time I spent assembling it together was about 2-3 hours by myself, which is very reasonable for a dollhouse this size! No pieces were missing or damaged. The quality of the product is amazing, and very sturdy. I see this lasting for many years of play! The instructions were actually pretty detailed for primarily using illustrations over words/photos. The instructions were perfectly in order, and I had next to no issues with assembling it. The only thing that would not assemble the way it was intended were the little knobs on the garage door. The screws will not go in without splitting the wood of the knobs so I will be using hot glue to put them on the door. That was the only piece that gave me that kind of issue so I can look past it as I have an easy fix for it. My daughter is absolutely thrilled with it! The furniture pieces, while not all are made of wood, are great quality as well and just so cute! I'd highly recommend this dollhouse! I also just learned that kidkraft also has dollhouse furniture sets so those will be great future gift options to help upgrade the dollhouse!

title: Kiddies love it

The price was great and although it came with some crack pieces, I was able to get them replaced in a few weeks. It took a long time to put together. We assembled it on christmas eve. I think it took us extra hours to build because we were so exhausted but the finish product is amazing.

It's exceptionally large (taller than my 8 year old) and includes quite a bit of cute, sturdy furniture. I put it together myself in less than 3 hours using a phillips screwdriver. I did use some of the advice other raters gave and did not tighten the screws to the elevator too much, and it moves easily.  I have four-year old twins and they are able to play with this house together without much arguing because there is so much room (although they do have some trouble taking turns with the elevator).  I still cannot believe how big it is.  I am pretty tall and the top of the roof comes to my chin.  It's a good thing we have plenty of stools around so they can reach the fourth floor - lol....  This is a great dollhouse and I recommend it highly to anyone with the room for it.

I found the ‚ÄòDisney Princess Shimmer‚Äô dolls fit best ( a touch smaller than a Barbie), but the house is so massive that she‚Äôs putting full grown stuffed animals in there. title: Excellent Quality, really BIG!
text: This dollhouse is exactly what I hoped for. I have a KidKraft kitchen set, so I knew the quality of the brand. My two kids have enjoyed playing with it since Christmas morning. I especially like all the furniture it came with and it's very bright and colorful. A few things to consider: I did pay someone to put it together and it took a few hours. The top level (the baby's room) is very high. My kids can not reach it (4.5 years and 20 months). I knew this would be the case from the video demo. But I guess I didn't anticipate my kids constantly using a bench to reach up there! It's like that's their favorite level! Also my littlest one has climbed into the garage and the other rooms and I've had to yell at him to get out! It's still in my living room (we haven't had chance to take it downstairs to the playroom yet) but when it does find its permanent home, it has to be bolted to the wall somehow, because I'm convinced it will topple over. It's not against a wall now, and it shakes slightly which scares me! The first reaction from everyone that sees it, is WOW that's BIG followed up by its beautiful. I sort of wish I ordered a smaller one. It would have served the same purpose, but I had the space so I figured why not?

title: Frustrating to put together, but it‚Äôs really cute
text: Once assembled the home is really cute. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô5 and it comes up to my collar bone so it‚Äôs pretty tall and wide. Seems pretty sturdy as well. Our cat likes to lay in the rooms and it‚Äôs held her up and doesn‚Äôt give so that‚Äôs also a plus. The reason for the non-five star review is simply because the piecing it together process. The directions are all photos with no words. You can kind of make out what it what, however I had to clue what design was on what end. The diagram will show a square piece with the number 10 using a letter screw (how they are identified) but the numbered pieces could sometimes be an either or. Sometimes I‚Äôd have to back track to fix it which was a pain or I had to skip ahead to see if I could figure it out. Simple fix would be to just clarify it in the directions. The second issue I had was some screw holes not aligning. Especially the roof. That‚Äôs like a the piece puzzle but the holes are in the wrong spot which made the front of the roof tighter than the back. Made it work by creating my own holes in the right spot. Third issue was some of the screw holes wet too close to the edges and not in the middle so when you put the screw in it cuts through the sides or cracks the boards. My little one is pretty gentle so it should be good, but the initial frustration and a few screws in the wrong spot took down a star.

title: Extraordinarily foolproof to build
text: Took my father-in-law and I 2.5 hours to build. Very gently used a drill to sink some of the screws. The whole time, we marveled at how easy it was to construct - from the numbered stickers on all the pieces to the separated screw/bolts packet to the instructions. As a veteran of endless bad kid toy, office furniture, etc., assembly instructions, this thing was a dream and, perhaps even more shocking, everything fit together perfectly. No overlaps, no poorly drilled holes, no pieces that just weren't quite flush. It may look daunting in the picture, but the manufacturer bent over backwards to make it user-friendly to put together.

text: Bought this for my 4 (soon to be 5) year old daughter and she absolutely LOVES it!  She plays with her barbie dolls and just about any doll with this in her room.  I was going to give this 4 stars since putting it together took 3 drunk adult males the better part of the entire Christmas eve but it is so well designed and made and my daughter is so happy with it that I have practically forgotten the chore of putting it together:)

title: A step up from the Barbie Dream House
text: This is a great dollhouse - better by far than the Barbie Dream House.  Although my daughter didn't end up using it that much, it was not due to the quality of the structure (she just wasn't into Barbies very much).  Well made and relatively easy to assemble (if you follow the detailed instructions).

title: Time required was approximately 10 hours!
text: On Christmas Eve the construction went smoothly until near the end when we added the garage and upper sun room.  Suddenly, the screw holes did not line up.  I wanted to forget the two rooms, but my husband (the grandfather) spent 12 hours in all making the necessary corrections for our granddaughter's Christmas morning surprise.  Quality  of the wood materials is very good, just wish those last two rooms had lined up properly!

title: Love this house
text: Love this house.  My daughter got it for Christmas, and loves playing with it.  The only 'slight' negative, is that the garage doors don't stay closed.  No matter how we tried to adjust them, they won't stay closed.  It really isn't that big of a problem, we use a ponytail holder as a latch.  My daughter keeps her Barbie horse and her barbie bike in the garage.  The furniture is very durable too.  The elevator works easily with a knob and slide.  Give yourself time to put it all together, it was definitely worth the money and is so much nicer than the plastic alternatives.

title: Arrived late, Box damaged!!!
text: Ordered on the 14th of December with prime shipping and it sat in a warehouse from the 20th-26th before it finally even moved again and arrived at my house on the 27th. This was my daughter‚Äôs Christmas present so I was rather disappointed. Box came extremely damaged and was taped to hold it together. Luckily, only one piece was damaged and it wasn‚Äôt noticeable after I put it together. The instructions were very easy to read. The screws were colored so that made things easier. Overall, this dollhouse is amazing and I am happy with it. But I‚Äôm not happy with the way it was packaged. I‚Äôm very lucky nothing was damaged inside so for that I give 4 stars.

I bought it for her to use for a long time. The garage for cars doesn't fit lol cars or basic barbie cars they will hang out of the garage. Lol dolls and barbies fit great on the furniture. But again I think it needed more furniture. The bed should come with a blanket too. A few of the pieces are plastic not wood. I think a toilet and vanity are plastic not wooden. But my daughter loves it. As long as she doesn't stand on it then it will last awhile. It also comes with things to attach it to the wall so it doesn't fall over. We didn't use them but that's helpful for others.

title: Beautiful Dollhouse, Really BIG!!
text: I was so impressed with this doll house. It is so pretty and has so many different rooms and pieces of furniture to play with. It seems pretty sturdy and durable, it took about 3 hours for my husband an I to put it together, but the directions were pretty easy to follow, there were just a lot of pieces. We got a great deal on the price since it was on sale for the Christmas holiday except for the shipping. We have an APO address in Japan and it wouldn't ship here through Amazon so I had it sent to my sisters house and she shipped it to us, the cost of shipping was $75 but it was worth it because my daughter was so excited and surprised Christmas morning. Everything arrived in good condition. It fits all her monster high and Brat dolls so pretty much any Barbie size doll or smaller would work with this house. The piano is the only  piece of furniture that keeps coming apart so I may just super the legs on so they'll stay but overall the furniture pieces are really sturdy and well put together. This house is HUGE my daughter is 4 an cant even see into the top floor. I think this house can last for years of play an grow with your child so I would definitely purchase this item, it's an excellent value for a great price.

title: Beyond Wildest Dreams
text: For this past Christmas, my husband and I really wanted to get an over-the-top gift for our 5-year-old since her big sister seemed to always get the fun electronics, etc.  Being the girly girl and doll lover that she is, I figured what better gift than a real, life-size dollhouse that will grow with her.  I did lots of research and discovered that there were more dollhouses out there than what I expected.  I took the plunge and bought this one.  When it arrived (very quickly, I might add), I found myself very excited to put it together and play with it myself!  Finally, Christmas arrived and my husband and I immediately started putting it together.  Right away, I noticed the attention to detail (skid marks in garage, etc) was top-notch.  I'll admit, the customer reviews about it taking 2 hours to put together were spot on.  It might have taken less time if our antsy new dollhouse owner wasn't "checking in" every 2 minutes and us shooing her away.  I highly recommend you put this together in the room where it will stay.  It is quite heavy once fully assembled.  One thing I was surprised about was how tall it is.  Our daughter is pretty tall, and even she can't reach the top floor without using a stool.  Overall, this product is highly recommended.  The only negative thing I could say is the screws underneath the elevator started scratching the floor on the second level after about a week of repeated use.  It might be helpful to cover the screws with tape after assembly.  To completely blow your child's socks off, consider purchasing a separate doll family to go with it.  It's equipped to use Barbie-size dolls, put small hands do better with the small wooden dolls, I think.

title: Incredible

title: Great product, so far...!
text: My daughter has enjoyed her new doll house a lot since Christmas. She has it decorated with battery light strings and candles. It was packaged well and all the pieces were present. It took several hours to assemble, but in all fairness, my 8yo daughter helped. All connections lined up properly and assembly instructions were complete and easy to follow. One minor issue...the elevator mounts are a little snug and don't allow it to move smoothly. The plastic spacers need to be a little thicker so the edges of the wood elevator floor and ceiling don't rub on the rail. I shimmed it out and it is fine now. I believe this will be more durable than the plastic houses in the long run. It is a little heavy, but I moved it myself (6'-2") or two people can easily move it. Make sure you don't drag it around on the carpet and it should hold together well. This has been a great value for the price!

title: It's adorable, but it's not standing up as well as ...
text: Unfortunately, for such a large and expensive doll house, many pieces arrived warped and already the paper backing of the walls and roof are beginning to peel. Also they screws that hold in the bottom of the elevator are leaving marks on the floor below.  It's adorable, but it's not standing up as well as I would have hoped.

title: Military wives, single moms, etc... Here's a review for YOU!
text:
As it always seems to work out, my husband is deployed for my daughter's third birthday. I'd like to call myself a "pro" at putting together children's toys and furniture at this point. So I'm going to break this review down for all you military wives, single moms, wives whose husbands travel for business, and the ladies who just want to do it themselves!

Why I love Amazon.com -
They almost always have the best price! They offer free super saver shipping on many items. They ship things out very quickly and offer tracking on all of your packages!

Why I love KidKraft -
Almost every big item we have for our daughters is made by Kidkraft (kitchen set, various kitchen accessories, table and chairs, bookshelves, toy box, train set and table, wall shelves, and now the dollhouse!) The packaging of the hardware is excellent and easy to find pieces. Everything is always VERY sturdy. It's a much more eco-friendly option than the big plastic pieces you can find by other companies. The price is right for the quality item you recieve. The customer service is one of the best I've ever come across. They even have a place on their website where you can order missing or broken parts without the hassle of having to call. (I've only ever needed a part once out of all of our items! They shipped it quick, even around Christmas time.) I suggest ordering ahead of time if you can, just in case you are missing a part or something is broken. That way you're not disappointed! And remember.. mistakes happen, we're all human!

Why I love this dollhouse -
It IS HUGE! The children in the display photo are not scaled down. Some people may not like this, but I however; love it! We have two toddler girls, and needed something that would be big enough for both of them to play with to avoid future temper tantrums. For the price, you get double the dollhouse you get from other models that are just a small amount cheaper. It will accomodate Barbie dolls once my girls start playing with them instead of their other dolls. This is something we will have for a long time, and I am confidant that the girls will be able to grow into it, and that the construction will last!

Some tips for construction by yourself, ladies! -
1. You will need a big (+) screwdriver and a little (+) screwdriver. You may need a (-) screwdriver to hold in some pieces at points. Kidkraft supplies the allen key. If you need a glass of wine, I suggest white, just in case it spills ;)
2. You will need a large space to build this, since there are points when the house will need to be on its side.
3. Unwrap all of your pieces. Read through all instructions before beginning as well as check and count all of your parts. I personally go through step by step and place the parts I will need in bunches.
4. Make sure you have the time to do this all. You will only get frustrated if the kids are awake, or you set a time limit to get this all done by! I did this during naptime and once the girls were in bed. All in all I think it took me about 2.5 hours to get it done, but this is also coming from a woman who can do this stuff with her eyes closed at this point.
5. Take your time to really look at the photos in the instruction manual. Plan it all out in your head first, then do it.
6. If the screw's paint doesn't match the spot it's in.. it's in the wrong place.
7. If something needs to be forced, it's probably in the wrong place or you need a new part. Kidkraft's items usually go together seamlessly. This is another reason I am a huge fan.
8. The wall makes a good "partner." If you need to hold something up, just put it against the wall.
9. Take your time, and don't get frustrated. You'll be SO proud when it's all done!

Some more fun facts -
I am 5'1", and the house is almost as tall as I am. If you are short.. get a step stool to screw the roof on! The box is 70lbs. when shipped. If you can, get your delivery man to place it right where you are going to set it up.. especially if you're a pregnant momma!

I hope this helped!
Overall I would recommend this dollhouse to all of my friends and family. My daughter has not yet played with it, but I just know that from the moment she wakes up on her birthday that this house will be played with daily for years to come!

title: Poorly made, physically impossible to correctly assemble.
text:
This thing is the absolute worst. It is true, the instructions are terrible, but that is nothing compared to how poorly the pre-drilled holes line up. I am lucky that I only broke one of the panels trying to force the floors together just to get a bolt through a hole in the wood.

The laminate art is also peeling away from at least one edge of almost every piece of this toy. It is very cheaply made, even compared to the other Kid Kraft items we have.

If it wasn't Christmas Eve (or if Santa had a different gift to give my daughter) this POS would be going back. I am guessing that this item is only a good seller because it would be impossible to return once it is built.

It took me just under 3 hours to build, and one whole section is not complete because the bolts won't fit. Looks like I am going to have to use construction screws to put this thing together, but nothing I have is even long enough to help.

Don't buy this thing. Just save yourself the aggravation and don't do it.

title: Kids Love It
text:
We bought this for our 2 year old daughter for Christmas. Assembly is a two person operation, but wasn't overly complex. The pieces all fit together and the actual assembly doesn't require any special tools or skill. This thing is huge, stands about 4 feet tall. The house is sturdy and the furniture is well made. The kids haven't stopped playing with it, it's their favorite Christmas toy. Only drawback is the amount of room needed for this dollhouse. It also needs to be strapped to the wall (it includes anchoring straps) to avoid any risk of tipping over.

I would definitely recommend.

title: A few defective pieces and busted bed
text:
I would love to give this product a 5 star because it is really cute, and I know my daughter will love it when she sees it on Christmas morning, however we have had some trouble with it. We were putting it together and everything was going good until we started putting the roof on. The holes on the roof board and the frame didn't match up. So we cant put the roof on and will have to drill holes in the frame to make it fit. And the wood started cracking on both sides of the house when we screwed it on.
Then the next night I got the furniture pieces out and was putting it together, and I noticed the bottom of the bed is busted. I really like the house but wish there was a way to get replacement pieces.

All furniture is wooden and sturdy as well. I am very happy with this purchase and recommend for anyone with a little girl who loves to play with dolls. title: Very Happy Little Girl
text:
This dollhouse was exactly what we were looking for. Our daughter loves it! It truly is a huge structure. The materials used are very sturdy and should stand up to some abuse. The front rails and vertical supports allow for you to put a lot of pressure each floor without it breaking. We were concerned about this because of our climbing toddler. He has not been able to damage it. The instructions were very easy to understand, and where they were lacking you can use the large picture on the box to fill in the blanks.

Assembly:

It took about 2 hours to put together. My advice would be to buy a hex set of bits for your drill. They cost 5 to 10 dollars at any hardware store and will make this project much easier. If you assemble the house with the Alan wrenches provided I can see how it may take a whole day to put together. Be careful not to over tighten the bolts it will split the wood. Stand up all the pieces against your walls with the numbers exposed. It makes finding them much easier. All the assembly hardware (screws, bolts, etc.) comes on a sheet. The best way to get the bolts out is to slice the plastic on the front with a box cutter. If you try to remove them from the back through the cardboard you will just frustrate yourself.

Overall, we are very satisfied with this purchase. We would recommend this house to anyone.

title: we have three kids and they can all play at it very easily. I can't give it 5 stars because the ...

title: She loves it!!
text: The dollhouse is beautiful. I shopped for a long time for the perfect one for Christmas. It was the same price as those plastic dream Barbie houses at Walmart, so it was a no brainer. The box was finally here & I waited until the night before to put together. Big mistake. If its for a special occasion, you may want to plan ahead. It took all of 4 hours BUT there were 3 of us "know it all" family members trying to assemble. So it may go easier for you. :)  All in all when we were done it was worth it. The middle part of the roof is loose because the screws don't match up with the holes but that really doesn't matter. It's not like my child will be pushing the big house around. Some parts of the home are the particle board material & some parts are thick wood. The furniture prices are adorable. They are thick wood.  I had trouble with the pink bed, the screw for the foot bed DIdnt match with hole again but that's an easy fix. I believe we will have many years of this dollhouse. It's beautiful & sturdy for what's available out there. I paid $140 when on sale so the price was hard to beat! Enjoy! My 7yr old LOVES it!

title: The BEST!
text:
I did a fair amount of research for a dollhouse for my almost 5yo, daughter. She loved the BARBIE houses, but in my opinion, they are all CHEAP JUNK! No thanks.

Then I found KidKraft. Their products are absolutely top quality, keeping in mind, they are still, toys. My almost 5yo daughter who is tall for her age, is still shorter than the house (Majestic Mansion), which she LOVED (that it was bigger than she was).

It did take my husband a few, methodical, hours to assemble, but it was worth it and while he was assembling it, he kept commenting what nice quality it was.

By the way, we only paid $138 for this house at COSTCO...what a deal! ($120 for the Barbie JUNK house!)

One more thing, the 35 pieces of furniture that came with the house were awesomely made of solid wood.

If you buy a Barbie-branded house, you are nuts! The Kidkraft dollhouses are awesome!

title: Daughter's Christmas present
text:
My daughter loves the doll house. It took me three hours to put together by myself. It is very sturdy and the instructions were clear.

The issues I had with it:
1. The roof supports were broken or cracked
2. There was a piece of paper taped to one of the pieces, and when it tried to carefully remove it, the wallpaper ripped
3. If the took a little more care in how they place the stickers that identify the pieces, you wouldn't have to worry about tearing the wallpaper or ruining the finish on the pieces

All of this stuff was able to be hidden or fixed though so it wasn't a huge deal.

All in all, a great dollhouse that I'm sure my daughter will love for many years.

text: This thing is huge. I figured it was big from the product pictures,but wow. My 4 year old needs a stool to reach the top level. It wasn't too hard to put together, but there are a decent amount of pieces. The elevator is an issue. It can easily get messed up by an overzealous child tugging on it. The bottom floor of it has also bowed on ours for some reason even though there isn't that much weight on the lower level and it sits on a hardwood floor. Overall we're glad we purchased it and the little one loves it.

title: Five Stars

title: KIDKRAFT MUCH BETTER VALUE THAN MATTEL
text: BOUGHT THIS FOR MY DAUGHTERS 5TH BIRTHDAY. SHE WANTED THE BARBIE HOUSE WITH THE ELEVATOR. AFTER LOOKING AT THE MATTEL PRODUCT WHICH IS MOSTLY PLASTIC, I FOUND THIS ON AMAZON. ORDERED IT FROM VMINNOVATIONS AND THE SPEED AT WHICH THEY DELIVERED IT WAS AMAZING. I ORDERED IT AROUND 9:30 PM WED. NIGHT THANKGIVING EVE AND IT ARRIVED ON SAT. AFTER THANKSGIVING. LESS THAN 3 DAYS ON A HOLIDAY WEEKEND. BOX ARRIVED AND IT WAS WELL PACKED. I READ ANYWHERE BETWEEN 21/2 HOURS TO 5 HOURS TO PUT TOGETHER. DEFFINATELY TAKE YOUR TIME, BECAUSE THE INSTRUCTIONS DONT SHOW YOU WHICH SIDE OF SOME OF THE PANELS TO USE. A LITTLE ATTENTION TO DETAIL AND COMMON SENSE HELPS HERE. I FOLLOWED SOME OTHER REVIEWERS ADVICE AND USED WOOD GLUE WHEN ASSEMBLING AND THIS THING IS VERY STURDY. DEFFINATELY WILL HOLD UP TO HOURS OF PLAY TIME. THE FURNITURE IS VERY CUTE, EVERYTHING IS MADE OF WOOD AND HAS CUSHIONING AND FABRIC DETAIL. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS KIDKRAFT PRODUCT OVER THE MATTEL HOUSE. AS FOR SOME OF THE REVIEWERS MENTIONING THE ELEVATOR BECOMING HARD TO USE I HAVE A SIMPLE SOLUTION. REMOVE THE CAP FROM THE ELEVATOR RAIL AND REMOVE THE ELEVATOR SLIDERS. YOU WILL SEE A METAL BRACKET ON THE FACE OF THE SLIDERS. CVAREFULLY REMOVE THIS CAP THAT HOLDS A BALL BEARING AND A SPRING SIMILAR TO A BALL POINT PEN SPRING. WITH A SMALL PAIR OF SNIPS, REMOVE A FEW COILS OF THE SPRING AND REASSEMBLE SLIDERS. THIS WILL ALLOW THE ELEVATOR TO MOVE MORE FREELY. I MAY HAVE OVERDONE IT BECAUSE THE ELEVATOR SLOWLY FALLS TO THE FIRST FLOOR BUT I THINK IT'S BETTER THAN THE CHILD NOT BEING ABLE TO MOVE THE ELEVATOR AT ALL. IF YOU ARE HESITANT ABOUT BUYING THIS HOUSE OVER THE MATTEL BARBIE HOUSE, DEFINATELY GO WITH THE KIDKRAFT, YOU WILL BE HAPPY YOU DID.
