title: Giant!
text: We got this for our 3 year old.  She can reach the bottom two levels great, but needs a stool to reach the top two.  It is a beautiful house.  It took about two hours for my husband and I to put it together.  There is one screw that didn't go in well, but my husband is going to fix that, and it's nothing that will change the structure of the house.  My daughter is constantly playing with it, and I'm hoping it will be played with for years to come.  We carried it upstairs, and did have to take the roof off for it to fit!  The majority is like a mdf type of material with the paper glued on, and in a few places it's peeling off in the corner or edge. It looks like when they manufacture it they make a large sheet, attache the paper, then cut it, so it curls up on the edge.  Most places that it's doing that, I don't think my daughter will snag it, so it shouldn't be a problem.  All the other trim is made of wood.  As a whole it is very durable, but I wouldn't trust it to hold a kid if they were trying to climb it.  and all the furniture is wood too.

title: Patience is a Virtue.
text:
Love the house & the included furniture. Great detail & feels sturdy. Giving it three stars only because in order to put it together (with no help), you need about two free hours & a great imagination. The instruction guide does not specify which way the double illustrated boards should go. There were not enough colored screws. Scraping glue out of the holes in order to embed the nut was awful. The elevator lift has already become unattached (the glue that they used was on the board- not on the elevator anchor). I‚Äôve also had to size down multiple pieces, due to them being untrimmed.

If you have the patience, I‚Äôd recommend it. Perhaps we just got a bad box? If you have trouble piecing it together, there are some great YouTube videos out there for help!

title: Great quality but assembly instruction can be improved
text:
Very nice dollhouse. I bought it for my 4-year old but I really liked it and wish I had one when I was little.
Pros - the product is of the best quality for a toy. Pictures are beautifully painted and furniture pieces are well made. Of the 80 parts not even a single one was damaged/missing/defective. Extra nuts and bolts are provided for convenience. This is not one of those disposable toys but something your child can keep for a long time.
Cons - assembly can be a pain, and there is a lot to improve on the assembly instruction, as mentioned by other reviewers. First of all, there is not even a color picture of what the dollhouse looks like. Second, all the steps are in black and white pictures without any explanation. In the first 30 minutes I did double if the assembly was even a mission possible. There were a few instances in which I had to take assembly apart after realizing I got the wrong side (floor up etc.). I think many other customers had to refer to kidkraft website to figure things out. I didn't, and as a result it took a while to put the house together solely based on the very poor assembly instruction.
All in all I would recommend this product but do not rely on the assembly instruction in the box - go to website for help. Also plan to make this a two-person job. It is big and heavy so one person might not be able to hold things all the time.

title: Every little girl's dream!!!!
text: Let me start by saying I would have loved to have a dollhouse like this as a child! This item was bought as a Christmas present for my daughter. The look on her face Christmas morning was priceless. This dollhouse is truly majestic! When I opened the box, I was very overwhelmed by all the pieces. Luckily, all the parts were labeled for easy assembly. It took my husband around 2 hours to put together. When assembled, I was amazed at the enormity of it. My 4 year old needs a step stool to reach the top floor. Every room is beautiful and the furniture and the house itself is very sturdy. My daughter's favorite part is the elevator. Barbie dolls are the perfect size for this house. So happy I purchased this. It's worth every penny. I would highly recommend this if you're in the market for something that will provide many years of fun!

title: Love this dollhouse!!
text:
I researched and researched for days trying to decide what dollhouse to get for my 4 year old. I decided the sale price and size of this dollhouse was too good to pass up. I also liked the colors used for all of the rooms. The Barbie house was mostly black and hot pink...yuck! Any toddler would get tired of that very quickly.

My daughter loves her new house! My boys (8 and 5) have even gone into her room and played with their lego characters. :)

I don't have anything negative to say about this one.

title: A sweet gift
text: We purchased this doll house for a Christmas gift for my 9 year old daughter.  She loves it!  The furniture is sturdy and cute and it fits Barbie dolls.  The elevator looks like it may break soon, but everything else seems sturdy.  My son and I put this together in about 3 hours; you really need two people for some steps, but we had a lot of fun.  It is HEAVY and requires two people to move; parents with smaller kids should really bolt this to the wall (it comes with bolts).  I also purchased wooden doll house people, but they are too small for this set.  A figure one to two inches smaller than a Barbie would be ideal.  But my daughter told me not to return them; we had fun seeing how small they were compared to the house and she pretend they are Barbie's kids!  All in all, we are very satisfied.

title: Impressive quality for the pirce
text:
My daughters birthday is this weekedn, so she has yet to play with this item.

I am very impressed with the quality of materials, the ease of assembly, the ease of ordering replacement parts, and size of the house. Especially for the price. While the unit did arrive with 8 broken pieces, the reorder process was extremely easy and quick. You simply visit the manufacturers website and enter in the item numbers you need replaced, provide your address and you're done. No creating an account, no phone calls deciphering broken English. I really expected to get a phone call with some sort of verification of purchase. Quite frankly i felt like you could order this entire thing as replacement parts. Anyway, very please with that process after finding a number of broken pieces. Also it stated 7-10 days shipping and I believe we received our parts in 3-5 days.

Once we had every piece intact, assembly was a breeze. Instructions were clear and only once or twice was there a step where a little more detail would have been appreciated. I was particularly impressed with the craftsmanship. All the holes and grooves were on center. Cuts were smooth and polished. With so much cheaply and quickly made junk coming out of China, this was refreshing. I had only one screw hole that did not line up with the hole in the piece it was being attached to (there were three holes to line up, and one was off by a good 1/8" - 1/4"). This unit is mostly held together by bolts that screw into threaded cylinders instead of the typical hardware of modular furniture(the pegs that get pushed into the disks that you turn and "pinch" tight). This is nice as you wont have to mess with re-tightening regularly.

Again my daughter has not used this item so my review is based solely on my experience of receiving the item, dealing with ordering replacement parts, and construction. While I feel like the unit will be very durable, time will tell.

My only complaint so far is the elevator. It attaches to the unit by screwing one of the cardboard walls to two pieces of plastic that are in a channel (two screws into each plastic piece). The plastic pieces pinch in the channel so that the elevator can remain suspended. This makes it difficult to move and with the elevator only being held on by a few screw points, feels flimsy. I feel like my daughter (4yrs) is going to have a tough time operating it and that it might not hold up to use. In light of the other houses I found, I don't feel the elevator is a show stopper.

I was drawn to this item:

- For it's size. I think it's cool that it's going to dwarf my daughter.
- It is scaled for Fashion dolls (Barbie, Disney). A lot of houses seem to be for ornate show or scaled for smaller dolls.
- For it's value. Other houses go for this price to upwards of $600 and are much smaller.

title: this is a great dollhouse. My daughters love it
text:
*EDITED 1/29/16 AFTER SPEAKING WITH KIDKRAFT* LEAVING MY FOUR STAR RATING FOR THE DOLLHOUSE ITSELF BUT CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM KIDKRAFT IS A BIG ZERO RIGHT NOW....

In my original review, I explained how we received a duplicate of one of the accessory boxes and were missing one of the other boxes. My first couple calls to KidKraft AFTER January 1st, I could not get a live person on the phone. Rather it was a voicemail message stating that I would have to leave a message so that my order could be filled BEFORE Christmas (mind you it was now a week AFTER Christmas...).

I eventually got someone on the phone the third week of January (after giving my daily call a rest for awhile). The very nice lady who answered stated that I would need a "batch code" off of the bottom of the dollhouse or from the instructions. I explained to her that I needed box "B" and would there be anything else she needs from me. No, she told me, just the batch code and that box letter.

Fast forward to today when I called and got the RUDEST woman on the phone. I explained to her that I had the batch code and would like to get the box that was missing. She cut me off to tell me she couldnt do anything without the list. I told her that I have the batch code and the name of the house. She very rudely told me that she cant help me with that, that I needed "THE LIST". I explained that I was missing box "b" - that I received box "a" and "c" - and what other information does she need other than that? She huffed at me and told me I need to tell her WHAT I'm missing. After explaining to her that I dont KNOW what I'm missing as I'm missing a BOX of stuff she basically sneered at me and told me to go look it up in the directions and call back once I have a list of everything I'm missing.

After a very deep breath to keep from snapping at this woman, I explained to her that the dollhouse was a gift that has since been put together - and played with - as it was a Christmas gift and as I started to explain that I was unable to get a hold of a live person until just last week she cut me off by saying "LOOK I cant do anything for you without a list of what you are missing." I thanked her abruptly and hung up.

Overall, the ATTITUDE was the worst of this. I can (vaguely) understand how the company may need a list of the items I am missing (though I did speak to the first woman who stated I only needed the box letter) but on the other hand, I would think that if the boxes are LABELED then they are labeled for a reason. Since I dont have the (rather thick) instruction book sitting in front of me, I cant say how difficult this task will be - especially considering most of the accessory pieces have been played with and are God knows where... - but I will say that I will probably be even more irritated if I find that the accessories are listed BY BOX in the instructions...

Hopefully my next call I'll get a much nicer representative on the phone who will be much more helpful!

********************************************************

Overall, this is a great dollhouse. My daughters love it, its spacious and has lots of little extras (the included furniture, the elevator, the details). It's big enough to fit Barbie and Monster High dolls, which is what my girls wanted - they think they got a Barbie dream house, I think I got much nicer dollhouse for a fraction of the price (while on sale) and much better quality.

However.. there are a few downsides. After seeing another KidCraft dollhouse in Costco, I expected this house to be made with the same thick wooden/pressboard walls; it is not. The top and sides are much thinner and are more like thin sheetrock rather than thick pressboard. I still think it will hold up well for the most part, though I do wish it was a little sturdier in that respect.

Also, we did have an issue with the contents of the box. This was purchased as a new item (and it came as a new item) however, there was supposed to be three furniture/accessory boxes; we did receive three, but two of the boxes were the same (there should have been a box A, B and C; we got two A's and one C box). I'm not sure what should have been in box B and did not realize that the boxes were duplicated until we had everything out and put together. I have not been in contact with the company yet to fix this but am hoping they will be able to send us that missing B box.

Aside from those two issues, the dollhouse is pretty awesome and I would recommend it to anyone.

title: THIS REVIEW WILL SAVE YOU TIME AND HELP YOU DECIDE PLEASE READ!
text:
THIS ITEM IS AMAZING!!!! FOR STARTERS I PRICE WATCHED FOR 2 WEEKS BEFORE PURCHASING IN EARLY NOVEMBER 2011 AND LUCKY ME I GOT THIS DOLLHOUSE FOR 165.00 WITH TAX AND FREE SHIPPING WITH THE AMAZON PRIME TRIAL SUBSCRIPTION (SO WORTH IT). THIS IS USUALLY SOLD FOR $250- TO UPWARDS OF $300 DEPENDING ON INVENTORY AND SELLER

SHIPPING- THIS IS QUITE HEAVY ESPECIALLY WHEN TRYING TO GO UP A FLIGHT OF STAIRS- SHIPPING WEIGHT IS OVER 60 LBS IT IS PACKAGED NICELY BUT MAKE SURE IT DOESNT RAIN WHEN YOUR EXPECTING THE SHIPMENT---ALSO KEEP IN MIND IT IS SOUROUNDED BY STYROFOAM SO CLEAN UP IS NECCESSARY WHEN DONE AFTER ASSEMBLY

PACKAGING-CONSISTS OF FLAT BOARDS SEPERATED BY STYROFOAM A CARDBOARD AND PLASTIC SEPERATER LABELED BY LETTERS FOR THE SCREWS& ALLEN WRENCHES- ALSO HAS SOME SMALL ADDITIONAL BOXES WITH ACCESSORIES (SET THESE UP ON A TABLE OFF TO THE SIDE)

DURABILITY- WHEN PUTTING IT TOGETHER YOU WILL HAVE MIXED FEELINGS...KIND OF FEELS FLIMSY AND CHEAPLY MADE UNTIL IT IS ASSEMBLED COMPLETELY...THIS IS THE TYPE OF ITEM WERE EVERY ADDITIONAL ITEM YOU ADD ON HELPS REINFORCE THE STRUCTURE MORE AND MORE...DON'T BE WORRIED THE BEGINNING MAY SEEM LIKE A FRAGILE STAGE

ASSEMBLY---THIS PART IS CRUCIAL!! I DID IT BY MYSELF...I AM A DO IT MYSELF TYPE OF WOMAN BUT AM VERY IRRITABLE AT TIMES AND I MANAGED JUST FINE. THE MOST IMPORTANT THING TO DO IS ASSESS THE PROJECT SIZE AND TO GET THE RIGHT TOOLS ....PHILLPS HEAD SCREW DRIVER (REGULAR SIZE) WOOD GLUE (TO HELP REINFORCE IF YOU FEEL THE NEED TO) PETROLEUM JELLY (I'LL EXPLAIN LATER = )
SOME KEY THINGS TO KEEP IN MIND ARE THAT THE INSTRUCTION MANUAL HAS NO WORDS..(PICTURES ONLY ) THE SCREWS FOR 80% OF THE PROJECT ARE COLOR CODED- MEANING THAT WHILE THEY DON'T REFER TO THEM USING COLOR, IF YOU ARE FOR INSTANCE SCREWING TO WALL PANELS TOGETHER ON THE OUTSIDE AND WHERE THE HOLE IS , THE WALL IS YELLOW MOST LIKELY THE SCREW IS GOING TO BE YELLOW
PLEASE PAY ATTENTION TO WHICH LETTER SCREWS YOU ARE POPPING OUT AS TO NOW MIX THEM TOGETHER ON ACCIDENT (THIS WOULD BE A PAIN).

THE ELEVATOR- THIS IS THE FIRST THING YOU WILL PUT TOGETHER. WHERE IT SLIDES UP AND DOWN GREASE HEAVILY WITH PETROLEUM JELLY...IF NOT YOU WILL REGRET IT...CAN BE VERY HARD IF NOT DONE TO MOVE IT UP AND DOWN

***IMPORTANT***
WHEN YOU GET TO THE STEP WHEN SLIDING THE PANELS IN THAT END UP BEING THE BACK WALL OF THE DOLLHOUSE BE GENTLEEEEEEEEEE AT THIS POINT THE OTHER SIDE OF THE HOUSE HAS NOT BEEN ATTACHED IF YOU MOVE THIS THE WRONG WAY THE WOOD WILL CRACK! I USED STOOLS TO HELP KEEP THE FLOORS IN PLACED WHILE I SCREWED THEM IN..THIS WORKED WELL

MAKE SURE YOU ARE ALWAYS USING THE RIGHT SCREWS! IF YOU PUT THE WRONG SCREW IN AND IT IS TO BIG YOU WILL HAVE TO REPLACE THE PART OR PURCHASE WOOD FILLER TO HELP FILL THE HOLE AGAIN FOR A SNUG FIT

THIS WAS NOT OVERWHELMING UNTIL I GOT THE WHOLE HOUSE COMPLETED AND REALIZED I STILL HAD TO ATTACH THE LEFT SIDE WITH THE DOORS...AT THIS POINT A BREAK WAS NEEDED

SUPRISES-----THE FURNITURE WAS HUGE COMPARED TO THE PICTURES ON THE NET...TO GET A REAL FEEL LOOK AT THE SIZE OF YOUR PALM..ONE OF THE TABLES INCLUDED MAYBE SLIGHTLY BIGGER THAN THIS...THE FURNITURE MAKES IT ALLLLLLLLLLLLLL WORTH IT!

THIS DOLLHOUSE IS HUGE COMES UP TO MY SHOULDER AND I AM 5' 5'' ! A GOOD IDEA WOULD BE TO USE A LATCH SYSTEM TO ATTATCH IT TO A WALL OR TO DRILL IT (WILL DAMAGE LOOK) FROM THE INSIDE TO A WALL.

ALSO IF YOU NEED ANY REPLACEMENT PARTS (WITHIN 90 DAYS OF RECEIPT) DUE TO DAMAGED, BROKEN,CRACKED, CHIPPED PAINT CONTACT KIDKRAFT DIRECTLY THEY ARE GREAT ABOUT NO HASSLE REPLACEMENTS YOU DONT EVEN HAVE TO SPEAK TO A LIVE PERSON! HOW GREAT

CONCERNS: THAT IT WILL FALL ON MY DAUGHTER DUE TO ROUGH PLAY...IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS OR NEED HELP EMAIL ME AT RUSSELL.DANIELLEM@GMAIL.COM

FINAL THOUGHTS---THIS WILL BE THE BEST GIFT YOUR PRINCESS HAS EVER RECEIVED NEXT TO A PUPPY...I CAN'T BELIEVE HOW MUCH OF JOY THIS IS!
THANKS FOR READING,

DIY GURU

title: Better than a Dream House
text: I ordered this dollhouse for our daughter's big Santa gift this year when I found it at a great price. I had the package in my basement for a month before I tackled putting it together. I read all the previous reviews on assembly time so I knew it would take awhile. That said it did take me roughly 5 hours to put together. I did it by myself and at a leisurely pace. I will say there were a few times an extra set of hands would have helped but they are not necessary at all. As with most kidkraft wooden toys there are bolt/nuts that drop in and the screws thread through them for a better fit when attaching the pieces. Some are difficult to line up with just two hands, but not impossible. One took me almost 15-20 minutes just because it was at an awkward angle. That was the only delay in assembly that I found. My shipment arrived quickly and had all the pieces. One piece of furniture did arrive slightly damaged but I sent an email for a replacement, ordering online was easy and hopefully it will arrive in a week or so. I intentionally put the house together early in case something was missing or damaged. I read other reviews on here and took the advise to put vaseline on the metal track of the elevator. THIS IS A MUST. It makes the elevator glide super easy since this is a problem most people seem to have with the house. Design wise, the house is BEAUTIFUL and makes me jealous! I can remember getting my barbie dreamhouse as a child and this is so much better, I can't wait for my three year old daughter to wake up Christmas morning and play with her!

text: I ordered this dollhouse for my four year old.  The dollhouse came today and I looked at each item to make sure there wasn't any broken or missing parts. title: Best dollhouse you can buy!
text:
I looked at over fifty dollhouses online and in retail stores but kept coming back to this house. We have several KidKraft products and have been really pleased with their quality and durability, but to be honest, the big draw for this item was its size. It's huge! One criteria I had for a doll house was that it would be big enough to grow with my child so she could have several years of play with it without it seeming too small. Another criteria was that it would be big enough to accomodate dollhouse dolls and 12 inch dolls - aka her Barbies. The large format makes it easy for little hands to manipulate furniture and play with dolls and gives plenty of room for adding in other toys - Little People, the Barbie convertible and more have reappeared this week as our daughter has played with the house.

Don't let the size intimidate you. It's not difficult to put together. My husband assembled it over the course of a couple evenings while also watching TV; one person can easily do this by himself/herself. Moving it is best with two people, though.

The collection of furniture and accessories is great, too. There are several items for each room (two for the bathroom), and I supplemented with the Fun Toys and Pet and Accessories Furniture sets by Plan Toys. The furniture is equally well-made, and a Barbie doll easily fits on the bed.

No regrets here! We love the Majestic Dollhouse, and so does our daughter.

title: very very nice!!!!

title: Very disappointed.
text: We bought this for my girls for Christmas. First off, it's a giant pain to put together and the screws/pieces weren't marked properly (either in the instruction manual or I got sent the wrong package of screws). I was able to make it all work but I had to improvise. It took me 3 nights of 3+ hours of work to get it all assembled, and I'm not inept or impaired. I've assembled more toys then I can count and I've done a ton of small projects and stuff that requires using a screw driver (that's all you need to put it together). Well I finally got it all together and it looks great. The girls were so happy on Christmas morning and it fits their barbies wonderfully. Fast foward to 3 weeks later, and probably half of the wooden furniture is falling apart or broke already. The way they join the pieces when assembling is with, what I'm assuming, glue. Well it didn't last very long.. The glued pieces have all come apart and I've had to super glue them back together. On some of the pieces the wood has split (the wooden stove. The side split and the door fell off). I really expected these things to last MUCH longer considering it's wooden and it's 170 bucks. I am very unhappy with this overall.

The quality, not great for kids Kraft, the directions eh, but what really has me upset is the damage to certain panels and pieces. Everything was carefully packed and wrapped. During building I‚Äôm noticing little tears, peeling, and rippling. Very disappointing.

Update: after a month of light use, all levels of the dollhouse are bowing. All the floors have large dips, and the furniture just slides to the side.

Reached out to kidkraft multiple times over the past two weeks and received no response. I purchased this to last through 2 little girls, and it‚Äôs barely a month after Christmas.

title: Best Dollhoue Out There
text:
Purchased for my four year old daughter for Christmas of 2011. The priceless look on her beautiful face, at that very moment, cleary made me see what this is all about! As the four old heaed off the Grandma's for the day to make her cookies for Santa and also prepare carrots for his reindeer, Mommy and Daddy assembled the dollhouse. In all it took about 2 1/2 hrs. Best tip to give, definitely use a little crisco or wd-40 for the elevator tracks. My little girl has played with this non stop since she has got it. I love going in there and playing barbies with her. Defintely reminds me of such simpler times when I was younger. I as so over the moon that she loves this house and suspect she will love it for years to come. KidKraft makes a great line of products. This house is sturdy, all furniture is good quility wood, there is one plastic piece and that id the staircase, but everything else deffinitely makes uo for it by far!!! I will be back to purchase more.

title: Huge and great quality! Worth the money!
text: Unlike many reviews, I thought this was pretty simple to put together. I started on it at about 9:30 pm on xmas eve and was done before midnight, doing most of it myself. I didn‚Äôt have any issues with parts not fitting correctly - it all went pretty smooth. When I first opened the box I was pretty intimidated and assumed it was going to be an all night task but once I got all the pieces laid out and took my time with the instructions it wasn‚Äôt bad at all. I didn‚Äôt need any special tools‚Ä¶just a screwdriver. It also comes with a wall anchor - it‚Äôs big and heavy but I could definitely see it tipping over if a child is pulling on it/tries to climb it. It‚Äôs huge. I read dimensions and looked at so many reviewer pictures but once you actually see it put together in person‚Ä¶just wow lol. It‚Äôs almost obnoxious how big it is. I wish I would have purchased a slightly smaller one. But it‚Äôs great quality and definitely worth the money. The wooden furniture that comes with it is great quality too! It‚Äôs a huge hit with my daughter, she‚Äôs been playing with it nonstop. I recommend this, unless you have a house on the cozier side then I‚Äôd recommend selecting a smaller model lol.

text:
I didn't purchase it myself but after extensive searching and reading all kinds of reviews, this is the one I chose for my sister to purchase my 3 year old for Christmas.

IT DOES NOT DISAPPOINT. We have so many options for play, including sticking her iPad in the livingroom for a "movie night in the dollhouse" or we have a house party with our mini karaoke machine. The possibilities are endless with this thing.

Assembly was reasonably long üò¨ but it is pretty easy. Definitely recommend having a partner in crime , lots of space , a couple drinks, and no children running around for at least 2 hours. title: Santa's Project Delight
text: Assembled this for my 4 yr. old granddaughter. Only problem with instructions was there were no graphics in the pictures to give you a clue as to upside-down or backwards. KEEP THE SHIPPING BOX CLOSE - YOU'LL NEED IT LIKE A ROAD MAP!!! It is a true "Barbie" size dollhouse. Get a "Dazzler" beach car to fit in the garage - none of the available "Barbie" vehicles fit into the garage. If you don't drink wine, a Bud will work just fine :-) My only other suggestion would be to unwrap ALL parts and arrange them in ascending numerical order. Instructions assemble the parts pretty much in numerical order - look for the part number on the round circle stuck to each piece. Leave the hardware in the bubble wrap container - if you take them all out you'll get them mixed up and be "screwed" in more than one way. Merry Christmas to all and to all a a good night :-)

title: Five Stars

title: The mansion is sturdy and durable long lasting and worth every penny
text: My girls ages 4 and 9 love everything about this mansion it really is over 4ft tall. As the mom 4‚Äù11 and it matches with my head as wide as my arms outstretched. This thing is a kids dream mansion for real. They have endless imagination. They play for hours nonstop. The mansion itself is very sturdy all the furniture pieces are hardwood as well I could see my girls playing with this for at least a good 5 years if not more because my little one has some years to grow into it. The 4 year old does have to stand on a step stool to play at the top level. All and all money well spent. My kids had a excellent Christmas thanks to amazon, kidkraft, and xcess limited. My husband wanted me to mention the the instructions and time frame of putting this mansion together. So on Christmas morning he started to unbox this beast around 11am ish and finished around 5pm ish. Over 100 pieces to put together like over 500 tiny screws to install the beast. A lot of file language was said putting this beast together a lot of frustration and prayer. I must add my husband is pretty good with following directions and good with his hands, but this beast worked his last nerve. The thing with him was every piece was numbered but the instructions were not helpful neither was the pictures. I had to go on YouTube and find videos of people putting this beast together. That was more helpful than what was given in the box. All and all we would buy this again and other kidkraft products because the final result makes it all so worth it. Plan ahead when preparing to put this kidkraft majestic mansion together. Even if you are the smartest at things like this, it will take some hours, make sure you have a helper this is easier with a two person job one to hold the mansion and the other to install. We hope this review is helpful to others.  We received the item with in a few days way before Christmas. Merry Christmas and happy New Years 2019

title: Definitely recommend! Nice quality, super adorable!
text:
This dollhouse is large & beautiful! I'm 5'3" and you can see in the picture how tall this house is. My 2 year old won't be able to reach the top. The furniture fills the house and is adorable! Everything came labeled very clearly and simply. The instructions are 100% in picture format, black and white. We would have benefited from color and graphics to make it easier to see how to position things when building it, however, it wasn't extremely hard. It took my husband and I 2 1/2 hours to unwrap and build the mansion and put the furniture together and decorate. We needed a screwdriver not included with the house. Ideally you need a buddy to build this. Some parts are wood, the walls and garage doors remind me of a thin drywall material. Overall happy with the quality & happy it's not plastic.

We wanted a dollhouse for our daughter to play with her Barbie dolls, but didn't love the plastic dream house. This fits Barbie well!

I'm so excited for our daughter to see this on Christmas morning and can't wait to play with it!

title: I would highly recommend!
text: This doll house is amazing. My 3 year old wanted the Barbie Dreamhouse for Christmas. I couldn't get myself to buy it, it was all plastic and so cheap looking! This house is GIANT and all wood. All the pieces are wood. It's awesome and very sturdy! Our daughters both love it and play with it all the time, they can't reach the top nursery without a stool but they dont seem to mind. It is Barbie compatible which was a relief! It took my husband and I about 3 hours to assemble. I would highly recommend!

title: Every Little Girls Dream House
text: I don't normally take the time to write a review and felt the need to on this KidKraft Majestic Mansion. We ordered this from Amazon before Christmas 2010 and including shipping it was less than $150.. What a STEAL :) - it shipped quickly and although assembly took 2 adults, 2+hours, pieces were marked numerically accordingly to assembly- overall wasn't too complicated. The furniture pieces that come with it fill the house nicely as one other owner stated. They are durable wood products with minimal assembly required. The elevator is slightly hard to maneuver up and down- light force is needed. I assume this so that it stays on the floor above and doesn't just glide down. The floors and wall are sturdy. This dollhouse easily accommodates 12" barbie dolls. Caution must be taken as this unit is heavy and can be easily tipped and an injury could occur. Overall this is ABSOLUTELY the cutest dollhouse- Worth every penny! My 7 year old daughter loves her "DREAM HOUSE". She isn't able to reach the top floor on her own- but nontheless, loves it!

title: Great House for Playing
text: Tough to build but overall it was exactly what we wanted. Huge house, sturdy, great decoration and easy to move.

title: Great looking house easy replacement part process
text:
Would first like to start with my daughter hasn't had time to play with this yet, it's a birthday present and there are a few weeks to go until she will receive it but it will be hard to imagine her not loving this thing. It is a monster 4' 6" tall and a little over a foot deep and very wide so lots of room to play, if you are buying it for a younger child I would suggest a pretty step stool to go with it or they will have trouble reaching the upper two floors. It also comes with furniture wall anchors and I will probably use them it is so tall. One other thing the inside and exterior sides of the house are decorated but not the "back" this is meant to be up against a wall, I had been wondering that before purchase.

I am the primary builder of kid things in the house so I know the drill pretty well and I have to say this was really easy to build. Some folks have said they used wood glue to reinforce it but I really don't think it's necessary. I also like that if you wanted to take it apart again in sections to take to someone's house you could because once's it's built you would need a pick up or van to take it somewhere else and I feel that this toy is going to last through our kids and probably some nieces as well it's very nicely made.

****If this is a gift you may want to assemble at least a week early!
If this is a gift you may want to at least open the box and carefully inspect the pieces a week before because we did have two broken pieces. Kidcraft has a phone number and website to get replacement parts. I used the website and ordering the pieces took just a few minutes and I received them two business days later completely free of charge (they say it can take 7-10 business days if they have them in stock so you may want to prepare) as a whole I was very impressed with this process I've had much worse experiences with other companies.
Once it's assembled hiding it is really the trick because it's about as big a dresser (that's what mine is currently hiding behind in our basement until the birthday arrives) and I had to stack some boxes on top of the dresser to hide the top of the house.

title: So cute and easy to build
text: The box was huge.. I had to roll it to get inside the house because I could not lift it alone, but it wasn‚Äôt a big deal.. just rolled carefully! It seemed somewhat intimidating, but once I opened it and laid everything out I could see the simplicity in the build. The directions are so easy to follow. Just start with step 1 and go on from there. I did have my dads help in putting it together.. so I would recommend having someone to help, but it‚Äôs not necessary. I believe I could‚Äôve done it myself. (22 year old female lol.) it took us about 2 hours to put together and it went by fairly quickly! It was like a fun puzzle ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è 10/10 I would buy again! 10/10 I recommend.

title: Nice large doll house
text: This doll house is seriously huge! It's very nicely made and our kids love it. The only downside is all the parts and how long it takes to put together. Luckily everything is labeled really well. It just takes a couple hours to assemble it all.

title: A wonderful Dollhouse!
text: It was a great dollhouse for my 4 year old daughter. She can use most of the people, as the dollhouse can get up to 12" dolls. It didn't take too long to put together, as my husband, and his 2 brothers attacked it on christmas morning. It took an hour for the 3 of them to put it all together --- and hours and hours of fun playtime for my daughter!

title: Poor quality, wrong instructions, started falling apart within a week.
text:
First of all the house comes in a very heavy box. Some parts came damaged because there is no adequate cushioning. There are just a few thin pieces of styrofoam which can't really protect a heavy load. So some corners were damaged.
I consider myself pretty good at putting stuff together. In this case either instructions were wrong or parts were mislabeled. Either way, it took a while to put it together and I had to backtrack a few steps.
Finally when all was put together, I was somehow happy... for a week. After a week, floors started bending as seen on pictures. The gap between two floors became so large thet the dividing wall would not longer stay in place. Also same thing happened with the garage door which just fell out and will no longer stay put.
Also, customer service is horrible. By accident we ordered two houses. I realized that and within 10 minutes requested that one order be cancelled. I received the confirmation that customer service received my request yet neither order was cancelled. In fact once i received shipment notification, I emailed th again and told them to reverse the shipment. They told me to refuse the delivery, but fedex just dropped it off. So I received two shipments and they refuse to issue a return label so I can ship one back. Shipping it back will easily cost half the price of the house or more. So I'm forced to dispute the charge as I think I acted in a timely matter to cancel the order and they just didn't do their part.
Overall I'm not very happy with the purchase. I thought I was getting a quality product and instead it came damaged, instructions were wrong or parts mislabeled and it started falling apart a week after I put it together. No more Kidkraft products for me.

title: Happy in the end
text: I‚Äôm not very talented when it comes to things like this, so it took me about 5-6 hours to put together (admittedly I made mistakes that I had to go back and correct). But eventually I got it done and it looks great! Very big and good quality.

title: Missing Back wall from the nursery
text: I gave it 2 stars  , because the wall for the nursery was missing so now it‚Äôs just that open space on the top floor . It‚Äôs a huge house So it‚Äôs very noticeable .

title: Very pleased with the doll house easy assembly
text: Very pleased with the doll house easy assembly, bigger than I expected, and got here on time. My 4 year old and 2 year old love it and there Barbie's fit in it like it was made for them

title: Warning! Attempted construction of product may increase chances of alcoholic consumption.
text: This was our choice of house after quite a bit of research and figuring it was our best option outside building our own. It does fit Barbie dolls perfectly fine, a few of the furniture pieces (wood furniture requires no assembly) are just a tiny bit off but Barbie still sits and lays well enough. It was Santa's gift and her big one this year after a very long wait, imagine her eyes as we begin to immediately pull out broken pieces from an obvious multi-time return. Screws were stripped as if done on purpose, key wooden components were beaten almost to saw dust, all the interior walls are a very flimsy material sandwiched between paper with artwork but they peel very easily and honestly little of this house is wood at all. Expect paper and foam with just enough of a slight touch of wood to insult your intelligence. Their flirting with false advertising more than one often sees in most products and that's no exaggeration. Please people, either pass on this, double check it before presenting or take that hard earned money and build one yourself. Even with diorama and model experience this thing was beyond being able to salvage. It's unreasonable for any parent to deal with this at all and children should never know such disappointment.

title: Great

title: Horrible instructions and terrible quality. Very disappointed.

title: MASSIVE AWESOME DOLLHOUSE! GREAT PURCHASE!
text: [[VIDEOID:585268b96b17744a90485945711fa13c]] This is a review (mainly from my point of view as a parent) of the Majestic Mansion Dollhouse designed by Kidkraft. My daughters are thrilled with this MASSIVE dollhouse. The furniture are crafted very well and I just can't say enough of how huge this dollhouse is. I love that it fits my daughters' 12" dolls. When their friends come over, they love playing with it. I am happy with my purchase and it's definitely worth the price!

title: The mansion is sturdy and durable long lasting and worth every penny
text: My girls ages 4 and 9 love everything about this mansion it really is over 4ft tall. As the mom 4‚Äù11 and it matches with my head as wide as my arms outstretched. This thing is a kids dream mansion for real. They have endless imagination. They play for hours nonstop. The mansion itself is very sturdy all the furniture pieces are hardwood as well I could see my girls playing with this for at least a good 5 years if not more because my little one has some years to grow into it. The 4 year old does have to stand on a step stool to play at the top level. All and all money well spent. My kids had a excellent Christmas thanks to amazon, kidkraft, and xcess limited. My husband wanted me to mention the the instructions and time frame of putting this mansion together. So on Christmas morning he started to unbox this beast around 11am ish and finished around 5pm ish. Over 100 pieces to put together like over 500 tiny screws to install the beast. A lot of file language was said putting this beast together a lot of frustration and prayer. I must add my husband is pretty good with following directions and good with his hands, but this beast worked his last nerve. The thing with him was every piece was numbered but the instructions were not helpful neither was the pictures. I had to go on YouTube and find videos of people putting this beast together. That was more helpful than what was given in the box. All and all we would buy this again and other kidkraft products because the final result makes it all so worth it. Plan ahead when preparing to put this kidkraft majestic mansion together. Even if you are the smartest at things like this, it will take some hours, make sure you have a helper this is easier with a two person job one to hold the mansion and the other to install. We hope this review is helpful to others.  We received the item with in a few days way before Christmas. Merry Christmas and happy New Years 2019

title: Cheaply made

title: LOVE THIS BARBIE HOUSE!
text:
This is honestly the first review I have written for a product. We have had this dollhouse for almost 2 years and my girls (now ages 9 and 3) play with it everyday. Here are a few things we love about it:
1 - My two daughters and their friends have plenty of room for their Barbies. Each girl playing tends to make their own "bedroom" by using the sunroom, living room, bedroom, attic, etc.
2 - The furniture is still in great condition. They use the bed, couch and sunroom chair as beds everyday. The wood furniture is definitely better than plastic sets.
3 - The garage is fun to park Barbie scooters, snowboards, etc.

The only con is the elevator. It is difficult to move up and down; however, my girls just move their Barbies up and down each level without it.

Every adult that sees this Barbie house says it is amazing and all my girls' friends love playing with it as well. I guess the biggest reasons we love it so much is because it is sturdy, large enough for 4+ kids to play with it, and the furniture is well-made. Definitely worth the money!

title: Terrific Dollhouse
text: Directions could be better but I'm far from handy and still managed to figure out construction. There are helpful You Tube videos which show assembly as well. But most importantly my 5 year old absolutely loves it and can't stop playing with it. Love that it's wood and not plastic like all the Disney castles. Much bigger than it seems in the pictures.

title: Real Nice, great value...meant to be used.
text: Having read some of the reviews, I was on both sides of the fence as to what I expected.  We were really happy with it.  It assembled nicely, all the holes lined up well and the instructions were fine.  They have no words...only pictures but pretty easy to follow.  The assembly IS A PROJECT. It isn't called for in the instructions, but I'd highly reccomend using some simple carpenters glue throughout the assembly.  I glued just about every single thing that touched something else...in addition to the screws/fastners that came with it and I ended up with a house that's built like a tank.  Total assembly time from opening box to play time was about 5 hours or so.  Maybe a coffee break or two was in there....but it's still a job better done.  Two hands would help at a few points....but I managed fine solo.  It makes a BIG...REALLY BIG IMPRESSION.  It's so big that it's just a thing of amazement to my 2 year old.  It's as tall as my mother (she's starting to shrink a bit) so she thought it was funny that it was taller than her.  All in all it is a BIG hit....and a great value for the price.  The furniture pieces that come with it are beautiful....all wood and painted really nice.  Says it accomodates a 12" doll......which the ceiling height would allow.....but they'd look like giants based on the scale of the details and furniture.  Ideally you'd have dolls about 6-8"....but then again my daughter is using stuffed penguins and Yo Gabba Gabba charachters anyway!  GO FOR IT!

title: AMAZING Dollhouse
text:
First of all, this doll house is truely amazing. It is way better then we had expected. It is huge, and seems as though it will accomidate any type Barbie size doll. The furniture is really cool, and the detail of the doll house is better then any I have seen. It is well worth the money.

Building this doll house is a task. I have built many things from barns, to various housing projects and this house is a little intimidating when you open it. My suggestion, keep the picture from the box as a guide, check all the parts, keep the hardware in the packet, and use it as it calls for it (DONT just dump all the hardware in a bowl). The hardware is color coded to certain parts. Take a deep breath, take your time, and it will go together well. The directions are great, and your daughter (and her mother) will love this house!! Another great product from Kid Kraft.

title: Doll house loved by 4 and 6 year old daughters
text: We bought this doll house for our daughters, ages 4 and 6.  We and they couldn't be more happy with it!  We put it up in their bedroom, and ever since doing so, we've had many quiet mornings where they are busy at play and content to play with their dolls for some time before doing anything else.  It takes a good 1 1/2 to 2 hours to assemble, but it was fairly simple to understand.  Also wanted to say that Kid Kraft had extremely impressive customer service, we got a live voice right away when calling to report a few broken pieces.  They asked for our address, and said they'd have the parts delivered in about a week, and didn't ask us many questions at all.  We're definitely glad we chose this one; it may be a little more pricey than others, but you're still getting a lot of bang for your buck!

title: Fabulous!
text: I bought this for my grand daughters, ages 5&7, for Christmas.  It is fabulous!  They play with Monster High and Barbies, though currently Frozen dolls are favorites. All of them work well in the doll house.  It's  tall and wide enough that two children can play simultaneously, and sturdy enough that it won't  crumble.  Great construction, good directions too. It took all afternoon to assemble but the finished product is so worth it!  All their old doll houses were flimsy plastic that needed constant adjustment. They no longer play with them.  Very nice furniture, again it's strong enough to actually play with, and  includes enough pieces to consider the house furnished. The elevator and attic and garage are cute bonus rooms. Run away from the other character houses, this one has them beat, hands down!!

title: Amazon Stepped it up here

title: Really cute dollhouse, but the one we received had a manufacturing defect
text: We bought this for my 3 year old daughter's birthday, and she loves it.  It is really cute, and it is large enough that she can play with her Barbie dolls in it.  However, the one that we received did have a manufacturing defect.  A pre-constructed floor was glued together incorrectly and prevented a back panel from sliding in.  We were able to tack the back panel on, but it is not perfect.  If we had enough time before her birthday, I would have sent it back for another one.  Besides this defect, the dollhouse is great and a good deal.

title: Disappointing...
text: Ours had missing accessories. We contacted KidKraft and they were happy to send us the missing pieces. We were happy and excited to complete the dollhouse. To our disappointment, we were still missing pieces. They still didn‚Äôt send us what we were missing but sent us more duplicate items which were not needed. It‚Äôs not really that big of deal, just more annoyance than anything. Some of the levels are starting to sag, so that‚Äôs disappointing to say the least. For the price we paid, we expect it to last long and be sturdier.

title: My daughter loves it.

title: Well Crafted- Well worth it!
text: We bought this for our 5 and 3 year old girls for Christmas.  We almost bought the Barbie Dream town house.... So glad we didn't.  This house is so well crafted and sturdy!  It is a dollhouse that will last for years and years!  It does not make any noise or light up but those are the things that usually brake anyway!  It is huge!  More like a furniture item.  My girls can not reach the top floor at this point! The furniture pieces are all wood too!  The elevator works great too!  This is a great item that I would recommend to anyone!  We paid one hundred and thirty dollars for it and I would have paid more.  (Just lucked out on a cheap price) One thing to know is my husband is extremely handy and it took him about two and half hours to put together. The directions are great just time consuming! Love it!

title: Doll house loved by 4 and 6 year old daughters
text: We bought this doll house for our daughters, ages 4 and 6.  We and they couldn't be more happy with it!  We put it up in their bedroom, and ever since doing so, we've had many quiet mornings where they are busy at play and content to play with their dolls for some time before doing anything else.  It takes a good 1 1/2 to 2 hours to assemble, but it was fairly simple to understand.  Also wanted to say that Kid Kraft had extremely impressive customer service, we got a live voice right away when calling to report a few broken pieces.  They asked for our address, and said they'd have the parts delivered in about a week, and didn't ask us many questions at all.  We're definitely glad we chose this one; it may be a little more pricey than others, but you're still getting a lot of bang for your buck!

title: Very Disappointed
text: If you plan on giving this dollhouse as a gift the night before, don't buy this one. The instructions are not that easy to follow and the material is cheaply made. It doesn't tell you which side goes on which side or what colored screws go where. Very confusing. There were a few pieces that cracked while putting it together due to its un-sturdiness. Overall, my daughter will enjoy it for a while or until it breaks. Spend the extra money and buy the real Barbie Dream House.

title: Beautiful Large Dollhouse

You will need it to figure out the direction of the pieces.  But if you do that, it won't be too hard.  It is not awful to put together like the play kitchen.  Just time consuming.  It was worth it.  My little girl is 3.  She loves it.  This dollhouse is huge and it comes with so much furniture.  It is amazing.  Dolls of all sizes can be in it.  It's large enough for more than one child to play.  There were couple of pieces of furniture that were damaged.  So, i am going to call kidkraft to recieve replacements.  Other than that it looks amazing.  Wish i had a dollhouse like this growing up!

title: Love this dollhouse!
text:
First time buyer for KidKraft - my new favorite brand. With the exception of two bolt holes that had to be routed out a bit, this went together flawlessly. My husband, who is a perfectionist, is also quite impressed with the accuracy of the fittings. You just have to look carefully at the illustrated instructions and you will have no problem. We put it together early - it is a Christmas gift for our granddaughter (32 months by Christmas)-- just in case there was a problem with any of the parts. Not a single one. Greased up the elevator with Vaseline, works great. Didn't use wood glue or wood filler anywhere, everything fit perfectly. We'll do an update after she's played with it for a while, but overall we are extremely impressed. The furniture is to die for, big and sturdy. Barbies fit perfectly. Now need to get a Barbie car for that garage!
My only con is that I see it's $6 less this week than last week when we bought it, but oh well.

title: dreamhouse for barbies
text: we purchased this product since our daughter wanted a barbie dreamhouse from santa.  we didn't want to spend this kind of money on a plastic dollhouse and instead found the kidcraft majestic dollhouse.  it is awesome!  because it is so large you will need lots of playing space.  our daughter loves that it is taller than she is and that is has 4 floors!  we love that it is sturdy and realistic and the floor heights are such that she can play with all of her barbie and princess dolls.  we have even incorporated other barbie furniture that she received from christmas gifts into the dollhouse as well.  we would definitely recommend this dollhouse to others.  the only questionable item in terms of durability is the elevator which may just require a little WD40 to lubricate it.  otherwise we all love this dollhouse!  thanks for another great product, kidcraft!

title: Cute but quality lacking
text: This dollhouse is beautiful and huge. Some great accessories also came with. Does take awhile to put together but not a big deal really.  However,  the quality is somewhat lacking. The paper with the graphics printed on are peeling up in many many areas. Some panels are cut jagged. The floors of this doll house ARE NOT study so I expect them to break first. Had to find my own screws for the handles to the garage because they were too long. Also, one roof came with a hole that was filled in with putty because they drilled the hole in the wrong place. Also the screws underneath  the elevator hit the floor and scrape it up. Definitely NOT impressed.  We got a pirate playset from Kidcraft and that was a lot better quality. I will NEVER EVER buy from kidkraft again.

title: There needs to be 10 stars!
text:
My husband and I purchased this dollhouse for our 2 year old daughter who has been asking for a dollhouse for quite some time. I cannot tell you how impressed I am with this dollhouse. Here is why.

1. Very sturdy construction
2. Massive scale (will work with barbies)
3. Comes with 32 pieces of furniture that are of great quality (even better than expected)and adorable!
4. Fairly easy to assemble

so, overall I was floored with this dollhouse and how much my daughter will love seeing this Christmas morning.
I also have a few suggestions that may help you when putting it together.

1. DO NOT WAIT UNTIL CHRISTMAS NIGHT. Unless you want to be up until sun up.
2. Have 2 people. It took my husband and I both, just for holding and steadying purposes. Plus it was nice to have both of us screwing in the screws to save time.
3. Pay close attention to the directions. Use the picture on the box so you know which way is the floor and the ceiling on some steps because it wasn't too clear. The screws are painted so you can usually tell if your doing things right.
3. Take your time and have fun because when your done you will be soo impressed with how large and cute this dollhouse is.
I hope this review was helpful and just know the money is worth it because I could see this dollhouse staying with my daughter until she has a daughter!

title: Two years later and still in use and looking new.
text: I bought this 2 years ago for my daughter for Christmas. Not only was she so stoked to see a giant present for her Christmas morning, we set it up then wrapped it, but there is not a day when my husband and I don't hear "I'm going to go play in my room with my doll house." from our daughter. It is well built and study for easy moving once assembled, we moved it from the play area at the front of our house to our daughters room at the back of our house with great ease. It is light enough that a single person could move it by themselves but for the sake of taking corners and doorways I suggest 2 people. It comes with wall anchors and instructions on how to install them. The accessories and furniture are well made and sturdy also. My daughter does not have a barbie car, she uses an army tank and I have not asked her if or how well the tank fits in the garage. I would have to say the only flaw that it has is, the panel that makes up the wall between the bedroom and shower, one side is printed upside-down. We chose to make the shower be the one that is upside-down when we put it together and as far as I know our daughter hasn't noticed. My daughter loves it and I more then have gotten my money's worth and would highly recommend it to any one.

title: Great Value and Sturdy House
text:
We got this for my 3 year old twins for Christmas. They absolutely love it. They were awe-struck when they came down stairs Christmas morning to see the gigantic house that Santa had left for them. The first thing they did was go get their step stool so they could reach the top floor.

The house is very sturdy. We do not have it attached to the wall but they have stepped on it and pull it pretty good and it has not rocked.

As with other reviews the elevator is a bit tough to pull up but after some use it has loosened up and they really have no problem with it. I asked them if it was hard to pull and they said no, we just do it like this mommy.

Overall very impressed with the quality. The only downside to this house is that you should be prepared to spend a good amount of time building it. It took my husband about 2 hours to assemble. I unpacked all of the furniture and that alone took about a half hour because everything is individually wrapped and a few pieces need assembly.

Other than that our girls have already spent many hours playing with their new house. It was money well spent.

title: Wonderful Dollhouse
text:
My 7 year old granddaughter asked for a Barbie townhome for Christmas. I looked at them at Walmart and after reading some 300 reviews decided that the Barbie dollhouse was plastic and cheaply made. I researched the Kid Kraft dollhouses which were huge
all wood and came with 30 some pieces of wood furniture. I ordered it and the box was the size of our kitchen table. My son took the box home and set it up the day before Christmas. It took some time to assemble but he handled it with ease. The dollhouse is truly spectacular. You need a lot of room because it is so very large. It is probably the single best gift I have ever bought her.
I was amazed to see how well the Barbies all fit in the house and the furniture is all wood and of great quality. All her friends come over to play with her and
the Mansion. I ordered the Majestic Dollhouse but Amazon sent me the Majestic Mansion because they had run out of the one I ordered. When UPS delivered it the two men carried it into the house for me and my son picked it up for his home.
This is probably the best dollhouse I have ever seen. It is bright, beautiful and sturdy. My son read all the helpful hint reviews posted at Amazon and was able to assemble it in three hours. His only issue was that the instructions were all pictures. No written instructions. Without all the extremely helpful reviews and hints from people who had built their dollhouses previously, he could have run into assembly problems. But after reading all the helpful hints, it went together smoothly.
I have told everyone I know about this dollhouse because all our friends have granddaughters 7 and 8 years old. I am sure she will play with this dollhouse well into her teens. Great purchase.

text: This dollhouse was purchased as a Christmas gift for our 2 1/2 year old granddaughter.  It took several hours to assemble as the directions were not very clear.  Also, the back of the house did not line up as it should.  I should probably give less than five stars as we had difficulty with the assembly.  However, our granddaughter was so enchanted with the house, we forgot about the difficulties with assembly.  The house is perfect for a little one as she can reach all the items in the house (except the attic) and move easily with out knocking things down. The furniture, which comes with the house, if very sturdy.  The dollhouse is shallow which allows for her to easily maneuver throughout the house.  She currently is using bath toys and Minnie Mouse (which works fine for a little one) as the dollhouse 'people'.  I'm sure we will add the 'real' people as she gets older.  I see this dollhouse keeping her interest and allowing her to explore and imagine for several years.  The dollhouse is our favorite toy to play with when Gammy visits!

title: If you're looking for a "Barbie-sized" house, BUY THIS!
text: I first bought my daughter a Barbie Dream House, which she desperately wanted. When I started to put together said Dream House, I stopped counting at TEN broken pieces. (Cheap plastic) So, I was going to order another one and send back the broken one. Then I found this. This house is AMAZING! It's much bigger than the Barbie one, and much more sturdy! It took a few hours to get completely put together and set up, but totally worth it! This house fits Barbie-sized dolls perfectly. My daughter is 6 and she is about eye-level to the top floor. (She is probably a bit above average height for her age.) It is HUGE. She absolutely loves it. I would DEFINITELY recommend this sturdy, well-made house! It will last for years to come!

title: Great Dollhouse for any age
text: I purchased this dollhouse after weeks of research online for my 5 year old and 2 year old daughters for Christmas.  I was hesitate after reading some reviews about the size and that the house furniture might be to small for Barbies.  The dollhouse took my husband and I 3 hours to assemble.  The instructions were great and all the parts were labeled.  It comes with the tools to assemble except for screw driver of course.  It is very durable.  The furniture is completely assembled except for the piano and the bed and those are very simple.  The house fits my daughters barbie dolls and the furniture is the perfect size for a 12" doll.  They have played with it every hour possible since opening on Christmas day.  It is large so you will have to have an open area to place the house.  I do like the fact that you can put against the wall and play from the front.  There are wall anchors which I would suggest using if have any children 3 or younger.  My youngest has been caught trying to climb to 4th floor.  We keep a step stool next to it so they can reach.  I would suggest this dollhouse to anyone looking for something to last.  My daughter had wanted the Barbie Townhouse but with all the bad reviews I am so glad I got the Majestic Mansion instead.  It will last much longer and is not plastic.  The knob on the elvator came off after a couple of days but was fixed easily with wood glue.  My daughters will be able to use this dollhouse for many years as long as they are interested in dolls.  Great Buy!!!!

title: Cute and Sturdy
text: I don‚Äôt typically leave reviews, but felt compelled to for this doll house. My 3 year old daughter LOVES this new house, ( although she can‚Äôt reach the top levels yet because it is huge!) and was so excited to see it by the tree on Christmas morning. My husband put it together so I really can‚Äôt speak for the assembly, but it only took him a couple hours (and a few Busch Lights) to finish. It is very sturdy, yet light weight. It comes with furniture for each room, which is also well-made. I am so happy with this purchase and I know my daughter will enjoy it for many years to come. If in doubt, buy it! You won‚Äôt regret it.

title: Initial problems - but well worth it in the end
text: I bought this for my 4 year-old granddaughter and she loves it.  However, it took 6 hours for 2 people to put it together.  The first day my husband and I spent 3 hours working on it and the next day my son-in-law and I spent another 3 hours working on it.  Both my husband and my son-in-law are very handy people who do a lot of work around their respective homes.  The instructions are only in pictures, no words, to be appropriate for an international customer base and are sometimes difficult to interpret.  In the end there were some parts of the dollhouse that did not quite meet up and my son-in-law had to drill new holes; the original holes were off by about 1/8 of an inch.  Also, the staircase between the first and second floors did not fit well and kept falling out.  In the last 2 months my granddaughter broke a lot of the furniture and my husband has had to re-glue them back together.  My 18 month-old granddaughter also likes to play with it, especially when the older girl is in pre-school, so beware because the instructions warn about small parts that are not appropriate for children less than 3 years old.  After going through these initial difficulties we have a product that my granddaughter adores and she spends many happy hours playing with it - with her Barbie-type dolls. Would I buy it again?  Absolutely!

title: Buy it now!

title: The parts are marked for assembly which is convenient, ...
text: The parts are marked for assembly which is convenient, except for the parts where the labels have fallen off. The assembly instructions are a joke as they are in black and white. As such, it is difficult to orient the parts.....left, right, inside, outside?? It took me 5 hours and I need to do the furniture. There is a Youtube video that is very helpful just for the part orientation alone. Make sure the colored heads of the screws are in the right color panel. I must be getting old. We bought two KidKraft products for gifts......there will not be a third.

They don‚Äôt specify which direction to face the pieces so I had to redo parts of it often after finding out it was upside down. Other than that, it‚Äôs huge, it fits barbies, my 6 yr had a fantastic birthday. Not sure the house will make it to her 7th birthday.

title: Sturdy, Easy, cute
text:
The dollhouse was easy to assemble. It took me about 2.5 hours for most of it and an additional half hour on Christmas eve to do the last four bolts and anchor it to the wall. There are some small gaps at the roof line but overall goes together well. It's sturdy since my youngest has already scaled it to get to the top room and squeezed herself inside the second story without having anything come crashing down. It's cute with wooden pieces so I didn't have to scavenge around to town for bits and pieces to fill it in. It's big enough to minimize most sibling disputes too.

Warning though, this thing is huge, taller than my kids, and takes up a large chunk of the wall. It's been an incredible success. We've moved the nursery stuff down to the third floor so the little one can reach it with a step stool. The only down side to it are the stairs which never really snapped into place so the kids can take them off and pretend the dolls slide down to the first floor. I got this on sale for under $150 so for me it was a great deal ofr the enjoyment my kids are getting from it.

title: Worth the price.
text: Took a while to put together.  Instructions are so so.  But my daughter loves it.

title: Amazing!!
text: My husband was out of town so I had to assemble this myself (I don‚Äôt typically do assembly!). It took me a few hours because there‚Äôs a ton of parts. Fortunately, the instructions are excellent, the Parts are labeled clearly with numbers and the screws are colored to match the house, so you know if you are placing them in the correct spot. The house is amazing once complete and comes with a ton of fun accessories! Definitely worth it! My daughter loves it!

title: Happy daughter

title: If you‚Äôre a father, read this
text:
If I wrote this review during during the assembly process, I would‚Äôve gave this 2 stars. Not because of the quality of the product, just because.. well.. dammit.. everyone is right when it comes to time prep.. I got this for my daughter‚Äôs Christmas gift for 2019 (she‚Äôs 4 now). Let me tell you.. it‚Äôs going to take a few hours.. I did it by myself and it took about 8 hours with a few breaks. But damn... the look on her face on Xmas morning.. and being that she‚Äôs playing with it everyday.. not just she... we are playing with it everyday. Which is awesome.

Why we love it & why you should consider getting it:

1. If you‚Äôre going to get a kid a doll house, get them this. Yeah there‚Äôs the smaller lol type ones.. but those come and go and honestly.. are cheap made. My kid has lol dolls.. but her favorite is the Barbie sized Elsa and the other princess ones..this product was a match made in heaven.. it not only comes with a bunch of accessories, it allows EVERYONE (types of dolls) to play. And the part I love the most.. how interactive each room (especially the elevator) is. If anything, it also allows the parents to get creative.. I went to ikea and got some led smart lights for like $10... boom.. each room lights up with a press of a button. I got a recorder message box for $2 on Amazon.. boom.. doorbell that plays any type of tune my daughter wants... except the ‚ÄúGET OUUUUTT‚Äù voice that the house in Adams family makes.. right now it‚Äôs that Elsa song from frozen 2.

2. This thing is good in quality.. just make sure you literally tighten everything.. and check it 9 times as you continue to assemble. My daughter gets a little crazy with her dolls in the house at times.. and it‚Äôs holding well.

3. Go big or go home guys. Yes this thing is massive, but like most of the people on here say, it‚Äôs worth it.. her room is 10X11 and tbh, it‚Äôs a great GREAT accent to it.

Best money spent.

Tips:

Youtube.. there‚Äôs this Asian couple who filmed their entire process of assembling the dollhouse.. whoever you two are.. thank you lol. Directions in all honesty are clear.. it just challenges you to be at your best when it comes to practical assembly. For me, everything was in the package, and labeled correctly.. the instructions assume that you have practical thinking..while I will say the instructions are just pictures.. and yes I had to re assemble some parts..but looking back at it.. I build (assembled) and epic doll house. You know that feeling once you assemble ikea furniture? You cuss while doing it, but you‚Äôre stoked once it‚Äôs done? Same thing.

title: This KidKraft dollhouse ruined Christmas :(
text: We bought this dollhouse for Christmas for my 3 1/2 year old daughter. I absolutely love this dollhouse and read the reviews online before purchasing it. I wanted an alternative to the Barbie Dreamhouse and loved all the furniture and that the dollhouse is wooden. Well, today is Christmas Eve. We sent all 3 of our kids to Grandma's so we could put it together. My husband and I worked for hours to put it together, but something was wrong with the holes - they weren't lining up right. We were not able to put it together. Not only are we terribly frustrated that we wasted hours of our Christmas Eve working on it - but the worst part is that this was the main present for our daughter. Our daughter has been talking about Christmas for months and she wanted a "Barbie Dreamhouse." By the time we realized that there was no possible way to get this put together, everything was closed. I've been thinking about giving her this dollhouse for weeks. I don't even think we can send it back b/c it is half put together. It would take us another hour to take it apart. I do think it was going to be the coolest dollhouse ever....but the machining just wasn't right and my husband is very good at putting things together...there was no way to make it work.

title: Very impressed!
text: I never, ever write product reviews but I felt I had to for this dollhouse. We bought it for my daughter's third birthday and she absolutely loves it. It does take awhile to put together, but we were expecting it to given its size. For the price, we were very impressed- it is well-made and comes with a ton of really cute furniture (would easily cost over $100 if you bought it separately given how expensive dollhouse accessories are). One thing I want to mention is that when the dollhouse arrived, two of the pieces of furniture were broken. If you look inside the instruction manual, there is a page describing what to do if you experience any problems.  I called the number for KidKraft and someone picked up immediately- provided them with a batch number, the item numbers for the broken pieces and a name and address and they are sending replacements via FedEx today....no problems, no questions asked. Why can't every company respond this way?!?!? Will definitely buy from KidKraft again and know my daughter will enjoy this dollhouse for years.

title: Beautiful dollhouse! We got this for our 3
text:
Beautiful dollhouse! We got this for our 3.5 year old for Christmas this year and we are pleased with the purchase. It is tall, she can't reach the top floor, but she doesn't mind. Her Barbies fit well inside and can stand in the elevator. We don't have a car for the garage, but my 20 lb 19 month old managed to fit herself inside the garage...that was a sight to see!

It did take us 3.5 hours to put together and you have to make sure you are attaching the pieces in the correct direction. We had to undo and correct a few of the pieces.

So happy we will get many years of play with this between my two girls!

title: The house was great, huge but great
text: The house was great, huge but great! This was a "Santa" gift so I left it in the box until that night thinking another pretty box of the item was within the ugly shipping cardboard. I was so wrong! I ended up having to put this thing together at 11pm! It's completely in pieces and even some of the furniture needs to be put together. Ended up waking my husband up and he put it together in about 3 hours with little to no confusion. I have no idea what the tool is called but, the little L shaped bar they send you to assemble with the hexagon tip?.. I suggest getting an actual tip to go on an interchangeable screwdriver, drill ect.. there is so much screwing together that this little tool was hell to hold onto. The price is amazing for this house. I didn't give it a 5 star because the slate piece that pops in to make a divider from the bedroom to the bathroom did not stay in the slot. It falls with play so I need to secure it somehow. Also be very aware of the screw colors!! They have colors to match different parts of the house. It does not tell you that in instructions! Worth the labor. Most people give poor ratings because they had to put in some work which is ridiculous. Love love love this house and my daughter constantly plays on it!

title: Missing a set of furnitures
text:
Spent an hour putting the doll house together for my daughter's birthday, only to find out I am missing one of the box of furnitures. Seems like I have an extra set of furnitures in box labeled "A", with one of them being defective and damaged.
I have two bathtubs, with one shattered, and two beds. Missing the entire set in box "B", which should have the refrigerater the two dining sets, baby furnitures etc.
It was awful since we had to give it to our daughter with all this parts missing on her birthday.
The whole thing is really heavy and time consuming to be taking down and packing up again to ship it back for returns.

I wish they did better quality control when packaging these things to make sure all parts are included.
Be wary when ordering this that you may have missing pieces and allow extra time for corrections.

If possible, I would be very happy with the replacement of the furniture set only.

title: Best Dollhouse EVER :)
text:
We've had this dollhouse for 7 full months now and it gets payed with EVERY day. Within 2 months my 2 year old thought she would climb the stairs and cracked them (but they were still playable). I went to KidKraft's website to see how much it would be to replace them. I thought I would get an email with estimates...instead the stairs just showed up at my door a few days later - along with the wooden cake that was included with the furniture set - WE lost it (it was a family favorite) and I wanted to order another so I included it in my inquiry on their website.

Bottom line: The dollhouse is FANTASTIC. My 4 and 2 year olds play with their barbies, princesses, little baby dolls, minnie mouse figurines...you name it and it goes in the dollhouse. It's big enough that they don't fight for positions in front of it either! Between their love of the thing and the absolutely fabulous customer service offered by KidKraft, this was one of the best purchases I have ever made!

title: My Villain origin story
text:
It was a day before my daughters birthday. A simple task to build this ‚Äú supposed‚Äú easy build. Didn‚Äôt think much of it and assumed that it would take a hour at most. But for the community of Cadence Henderson it would almost become the last night of peace.

It started the moment the Box was opened. Parts were in a mess that rivaled my local Wal mart. The instructions were as complicated as diffusing a nuclear bomb. Pieces that were supposed to have pre-drilled holes were in the wrong place that made you question your man hood. At one point when you think you could be like the great American War hero Angus`Mac' MacGyver, you was slapped across the face with despair and loneliness, because nothing was making sense while building this monstrosity. I will be reaching out to a lawyer because of the massive side effects this thing has on a person. You also gain the gift of tongues to swear in languages you never have learned. My sanity, my marriage, my fatherhood was all put on the line.

Just when I thought I was about to quit a hero emerged from YouTube with the title labeled ‚ÄúHow To Build KidKraft Majestic Mansion
Dollhouse: Step-by-Step Assembly Instructions.‚Äù Listen to her and follow her keen instructions. If it wasn‚Äôt for her I would have thrown this $135 Pandora‚Äòs box into the depths of the Pacific Ocean. After I am done with his review, I will be calling the Vatican to make sure this lady gets her shang hood and capitol Hill for her to get a civilian medal of honor or something equivalent.

Trying to rate this on if it is worth, it is like rating your levels of failures in life. But all in all it is worth it because my daughter loves this stupid house. The quality of parts is horrendous, the instructions was miserable, but the final product came out well. If I were to build this again, I would a hire a NASA engineer to build it.

So I did (as the picture and reviews show), but I was so surprised when it arrived and  had several parts broken, I called KidKraft Majestic and they were prompt and very courteous and sent me the pieces right away, but it dawned on me if this "cardboard" house does not last shipment: how long will it really last my daughter?, obviously it would not last for generations to come. Oh well, the price was good but the material ... trust me !,it is not that good, I was under the impression it was wood, not cardboard, the shipment said it was 63 lbs, but I was surprised when the thing didn't weight that much, oh well... lesson learned over here!, next time I will just build my own doll house from real wood.

Overall the assembly fiasco was well worth as my daughter loved it. Furniture it came with as good quality and cute. House is big enough for Barbie size dolls. Due to the way the garage side of the house is attached it's best to find a spot and leave the house there. Overall satisfied with the purchase.

Some of the stickers designs are peeling off the wood in some places. I had to keep referring to the picture from amazon to better understand the placement of each piece as I read the instructions.
